name: zucchini
trans: n. 夏季产的一种南瓜

name: zoom
trans: n. 嗡嗡声；急速上升；变焦摄影
vi. 急速上升；摄象机移动

detailed_translations.chinese: 急速上升；嗡嗡声；[摄] 变焦摄影
detailed_translations.english: a sound made by a vehicle that is travelling fast

name: zoology
trans: n. 动物学；动物区系

sentences.english: The scholarship money she won helped her attend Cornell University, where she majored in zoology.
sentences.chinese: 她赢得的奖学金帮助她上康奈尔大学，在那里他主修动物学。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of animals and their behaviour

name: zigzag
trans: adj. 锯齿形的；曲折的；之字形的
vt. 使成之字形；使曲折行进

sentences.english: Some species weave designs into their webs, creating zigzag patterns that can either attract prey, like bees, in bright sunlight, or camouflage the net in the shade.
sentences.chinese: 一些种类的蜘蛛能设计织网，设计出可以在明媚的阳光下吸引猎物，如蜜蜂，或在阴暗处能掩饰蜘蛛网的之字形图案。

sentences.english: Located at 4210 Silver Hill Road just outside of Washington, D.C., the museum is a massive zigzag-shaped edifice constructed of five interconnected pods—each pod larger than a football field.
sentences.chinese: 这座博物馆位于华盛顿特区郊外的银山路4210号，建得宏伟壮观，五个相互连通的分区组成之字形，每个分区的面积比足球场还大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 曲折的；锯齿形的；之字形的
使成之字形；使曲折行进
detailed_translations.english: to move forward in sharp angles, first to the left and then to the right etc
a pattern that looks like a line of z’s joined together

detailed_translations.chinese: 曲折地；之字形地；Z字形地
detailed_translations.english: to move forward in sharp angles, first to the left and then to the right etc

name: zesty
trans: adj. 兴致很高的
vt. 给…增兴趣

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴致很高的， 热望的

name: zenith
trans: n. 顶点；最高点；顶峰

sentences.english: Obama will be the zenith of black America for as long as he lives.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马毕其一生都将成为美国黑人运动成就的顶点。

detailed_translations.english: the most successful point in the development of something

name: zeal
trans: n. 热心；热诚；热情

sentences.english: ...his zeal for teaching.
sentences.chinese: …他对教学的热衷。

detailed_translations.english: eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim

name: yikes
trans: int. 呀（表示惊讶）

name: yield
trans: vt. 出产；屈服；放弃
vi. 屈服，投降

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

name: yeast
trans: n. 酵母；酵母菌
v. 发酵；起泡沫

sentences.english: Flour, , milk, butter and yeast are some ingredients in bread.
sentences.chinese: 面粉、牛奶、黄油和酵母是做面包的一些原料。

sentences.english: However in another book I found a graph showing yeast cell population growth and specific gravity plotted against time .
sentences.chinese: 然而，在另一本书，我发现一个图表显示人口增长与酵母细胞比重密谋对付时间。

detailed_translations.english: a type of fungus used for producing alcohol in beer and wine, and for making bread rise

name: yank
trans: vi. 猛地一拉
vt. 猛拉

sentences.english: She yanked open the drawer.
sentences.chinese: 她猛地拉开了抽屉。

sentences.english: Grabbing his ponytail, Shirley gave it a yank.
sentences.chinese: 雪莉抓住他的马尾辫猛地一拉。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly pull something quickly and with force
Yank is also a noun

name: Yangtze River
trans: 长江

name: yam
trans: n. 甘薯；薯蓣

sentences.english: And we went into the poisonous giant tubers, like the yam and the taro, which also had to be leeched, ground up and cooked before we could eat them.
sentences.chinese: 我们也寻找到了那些带有毒性的、个头颇大的块茎，像山药、芋头，这些在食用之前得经过榨取、提炼和烹饪。

detailed_translations.english: a tropical climbing plant grown for its root, which is eaten as a vegetable

name: yacht
trans: n. 快艇, 帆船, 游艇

sentences.english: His 36 ft yacht sank suddenly last summer.
sentences.chinese: 他的36英尺游艇去年夏天突然沉没了。

detailed_translations.english: a large boat with a sail, used for pleasure or sport, especially one that has a place where you can sleep

name: writhe
trans: vi. 蠕动；翻滚
vt. 扭曲；扭动

sentences.english: His family could only cry and watch this expert marksman twist and writhe in his death agonies.
sentences.chinese: 他的家人只能嚎啕大哭，眼睁睁地看着这个出色的神枪手在扭曲翻滚中痛苦地死去。

name: wrestling
trans: n. 摔跤

sentences.english: ...a championship wrestling match.
sentences.chinese: …一项摔跤锦标赛。

detailed_translations.english: a sport in which two people fight by holding each other and trying to make each other fall to the ground

detailed_translations.chinese: 摔跤；格斗（wrestle的ing形式）；与…摔跤；使劲移动

name: wrestle
trans: n. 摔跤；斗争；搏斗
vi. 斗争；摔跤；斟酌

sentences.english: They run races; they wrestle; and sometimes they have mock fights together.
sentences.chinese: 蚂蚁参加各种赛跑，摔跤，有时还在一起模拟战斗。

detailed_translations.english: to fight someone by holding them and pulling or pushing them

name: wrath
trans: n. 愤怒；激怒

sentences.english: He was scared of incurring his father’s wrath .
sentences.chinese: 他害怕惹他父亲大发脾气。

detailed_translations.english: extreme anger

name: wrap-up
trans: n. 综合报导,简讯

name: wort
trans: n. 草；植物；麦芽汁

name: workaround
trans: n. 工作区

name: wonderment
trans: n. 惊奇,惊叹

name: womb
trans: n. 子宫；发源地
vt. 容纳

sentences.english: ...the development of the fetus in the womb.
sentences.chinese: …胎儿在子宫里的发育。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a woman’s or female animal’s body where her baby grows before it is born

name: wolfberry
trans: n. 薄叶西方雪果

name: witty
trans: adj. 诙谐的；富于机智的

sentences.english: His plays were very good, very witty.
sentences.chinese: 他的那些剧作非常好，非常诙谐。

detailed_translations.english: Someone or something that is witty is amusing in a clever way

name: withhold
trans: vt. 保留，不给；抑制；隐瞒
vi. 忍住；克制

sentences.english: I withheld payment until they had completed the work.
sentences.chinese: 我扣着钱，直到他们完工。

sentences.english: Ian was accused of withholding vital information from the police.
sentences.chinese: 伊恩被控向警方隐瞒重要信息。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to give someone something

name: withered
trans: adj. 凋谢了的；憔悴的；枯萎的；尽是皱纹的
v. 干枯；减弱；羞愧（wither的过去分词）

trans: vt. 使凋谢；使畏缩；使衰弱
vi. 枯萎；凋谢；衰弱

sentences.english: The flowers in Isabel's room had withered.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎贝尔房间里的花朵已经枯萎了。

detailed_translations.english: if plants wither, they become drier and smaller and start to die

name: withdrawal
trans: n. 撤退；退回；取消

sentences.english: large-scale troop withdrawals
sentences.chinese: 大规模撤军

detailed_translations.chinese: 撤退，收回；提款；取消；退股
detailed_translations.english: the act of moving an army, weapons etc away from the area where they were fighting

name: witch
trans: n. 巫婆，女巫
vt. 迷惑；施巫术

sentences.english: She was swindled out of ￡ 1,000 by a witch.
sentences.chinese: 她被一个女巫骗了一千英镑。

sentences.english: The old witch said she could raise the dead.
sentences.chinese: 老巫婆说她能起死回生。

sentences.english: A witch was supposed to take the shape of a cat.
sentences.chinese: 据说女巫会化为猫的形状。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is supposed to have magic powers, especially to do bad things

name: wireway
trans: n. 电线管道；电缆；金属线导管

name: wintry
trans: adj. 寒冷的，冬天的；冷淡的

sentences.english: a wintry day
sentences.chinese: 一个冬日

sentences.english: wintry showers
sentences.chinese: 冬季的阵雪

detailed_translations.english: cold or typical of winter

name: wink
trans: vi. 闪烁；眨眼；使眼色
n. 眨眼；瞬间；使眼色；闪烁

sentences.english: He winked an eye at his companion.
sentences.chinese: 他朝同伴眨眨眼。

a quick action of opening and closing one eye, usually as a signal to someone else

name: windfall
trans: n. 被风吹落的果子；意外的收获；意外之财

sentences.chinese: 他彩票中奖得来的200万英镑意外之财

detailed_translations.chinese: 意外之财；被风吹落的果子；意外的收获
detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you get unexpectedly

name: winch
trans: n. 卷扬机,绞车,辘轳
vt. 用卷扬机移动…

name: willow
trans: n. 柳木制品；柳树
adj. 柳木制的

sentences.english: The willow trees cast their shadows all around.
sentences.chinese: 柳荫匝地。

sentences.english: He worships that big willow south of the house.
sentences.chinese: 他很崇拜房子南面的那颗大柳树。

sentences.english: He has also captured pollen from alder, pine and willow.
sentences.chinese: 他还从桤树、松树和柳树上捕捉到了花粉。

name: willies
trans: n. 焦虑不安；心惊肉跳；小鸡鸡（儿童用语，willy的复数）

name: wilderness
trans: n. 荒野;沙漠 (政治家)在野；不再当政(或掌权)

sentences.chinese: …冰封的加拿大荒野。

detailed_translations.english: A wilderness is a desert or other area of natural land which is not used by people

name: wiggle
trans: vi. 使……摆动，使……扭动
vt. 摆动

sentences.english: Henry wiggled his toes.
sentences.chinese: 亨利扭动他的脚趾。

sentences.english: ...a wiggle of the hips.
sentences.chinese: …臀部的扭动。

trans: n. 假发；要人；[俚]头脑
vt. 使戴假发；斥责

sentences.chinese: 乔带着一头长长的假发，使她看起来很性感。

detailed_translations.english: artificial hair that you wear on your head

name: wield
trans: vt. 挥舞；使用；行使

sentences.english: The Church wields immense power in Ireland.
sentences.chinese: 在爱尔兰，教会操纵着大权。

detailed_translations.english: to have a lot of power or influence, and to use it

name: wickedness
trans: n. 邪恶

name: wicked
trans: adj. 邪恶的；顽皮的；恶劣的；不道德的

sentences.english: the wicked stepmother in ‘Hansel and Gretel’
sentences.chinese: 《糖果屋》中那个恶毒的继母

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is morally wrong

name: wick
trans: n. 灯芯，蜡烛心
vt. 依靠毛细作用带走

detailed_translations.english: the piece of thread in a candle, that burns when you light it

name: whoosh
trans: v. 飞快地移动

name: whoop
trans: n. 大叫；哮喘声；呐喊；一点点
vt. 高声说；唤起

sentences.english: Scattered groans and whoops broke out in the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 人群中发出零星的懊恼声和欢呼声。

detailed_translations.english: Whoop is also a noun

name: wholesome
trans: adj. 有益健康的；合乎卫生的

sentences.english: good wholesome fun
sentences.chinese: 健康有益的娱乐

detailed_translations.chinese: 健全的；有益健康的；合乎卫生的；审慎的
detailed_translations.english: likely to make you healthy

name: wholesaler
trans: n. 批发商

sentences.english: Under state law, bar owners must buy their liquor from wholesalers.
sentences.chinese: 依照州法律，酒吧经营者们必须从批发商们那儿购买酒。

detailed_translations.english: a person or company who sells goods wholesale

name: whiz
trans: n. 飕飕声；奇才
vi. 飕飕作声

name: whiskey
trans: n. 威士忌酒
adj. 威士忌酒的

sentences.english: ...a tumbler with about an inch of whiskey in it.
sentences.chinese: …一个装了大约一英寸高的威士忌酒的大玻璃杯。

detailed_translations.english: Whiskey is a strong alcoholic drink made, especially in the United States and Ireland, from grain such as barley or rye

name: whipped
trans: adj. 受到鞭打的
v. 鞭打；挥动（whip的过去分词）

name: whip
trans: vt. 抽打；煽动；搅打（蛋，奶油）；[口]彻底击败
n. 鞭子；抽打；车夫；搅拌器

sentences.english: He whipped the horse into a canter.
sentences.chinese: 他抽了一下鞭子，马儿就小跑起来。

sentences.english: The coachman cracked his whip and the carriage lurched forward.
sentences.chinese: 马车夫甩了一记响鞭，马车猛然向前冲去。

detailed_translations.english: to hit someone or something with a whip
a long thin piece of rope or leather with a handle, that you hit animals with to make them move or that you hit someone with to punish them

name: whine
trans: n. 闹声；抱怨；牢骚
v. 哭诉；发牢骚

sentences.english: Oh Charlotte, please stop whining.
sentences.chinese: 哎呀，夏洛特，请你别再抱怨了。

sentences.english: ...the whine of air-raid sirens.
sentences.chinese: …空袭警报的尖叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发牢骚；哭诉；嘎嘎响；发呜呜声
detailed_translations.english: if a machine whines, it makes a continuous high sound
Whine is also a noun

name: whimsical
trans: adj. 异想天开的,闹着玩的;反复无常的

sentences.english: He has a wonderful whimsical sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 他怪异的幽默感令人惊叹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的；异想天开的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: unusual or strange and often amusing

name: whilst
trans: conj. 当…的时候；时时，有时；同时

sentences.english: As you lower your pen whilst continuing the motion, you should notice the resulting shape is more regular than it otherwise would have been.
sentences.chinese: 随着你降低你的笔，同时保持圆周运动，你应该会注意到画出的形状比起不这样做画出的形状要规范的多。

sentences.english: Indeed, it is important to keep fit and healthy, whilst we all aspire to improve the way we look and feel in order to make good first and lasting impressions.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，为了得到一个良好的初次印象和持续印象，在保持体形和健康的同时，我们也渴望提高自己看待和感受他人的方式。

sentences.english: Modules participate in a dynamic life cycle which includes the ability to add, update and remove modules at runtime, whilst preserving the state in the system.
sentences.chinese: 模块参与到动态的生命周期里，这个动态的生命周期能够在运行时添加、更新、删除模块，同时保留系统中的状态。

name: whichever
trans: adj. 无论哪个；无论哪些
pron. 无论哪个

sentences.english: Letting taxes rise abruptly would hurt not only the recovery but also whichever party the electorate ended up blaming.
sentences.chinese: 突然的增税不但会妨害经济复苏，而且无论哪个政党这样做都会受到选民指责。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无论哪个， 无论哪些

name: whereby
trans: adv. 凭什么；靠那个

sentences.english: a proposal whereby EU citizens would be allowed to reside anywhere in the EU
sentences.chinese: 允许欧盟公民在欧盟任何地方居住的一项提议

detailed_translations.english: by means of which or according to which

name: whereas
trans: conj. 但是, 而

sentences.chinese: 旧系统相当复杂，而新系统却很简单。

sentences.english: Whereas the city spent over $1 billion on its museums and stadium, it failed to look after its schools.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市花了十亿美元建造博物馆和体育馆，但是却忽略了对学校的建设。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that although something is true of one thing, it is not true of another

name: whereabouts
trans: adv. 在什么地方, 靠近什么地方
n. 下落, 去向

sentences.english: He showed great reluctance to reveal his whereabouts.
sentences.chinese: 他极不愿意说出他的行踪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下落；行踪；去向；所在之处
detailed_translations.english: the place or area where someone or something is

name: wheat
trans: n. 小麦；小麦色

sentences.english: a field of wheat
sentences.chinese: 小麦地

detailed_translations.english: the grain that bread is made from, or the plant that it grows on

name: whatsoever
trans: pron. 无论什么

sentences.english: But there should be no Christmas for me, I knew, no gifts, no remembrance whatsoever.
sentences.chinese: 但我知道，对我来说，将没有圣诞节可言，没有礼物，没有怀念，什么都没有。

name: westbound
trans: adj. 向西行的

name: wellhead
trans: n. 泉源；水源

name: weirdo
trans: n. 古怪的人，奇怪的人

name: weird
trans: adj. 怪异的；不可思议的；超自然的
n. （苏格兰）命运；预言

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: weigh
trans: vt. 权衡；考虑；称…重量
vi. 重量为…；具有重要性；成为…的重荷；起锚

sentences.english: The young birds weigh only a few grams.
sentences.chinese: 雏鸟重量只有几克。

sentences.english: Do you know how much it weighs?
sentences.chinese: 你知道它的重量吗？

sentences.english: (= how much ) do you weigh?
sentences.chinese: 你的体重是多少？

sentences.english: The box was full of books and weighed a ton (= was very heavy ).
sentences.chinese: 这箱子里放满了书，重得很。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular weight

name: weathered
trans: adj. 饱经风霜的；被风化的

name: weary
trans: adj. 疲倦的；厌烦的；令人厌烦的
vi. 厌烦；疲倦

sentences.english: She found Rachel in the kitchen, looking old and weary.
sentences.chinese: 她发现雷切尔在厨房里，看上去苍老而疲惫。

sentences.english: She sat down with a weary sigh.
sentences.chinese: 她疲倦地叹口气坐了下来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疲倦的；厌烦的；令人厌烦的
detailed_translations.english: very tired or bored, especially because you have been doing something for a long time
to become very tired, or make someone very tired

name: wavelength
trans: n. 波长 具有相同的
不同的思路；合拍；不合拍；与… 所见略同
不同

sentences.english: Sunlight consists of different wavelengths of radiation.
sentences.chinese: 阳光由波长不同的射线组成。

detailed_translations.english: the size of a radio wave used to broadcast a radio signal

name: watery
trans: adj. 水的；淡的；湿的；松软的；有雨意的

sentences.english: Her eyes were red and watery from crying.
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛哭得红红的，眼里含满泪水。

sentences.english: Snakes lay eggs in a watery environment.
sentences.chinese: 蛇在潮湿的环境里产卵。

name: underneath
trans: adv. 在下面

sentences.chinese: …莉齐艺术收藏品中一些杰作的幻灯片。

sentences.chinese: 新的暴力威胁实际上已经破坏了和平谈判。

sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.english: The tornado disrupted broadcasting along the entire coast.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.chinese: 这次旅途对他们来说一定十分痛苦。

sentences.chinese: 砷在当时以福勒氏溶液（亚砷酸钾溶液）的形式被广泛使用：该溶液被作为一种医治百病的药剂——从风湿病到梅毒——奥斯汀在信中曾抱怨过此事。

trans: vt. & vi. (为要求赔偿损失而)起诉, 控告, 和…打官司

sentences.english: If the builders don’t fulfil their side of the contract, we’ll sue.
sentences.chinese: 如果建筑商不履行合同，我们就要提出起诉。

sentences.english: The company is suing a former employee.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正在起诉一名前雇员。

sentences.english: The railway may sue for damages (= in order to get money ) because of loss of revenue.
sentences.chinese: 铁道部门可能会因收入损失而提出起诉，要求赔偿。

sentences.chinese: 他的妻子对他提出起诉，要求离婚。

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sue)人名；(日)末(名)；(法)休；(英)休(女子教名Susan、Susanna的昵称)

name: suction
trans: n. 抽吸；吸力；吸

sentences.english: My vacuum cleaner has very good suction.
sentences.chinese: 我的真空吸尘器吸力很强。

sentences.english: a suction pump
sentences.chinese: 抽吸泵

detailed_translations.english: the process of removing air or liquid from an enclosed space so that another substance is sucked in, or so that two surfaces stick together

name: succumb
trans: vi. 屈服；被压垮；死

sentences.chinese: 不要屈服于只抽一支烟的诱惑。

sentences.chinese: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it

trans: adj. 破坏性的；从事颠覆的
n. 危险分子；颠覆分子

sentences.chinese: 他参与了颠覆活动。

someone who secretly tries to damage or destroy the government or an established system

name: subtle
trans: adj. 微妙的；敏感的；狡猾的；精细的；稀薄的

name: substation
trans: n. 分局；分台；变电所

trans: adj. 独立的；真实的；持久的；本质的；名词性的；大量的；规定义务与责任的；实质的
n. 作名词用的词或词组

sentences.chinese: 他们计划很快在罗马再次会面以开始实质性的谈判。

detailed_translations.chinese: 名词性实词；独立存在的实体
detailed_translations.english: a noun

trans: vt. 用事实支持(某主张、说法等);证明, 证实

sentences.chinese: 卡曾拿不出什么证据来证明他的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc

name: substantial
trans: adj. 大量的；坚固的；实质的；可观的
n. 本质；重要部份

sentences.english: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
sentences.chinese: 我们有相当多家长的支持。

sentences.english: a substantial salary
sentences.chinese: 丰厚的薪水

sentences.english: a substantial breakfast
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的早餐

sentences.chinese: 文件需要作大量修改。

detailed_translations.english: large in amount or number

sentences.chinese: 欧洲的农场主们正在策划一场反对削减农场补贴的大游行。

trans: vt. 给与补助金或奖助金；贿赂

sentences.chinese: 农业得到政府的大量补贴。

detailed_translations.chinese: 资助；给与奖助金；向…行贿
detailed_translations.english: if a government or organization subsidizes a company, activity etc, it pays part of its costs

trans: adj. 随后的, 继…之后的

trans: n. 次要情节；陪衬情节

trans: adj. 未达最佳标准的,不最理想的,不最适宜的,不最满意的

trans: adj. 顺从的, 唯命是从的

detailed_translations.english: growing or used under the sea

detailed_translations.chinese: [生理] 阈下的；潜在意识的；微小得难以察觉的

name: subdivision
trans: n. 细分,一部

sentences.chinese: 月份是年的常规分支。

detailed_translations.english: when something is subdivided, or the parts that result from doing this

name: subassembly
trans: n. 部件,组件

trans: n. 设计师；文体学家

name: stylish
trans: adj. 时髦的；潇洒的；现代风格的

sentences.chinese: 一名40多岁的时髦女子

sentences.english: Jack is quite stylish.
sentences.chinese: 杰克很时髦。

sentences.chinese: 位于伦敦西区的一家有格调的饭店

sentences.english: She was 55 and still a stunning woman.
sentences.chinese: 她55岁，仍是个极美的女人。

trans: v. 绊倒；绊脚；出岔子，出差错，过失；（不顺畅地）说，读，演奏；跌跌撞撞地走；蹒跚而行；使…困惑

种马的；为配种而饲养的

sentences.chinese: 严格的防噪音条例

sentences.chinese: 他大步向她走去。

trans: n. 走失的家畜；浪子

sentences.chinese: 这将会减少流浪狗在这一区域的数量。

sentences.chinese: 至于她个人的安全，她说她并没有过度担心，但是她的确在考虑一个流浪疯子可以做些什么。

sentences.english: Then let's say you get into horrible, disastrous debt and have to go begging to the government, like a sad little stray.
sentences.chinese: 另外，比如说，你陷入了讨厌的、损失惨重的债务，而且必须像一个可怜的小流浪儿一样向政府祈求。

name: stratification

sentences.chinese: 印度的种姓制度是社会阶层化的一个例子。

detailed_translations.english: when society is divided into separate social classes

name: strategy

sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

name: strangle
trans: vt. 把…勒死；使…窒息

sentences.chinese: 他试图扼死一位边防警察并偷走他的枪。

sentences.chinese: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.chinese: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

name: strait
trans: n. 海峡；困境
adj. 困难的；窘迫的；狭窄的；严格的

sentences.english: the Bering Strait
sentences.chinese: 白令海峡

detailed_translations.english: a narrow passage of water between two areas of land, usually connecting two seas

name: strain

name: straightforward

sentences.english: In this example, we will use the most straightforward method of all -- writing our object reference to a file that will be picked up by our client.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，我们将使用所有方法中最直截了当的一种 — 将对象引用写入一个文件，该 文件将由客户机选取。

name: strabismus

name: stow

sentences.chinese: 卢克把他的相机袋收到旅行箱里。

name: storyline
trans: n. 故事情节

sentences.chinese: 故事情节的曲折离奇是这部电影的精彩之处。

name: stoplight

name: stool

sentences.english: a bar stool

detailed_translations.english: a seat that has three or four legs, but no back or arms

v. 安慰；减轻痛苦（soothe的现在分词）

sentences.english: No one else leant over her, and whispered soothing words to her, or was near enough to hear the flutter of her beating heart.
sentences.chinese: 没有其他任何人向她弯下身去，低声地对她说些安慰的话，或跟她挨得很近，可以听到她颤动的心房正在怦怦地跳动。

sentences.english: He offered soothing words about the value of the French model in the recession and its ability to protect the most vulnerable from poverty.
sentences.chinese: 对于衰退中法兰西模式的价值，以及保护绝大多数易受伤害的贫困人口的能力，他给予了安慰。

name: soothe
trans: vt. 安慰；使平静；缓和
vi. 起抚慰作用

sentences.english: Lucy soothed the baby by rocking it in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 露西把宝宝抱在怀里摇晃着，让他安静下来。

sentences.english: She made a cup of tea to soothe her nerves.
sentences.chinese: 她泡了杯茶让自己平静下来。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry

name: sonorous
trans: adj. 响亮的；作响的；能发出响亮声音的

sentences.english: a sonorous voice
sentences.chinese: 洪亮的嗓音

detailed_translations.chinese: 响亮的；作响的；能发出响亮声音的
detailed_translations.english: having a pleasantly deep loud sound

name: Somnus
trans: n. [罗神]索莫纳斯（睡眠之神）

name: somewhat
trans: n. 几分；某物
adv. 多少；几分；稍微；有点

sentences.english: Things have changed somewhat since then.
sentences.chinese: 从那时候起，情况就有些不一样了。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little but not very

name: somehow
trans: adv. 莫名其妙地；以某种方法

sentences.english: Don’t worry, we’ll get the money back somehow.
sentences.chinese: 别担心，我们总会把那些钱拿回来的。

sentences.english: Somehow, I managed to lose my keys.
sentences.chinese: 我不知怎的竟然把钥匙弄丢了。

sentences.english: Maybe we could glue it together somehow or other .
sentences.chinese: 也许我们可以想什么办法把它粘起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由于某种原因， 不知怎么的； 以某种方式
detailed_translations.english: in some way, or by some means, although you do not know how

name: solitary
trans: adj. 孤独的；独居的
n. 独居者；隐士

sentences.english: a long, solitary walk
sentences.chinese: 独自一人的长距离散步

detailed_translations.english: doing something without anyone else with you
someone who lives completely alone

name: solidarity
trans: n. 团结

sentences.english: a gesture of solidarity
sentences.chinese: 团结的表示

sentences.english: an appeal for worker solidarity
sentences.chinese: 呼吁工人们团结

detailed_translations.english: loyalty and general agreement between all the people in a group, or between different groups, because they all have a shared aim

name: solicitude
trans: n. 关心,挂念,渴望

sentences.english: Wherefore, I strongly advise you, my lords, to put aside all care and solicitude and to receive readily the most holy Body and Blood of our Lord Jesus Christ in holy commemoration of Him.
sentences.chinese: 为此，我强烈地建议你们，大人，把（对此世的）关心和渴望放到一边并接受我们的主基督在祂神圣的纪念仪式中已经是最神圣的身体和血。

name: solicitous
trans: adj. 关心的,挂念的 热切的,渴望的

sentences.english: He was so solicitous of his guests.
sentences.chinese: 他是如此挂念自己的客人们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热切期望的；热心的；挂念的
detailed_translations.english: very concerned about someone’s safety, health, or comfort

name: solenoid
trans: n. 螺线管；螺线形电导管

name: solemn
trans: adj. 庄严的，严肃的；隆重的，郑重的

sentences.english: a solemn expression
sentences.chinese: 严肃的表情

sentences.english: Their faces suddenly grew solemn.
sentences.chinese: 他们的脸突然变得严肃起来。

sentences.english: a solemn procession of mourners
sentences.chinese: 庄重的送葬队伍

sentences.english: solemn ritual/ceremony
sentences.chinese: 隆重的仪式/典礼

detailed_translations.chinese: 严肃的，庄重的；庄严的,隆重的
detailed_translations.english: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion

name: sole
trans: adj. 独占的；唯一的
n. 脚底；鞋底
n. 鳎鱼
vt. 给(鞋)换底

sentences.english: the sole American in the room
sentences.chinese: 房间里唯一的美国人

sentences.english: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
sentences.chinese: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。

sentences.english: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

sentences.english: the soles of her shoes
sentences.chinese: 她鞋子的鞋底

detailed_translations.english: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on

name: solder
trans: vi. 焊接
vt. 焊接；使联接在一起

sentences.english: Each sculptural planter is made-to-order with handmade glass and lead-free solder and comes with everything you need but the plants.
sentences.chinese: 每个艺术花盆都是定制的。 它们由手工制作的玻璃和无铅焊料接合而成，交付使用时，万事俱备，只欠花卉。

sentences.english: This superior reliability comes from advances in packaging techniques and epitaxial structure, together with the use of hard solder construction.
sentences.chinese: 这种超级可靠性来自于封装技术和外延结构的发展，也得益于硬焊接架构的使用。

sentences.english: You can either solder them together properly with a metal strip on the front, or just try positioning the metal correctly inside the case with the cells.
sentences.chinese: 你可以使用前面的金属条将他们焊在一起，或者只是定位好电池盒里面的电池单元的金属条。

detailed_translations.english: a soft metal, usually a mixture of  lead  and  tin  , which can be melted and used to join two metal surfaces, wires etc
to join or repair metal surfaces with solder

name: soiled
trans: adj. 脏的，被弄脏的
v. 弄脏；玷污，败坏；喂（牛）青饲料（soil 的过去式和过去分词）

name: soggy
trans: adj. 浸水的；透湿的；沉闷的

sentences.english: The ground was soggy from the rain.
sentences.chinese: 雨后地面湿透了。

sentences.english: The sandwiches have gone all soggy .
sentences.chinese: 那些三明治全都变得湿乎乎软塌塌的。

detailed_translations.english: unpleasantly wet and soft

name: societal
trans: adj. 社会的

name: sober
trans: adj. 冷静的，清醒的；未醉的
vt. 使醒酒，使清醒；使严肃

sentences.english: He’s a nice guy when he’s sober.
sentences.chinese: 他没喝醉时是个不错的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: not drunk

name: soaring
trans: adj. 猛增的；翱翔的；高耸的
v. 高飞；猛增；高耸（soar的现在分词形式）

name: snugly
trans: adv. 舒适地；隐蔽地；贴身地；紧密地

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适温暖地, 整洁地

name: snuggle
trans: v. 依偎；挨近

sentences.english: Jane snuggled up against his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 简依偎在他的肩膀上。

detailed_translations.english: to settle into a warm comfortable position

name: snug
trans: adj. 温暖舒适的；合身的；安全的
v. 使整洁干净；舒适地依靠；紧贴 n. 酒吧里的私房

sentences.english: She wished she were back in her snug little house.
sentences.chinese: 她希望自己还在她那温暖而舒适的小屋里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适的；温暖的；紧身的；隐藏的
detailed_translations.english: a room, building, or space that is snug is small, warm, and comfortable, and makes you feel protected

name: snot
trans: n. [口]鼻涕；惹人嫌的人；蛮横无理的话

name: snort
trans: vi. 轻蔑或愤怒地发出哼声；喷出蒸汽声
vt. 喷出；发哼声；[美俚]吸毒品

name: snoop
trans: vi. 调查，窥探
n. 私家侦探，到处窥视；爱管闲事的人

name: snob
trans: n. 势利小人，势利眼；假内行

sentences.english: Stop being such a snob.
sentences.chinese: 别这么势利眼。

sentences.english: I don’t want to sound like a snob, but I thought she was vulgar.
sentences.chinese: 我不想像个势利小人，但我觉得她就是庸俗。

detailed_translations.english: someone who thinks they are better than people from a lower social class – used to show disapproval

name: snatch
trans: n. 抢夺；小量；抓举
vt. 夺得；抽空做；及时救助

sentences.english: I snatched a glance at the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 我乘机瞥了一眼镜子。

detailed_translations.english: If you snatch an opportunity, you take it quickly. If you snatch something to eat or a rest, you have it quickly in between doing other things.

detailed_translations.chinese: 夺，夺走，抢走；一下子拉，一把抓住；抓住机会做，抽空做
detailed_translations.english: to take something away from someone with a quick, often violent, movement
a short part of a conversation, song etc that you hear

name: snarl
trans: n. 咆哮；混乱；怒骂
vi. 咆哮；怒骂；缠结

sentences.english: ‘Shut up,’ he snarled.
sentences.chinese: “住口。”他怒吼道。

detailed_translations.english: a vicious growl, utterance, or facial expression
if an animal snarls, it makes a low angry sound and shows its teeth

name: snag
trans: n. 障碍；意外障碍；突出物
vt. 抓住机会；造成阻碍；清除障碍物

sentences.english: It’s an interesting job. The only snag is that it’s not very well paid.
sentences.chinese: 这是一份有趣的工作，唯一的缺憾是工资不高。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or disadvantage, especially one that is not very serious, which you had not expected

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓住机会；造成阻碍；清除障碍物

name: smug
trans: adj. 自满的, 沾沾自喜的

sentences.english: Thomas and his wife looked at each other in smug satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯和他妻子互相看着对方，面带着自鸣得意的满足。

detailed_translations.chinese: 自鸣得意的；自以为是的；整洁的
detailed_translations.english: showing too much satisfaction with your own cleverness or success – used to show disapproval

detailed_translations.chinese: 书呆子；自命不凡的家伙

name: smother
trans: vt. 使窒息；（用灰等）闷熄；忍住；抑制
vi. 窒息；被抑制；闷死

sentences.english: A teenage mother was accused of smothering her 3-month-old daughter.
sentences.chinese: 一个少女妈妈被指控闷死自己三个月大的女儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使窒息；抑制；（用灰等）闷熄；忍住
detailed_translations.english: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing

detailed_translations.chinese: 窒息状态；令人窒息的浓烟

name: smooch
trans: n. 接吻；污迹
vt. 接吻；弄脏

name: smelly
trans: adj. 有臭味的，发臭的

sentences.english: smelly feet
sentences.chinese: 臭脚

detailed_translations.english: having a strong unpleasant smell

name: smear
trans: v. 涂抹；弄脏；诽谤
n. 污点；涂料；诽谤

sentences.english: smeared windows
sentences.chinese: 脏了的窗户

detailed_translations.english: to put dirty or oily marks on something
a  smear test

name: smashed
trans: adj. 喝醉酒的；破碎的
v. 粉碎（smash的过去式和过去分词）

name: smartly
trans: adv. 潇洒地；刺痛地；火辣辣地；漂亮地

name: slut
trans: n. 懒妇；母狗；荡妇

name: slushy
trans: adj. 泥泞的；融雪的
n. [俚]船上的厨子；（澳）厨子的助手

name: slurp
trans: vt. 出声地吃或喝
vi. 出声地吃或喝

sentences.english: He blew on his soup before slurping it off the spoon.
sentences.chinese: 他先吹了吹汤，然后出声地从匙子里喝汤。

detailed_translations.english: to drink a liquid while making a noisy sucking sound

name: slump
trans: vi. 下降，衰落；倒下
n. 暴跌；衰退；消沉

sentences.english: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

sentences.english: The council's land is now worth much less than originally hoped because of a slump in property prices.
sentences.chinese: 由于地产价格的暴跌，委员会的土地目前大不如原来所希望的那么值钱了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌
detailed_translations.english: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
Slump is also a noun

name: slue
trans: n. 旋转，转向；沼泽地
vt. 使……旋转；使……转向

name: sludge
trans: n. 烂泥；泥泞；泥状雪；沉淀物；（海上）小浮冰

sentences.english: More than a million gallons of sludge has seeped into the water.
sentences.chinese: 超过一百万加仑的工业废料已渗进水中。

detailed_translations.english: soft thick mud, especially at the bottom of a liquid

name: Slovak
trans: n. 斯洛伐克语；斯洛伐克人
adj. 斯洛伐克语的；斯洛伐克人的

name: sloppy
trans: adj. 草率的；泥泞的；肥大的；粗心的；稀薄的

sentences.english: Ann was dressed in a sloppy brown sweater.
sentences.chinese: 安穿了一件邋遢的棕色羊毛衫。

detailed_translations.english: sloppy clothes are loose-fitting, untidy, or dirty

name: slope
trans: n. 倾斜；斜率；斜坡；扛枪姿势
vi. 倾斜；逃走

sentences.english: a steep slope
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

sentences.english: a gentle
sentences.chinese: 缓坡

sentences.english: She looked back up the grassy slope.
sentences.chinese: 她回头望了一眼那绿草如茵的坡地。

sentences.english: a pleasant garden that slopes down to the river
sentences.chinese: 一座向河边倾斜的宜人花园

detailed_translations.english: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes
if the ground or a surface slopes, it is higher at one end than the other

name: slogan
trans: n. 标语；呐喊声

sentences.english: an advertising slogan
sentences.chinese: 一句广告口号

sentences.english: demonstrators shouting political slogans
sentences.chinese: 高喊政治口号的示威者

sentences.english: the Democrats’ campaign slogan
sentences.chinese: 民主党的竞选口号

detailed_translations.english: a short phrase that is easy to remember and is used in advertisements, or by politicians, organizations etc

name: slippery
trans: adj. 滑的；狡猾的；不稳定的

sentences.english: In places, the path can be wet and slippery.
sentences.chinese: 路上有些地方可能又湿又滑。

sentences.english: the slippery notion of ‘standards’
sentences.chinese: “标准”这一模糊概念

detailed_translations.english: something that is slippery is difficult to hold, walk on etc because it is wet or  greasy

name: slinky
trans: adj. 鬼鬼祟祟的；（指女装）紧身的，线条优美的

name: sling
trans: v. 投掷；抛；吊起；悬挂；驱逐；遣送
n. 投石器；投掷；吊索；悬带；斯林酒

sentences.english: They used slings of rope to lower us from one set of arms to another.
sentences.chinese: 他们用几条绳索把我们从一组吊臂降到另外一组吊臂。

sentences.english: She slung her coat over her desk chair.
sentences.chinese: 她把外衣搭在了桌椅背上。

sentences.english: He had a small green backpack slung over one shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他把一只绿色小背包搭在一边肩上。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ropes or strong pieces of cloth that are used to lift and carry heavy objects
If you sling something over your shoulder or over something such as a chair, you hang it there loosely

name: slimy
trans: adj. 黏滑的；泥泞的；谄媚的，虚伪的

sentences.english: a slimy politician
sentences.chinese: 假惺惺的政客

detailed_translations.chinese: 黏滑的；泥泞的；谄媚的，虚伪的
detailed_translations.english: friendly in an unpleasant way that does not seem sincere – used to show disapproval

name: slick
trans: adj. 光滑的；聪明的；熟练的；老套的；华而不实的
n. 平滑器；修光工具；通俗杂志

sentences.english: a slick Hollywood production
sentences.chinese: 一部场面恢宏但内容肤浅的好莱坞电影

sentences.english: slick advertising
sentences.chinese: 虚华的广告

sentences.english: The presentation was very slick.
sentences.chinese: 这个展示会非常华而不实。

detailed_translations.chinese: 光滑的；华而不实的；聪明的；熟练的；老套的
detailed_translations.english: if something is slick, it is done in a skilful and attractive way and seems expensive, but it often contains no important or interesting ideas

detailed_translations.chinese: [机] 平滑器；[机] 修光工具；通俗杂志

name: slicer
trans: n. 切片机；截剪器；限制器

name: sleigh
trans: vi. 乘雪橇；驾雪橇
vt. 乘雪橇；用雪橇运输

sentences.english: The sleigh jingled along the snowy road.
sentences.chinese: 雪橇在积雪的路上丁当前进。

sentences.english: They believe that -- on the night before Christmas -- he travels through the air in a sleigh pulled by reindeer. He enters each house from the top by sliding down the hole in the fireplace.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子们相信：在圣诞节的前一夜，圣诞老人乘坐驯鹿拉的雪橇从空中而来，他从壁炉的烟囱进入到每家每户，他把给孩子们的圣诞礼物放在圣诞树下。

detailed_translations.english: a large open vehicle with no wheels that is used for travelling over snow and is pulled along by animals

name: sleet
trans: vi. 下雨夹雪；下冰雹
vt. 冻雨拍打；使下霰般落下

sentences.english: Photo Tip: When shooting in cold weather, or extreme conditions such as snow and sleet, it's important not to change your lenses outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 拍照小技巧：在寒冷的天气里，或者遇到极端天气的时候，如下雪或者雨夹雪，想要拍照，最重要的是注意不要在户外更换镜头。

sentences.english: The three boys threw their hockey gear to the top of the hill and tried crawling up the path, but the sleet had created a smooth glacier with nothing to hold on to.
sentences.chinese: 三个男孩儿把他们的冰球装备扔到山顶上，然后试着沿小路往上爬，但雨夹雪已经令山坡变得更加的滑，而且没有任何可以抓住的东西。

detailed_translations.english: half-frozen rain that falls when it is very cold

name: sleek
trans: adj. 圆滑的；井然有序的
vt. 使…光滑；掩盖

sentences.english: the sleek lines of the new Mercedes
sentences.chinese: 这款新梅赛德斯汽车的优美外形

detailed_translations.english: sleek hair or fur is straight, shiny, and healthy-looking
to make hair or fur smooth and shiny by putting water or oil on it

name: slaughter
trans: n. 残杀；屠杀；大量杀戮
v. 残杀；屠杀

sentences.english: Men, women and children were slaughtered and villages destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 村庄被毁，男人、女人和儿童惨遭杀戮。

sentences.english: Lack of chicken feed means that chicken farms are having to slaughter their stock.
sentences.chinese: 饲料不足意味着养鸡场将不得不宰杀鸡。

sentences.english: the slaughter of defenceless women and children
sentences.chinese: 对毫无自卫能力的妇孺的杀戮

sentences.english: the export of live animals for slaughter
sentences.chinese: 屠宰用活畜的出口

detailed_translations.english: to kill a lot of people in a cruel or violent way
when large numbers of people are killed in a cruel or violent way

name: slang
trans: n. 俚语；行话
adj. 俚语的

sentences.english: schoolboy slang
sentences.chinese: 学生俚语

detailed_translations.english: very informal, sometimes offensive language that is used especially by people who belong to a particular group, such as young people or criminals

name: slam dunk
trans: 扣篮，塞投（篮球动作）

name: slag
trans: 矿渣；熔渣；炉渣；荡妇

detailed_translations.english: a waste material similar to glass, which remains after metal has been obtained from rock

name: slacks

sentences.english: police in bullet-proof vests and carrying riot shields
sentences.chinese: 穿防弹背心、持防暴盾牌的警察

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large crowd of people are behaving in a violent and uncontrolled way, especially when they are protesting about something
if a crowd of people riot, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way, for example by fighting the police and damaging cars or buildings

name: rinse
trans: vt. 冲洗掉；漱；漂净
n. 冲洗；漂洗；染发剂；染发

sentences.english: Let me just rinse my hands.
sentences.chinese: 让我冲个手。

sentences.english: Rinse the vegetables under a cold tap.
sentences.chinese: 把蔬菜放在冷水龙头下冲洗。

detailed_translations.english: to wash clothes, dishes, vegetables etc quickly with water, especially running water, and without soap

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲洗；漂洗；[轻] 染发剂；染发
detailed_translations.english: when you rinse something

name: ringing
trans: adj. 响亮的；明白的
n. 铃声

name: rim
trans: n. 边，边缘；轮辋；圆圈
vi. 作…的边，装边于

sentences.english: She looked at him over the rim of her glass.
sentences.chinese: 她沿玻璃杯口看着他。

detailed_translations.english: the outside edge of something circular
to be around the edge of something

name: rigor
trans: n. 严厉；精确；苛刻；僵硬

sentences.english: We are not so much testing as proposal-thinning, and we can add rigor such as traceability and other documentation as the leading architectural candidates emerge.
sentences.chinese: 我们不像细化提议那样做太多测试，随着最主要的架构候选的出现，我们可以添加严密，如可溯性和其他文档。

sentences.english: The towers, not only ground the buildings with their visual weight, but they also contribute to the rigor of rhythmic play needed in such expansive internal spaces and environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些塔楼不仅利用其视觉上的厚重感将建筑物固定在地面上，还有助于生成这种开阔的内部空间和环境所需的严谨的韵律感。

name: rigger
trans: n. 装配工；索具装配人；保护架

name: rig
trans: n. 装备；帆具；服装；钻井架；钻塔
v. 装配；装扮；临时赶造；操纵

sentences.english: The ship was fully rigged and ready to sail.
sentences.chinese: 船已装备就绪，等待起航。

detailed_translations.chinese: 给船装帆;为提供必要装备
detailed_translations.english: to put ropes, sails etc on a ship

name: riding
trans: n. 骑马；骑术
v. 骑；乘坐（ride的现在分词）

sentences.english: horse riding
sentences.chinese: 骑马

sentences.english: Shall we go riding on Saturday?
sentences.chinese: 我们星期六去骑马好吗？

detailed_translations.english: the sport or activity of riding horses

name: ridicule
trans: vt. 嘲笑；愚弄；嘲弄
n. 嘲笑；愚弄；笑柄

sentences.english: the ridicule of his peers
sentences.chinese: 他同龄人的奚落

sentences.english: The government’s proposals were held up to ridicule (= suffered ridicule ) by opposition ministers.
sentences.chinese: 政府的提案遭到反对党部长们的嘲笑。

sentences.english: He had become an object of ridicule among the other teachers.
sentences.chinese: 他成了其他教师嘲笑的对象。

detailed_translations.english: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid
to laugh at a person, idea etc and say that they are stupid

name: ridge
trans: n. 山脉；山脊；屋脊
vt. 使成脊状；作垄

sentences.english: We made our way carefully along the ridge.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着山脊小心前行。

detailed_translations.english: a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain

name: riddle
trans: n. 谜；谜语；神秘事件；无法解释的情况
v. 使布满孔洞

sentences.english: See if you can solve this riddle .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能猜出这个谜语。

detailed_translations.english: to solve, explain, or interpret (a riddle or riddles)

detailed_translations.chinese: 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
detailed_translations.english: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer

name: rick
trans: vt. 把…堆成垛；（英）扭伤
vi. 扭伤

name: rhino
trans: n. [俚]钱；现金；犀牛（等于rhinoceros）

sentences.english: But critics and environmental groups say poaching is still on the rise in Zimbabwe, especially of the black rhino.
sentences.chinese: 但批评家和环境保护组织认为，偷猎在津巴布韦依然有增无减，尤其是狩猎黑犀牛。

detailed_translations.english: a rhinoceros

name: rhetorical
trans: adj. 修辞的；修辞学的；词藻华丽的

sentences.english: a speech full of rhetorical phrases
sentences.chinese: 充满华丽辞藻的演讲

detailed_translations.chinese: 修辞的；修辞学的；夸张的
detailed_translations.english: using speech or writing in special ways in order to persuade people or to produce an impressive effect

name: rhetoric
trans: n. 修辞，修辞学；华丽的词藻
adj. 花言巧语的

sentences.english: The speech was dismissed by some people as merely political rhetoric .
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为这场演讲只是华而不实的政治空谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 修辞，修辞学；华丽的词藻
detailed_translations.english: the art of speaking or writing to persuade or influence people

name: rewire
trans: vt. 给…再打电报；给…换新电线
vi. 再发电报；重装电线

name: revoke
trans: vt. 废除；撤回，取消
vi. 有牌不跟

sentences.english: Their work permits have been revoked.
sentences.chinese: 他们的工作许可证被吊销了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially state that a law, decision, or agreement is no longer effective

name: revenge
trans: n. 复仇；报复
vt. 报复；替…报仇；洗雪

sentences.english: The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully.
sentences.chinese: 攻击者被称是在报复一名14岁男孩，称他是学校一霸。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to punish someone who has harmed or offended you
to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

name: reunite
trans: vt. 使再结合；使再联合；使重聚
vi. 再结合；再联合；重聚

sentences.english: The band will reunite for a US tour.
sentences.chinese: 乐队将重聚作美国巡演。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使重聚；使再结合；使再联合
detailed_translations.english: to come together again or to bring people, parts of an organization, political party, or country together again

name: retrograde
trans: adj. 倒退的；退步的；逆行的；衰减的
v. 倒退；退化；逆行 adv. 后退地

sentences.english: The closure of the factories is seen as a retrograde step .
sentences.chinese: 工厂的关闭被认为是一个退步。

detailed_translations.chinese: 倒退的；退化的；次序颠倒的
detailed_translations.english: involving a return to an earlier and worse situation

name: retrieve
trans: vt. 重新得到；恢复；检索
vi. 找回猎物

sentences.english: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
sentences.chinese: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新得到， 取回， 收回； 挽回， 补救； 检索
detailed_translations.english: to find something and bring it back

name: retrieval
trans: n. 重获,取回,检索,挽回,恢复

sentences.english: a new system that should speed up information retrieval
sentences.chinese: 能加速信息检索的新系统

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting back information stored on a computer system

name: retort
trans: n. 反驳，顶嘴；曲颈瓶
vt. 反驳，反击

sentences.english: He was about to make a sharp retort .
sentences.chinese: 他正要尖刻地反驳。

detailed_translations.english: a short angry or humorous reply
to reply quickly, in an angry or humorous way

name: retiree
trans: n. （美）退休人员；歇业者

name: retinal
trans: adj. 视网膜的
n. [生化]视黄醛（等于retinene）

name: retina
trans: n. [医]视网膜

sentences.english: Consider one of the difficulties: every time we move our eyes, the image on our retina moves.
sentences.chinese: 比如困难之一就是：每当我们的眼球移动时，视网膜上的影像也在移动。

sentences.english: There are sensory neurons, which take information from the world so as you see me, for instance, there are neurons firing from your retina sending signals to your brain.
sentences.chinese: 感觉神经元,负责收集外界信息,比如,当你看到我的时候,视网膜上的神经元会产生神经冲动,将刺激信号传递到你的大脑

sentences.english: A tiny electronic pad is placed onto the retina of one eye, so that the electrodes are in direct contact with the ganglion cells.
sentences.chinese: 一个微小的电子衬垫被放置在单侧眼睛的视网膜上，这样电极就可以与神经节细胞直接接触了。

detailed_translations.english: the area at the back of your eye that receives light and sends an image of what you see to your brain

name: reticent
trans: adj. 沉默的；有保留的；谨慎的

sentences.english: She is so reticent about her achievements.
sentences.chinese: 她对于自己的成就如此缄默。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉默的；有保留的；谨慎的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is reticent does not tell people about things

name: retard
trans: vt. 妨碍；延迟；使减速；阻止
vi. 减慢；受到阻滞

sentences.english: Cold weather retards the growth of many plants.
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的天气使许多植物生长滞缓。

detailed_translations.english: to delay the development of something, or to make something happen more slowly than expected

name: retainer
trans: n. 保持者；家臣；[机]护圈；[机]保持器；预付费用

sentences.english: I'll need a five-hundred-dollar retainer.
sentences.chinese: 我将需要一笔500美元的预付聘金。

detailed_translations.chinese: 保持器；家臣；保持者；[机] 护圈；预付费用
detailed_translations.english: a reduced amount of rent that you pay for a room, flat etc when you are not there, so that it will still be available when you return

name: retail
trans: vt. 零售；转述
vi. 零售

sentences.english: a retail price of £8.99
sentences.chinese: 8.99英镑的零售价

sentences.english: The retail value would be around $500.
sentences.chinese: 零售价在500美元左右。

sentences.english: Retail sales fell by 1.3% in January.
sentences.chinese: 1月份零售额下降了1.3%。

sentences.english: The wine retails at £6.95 a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 这种葡萄酒每瓶的零售价为6.95英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the sale of goods in shops to customers, for their own use and not for selling to anyone else
to be sold for a particular price in a shop

name: resuscitate
trans: v. 使复活；使苏醒；使复兴
v. 恢复；复兴

sentences.english: Doctors managed to resuscitate him.
sentences.chinese: 医生把他抢救了过来。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone breathe again or become conscious after they have almost died

name: restraint
trans: n. 克制；抑制；束缚

sentences.english: The police were praised for their restraint in handling the demonstrators.
sentences.chinese: 警方因对待示威者时所表现出的克制而受到赞扬。

detailed_translations.english: calm sensible controlled behaviour, especially in a situation when it is difficult to stay calm

name: restoration
trans: n. 恢复；归还；复位

sentences.english: You have control over the restoration of objects.
sentences.chinese: 您还可以控制对象的恢复。

detailed_translations.english: the act of bringing back a law, tax, or system of government

name: rest
trans: n. 休息，睡眠；静止；支持物；剩余部分，余下的人或物
vt. & vi.（使）休息；（使）倚靠，支撑；停止，不再谈论

sentences.english: If you’re tired, we’ll stop and rest for a while.
sentences.chinese: 如果你累了，我们就停下来歇一会儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使休息，使轻松；把…寄托于
detailed_translations.english: to stop working or doing an activity for a time and sit down or lie down to relax

detailed_translations.chinese: 休息，静止；休息时间；剩余部分；支架
detailed_translations.english: a period of time when you are not doing anything tiring and you can relax or sleep

name: responsive
trans: adj. 回答的；应答的；易感应的

sentences.english: I tried to get him talking about his problems, but he wasn’t very responsive .
sentences.chinese: 我试图让他谈谈他的问题，但他不是很愿意讲。

detailed_translations.english: eager to communicate with people, and to react to them in a positive way

name: respective
trans: adj. 分别的，各自的

sentences.english: We all went back to our respective homes to wait for news.
sentences.chinese: 我们都各自回家等待消息。

sentences.english: the respective roles of teachers and students
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生各自不同的角色

detailed_translations.english: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

name: resort
trans: n. (度假)胜地；手段；凭借
vi. 诉诸；常去

sentences.english: His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他那累人的工作日程已经使他不得不求助于毒品了。

sentences.english: Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.
sentences.chinese: 国会有责任确保在所有和平的手段用尽之后再诉诸武力。

detailed_translations.english: when you must use or depend on something because nothing better is available
The action of resorting to a course of action in a difficult situation

name: resonate
trans: v. （嗓音、乐器等）产生共鸣；发出回响；回荡；（使）回响，起回声；使产生联想；引起共鸣；和…的想法（或观念）类似

sentences.english: The bass guitar began to thump so loudly that it resonated in my head.
sentences.chinese: 低音吉他开始砰然作响，震得我的脑袋嗡嗡的。

detailed_translations.english: if something such as an event or a message resonates, it seems important or good to people, or continues to do this

name: resolute
trans: adj. 坚决的；果断的

sentences.english: resolute opposition
sentences.chinese: 坚决的反对

sentences.english: resolute leadership
sentences.chinese: 果断的领导

sentences.english: She remained resolute in her belief that the situation would improve.
sentences.chinese: 她依然坚信情况将会好转。

detailed_translations.english: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc

name: resistor
trans: n. 电阻器

sentences.english: What is the output power at weak signals compared to the optimal load resistor.
sentences.chinese: 在接收弱信号的时候，和最佳负载电阻比较，它的输出功率如何？

sentences.english: In a circuit diagram, on the other hand, a resistor might be oriented horizontally or vertically, and it might appear above, below, or next to the preceding circuit element.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，在一张电路图表里，一个电阻器可能是水平或者垂直朝向的，并可能在之前电路元素的上面、下面或者旁边。

sentences.english: Because moving charges make currents, and changing magnetic fluxes breed voltages, the new device would generate a voltage from a current rather like a resistor, but in a complex, dynamic way.
sentences.chinese: 因为移动的电荷会产生电流，变化的磁通量会产生电压，新的设备会从电流中产生电压，像电阻一样，不过是以更加复杂、动态的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wire or other material used for increasing electrical resistance

name: resinous
trans: adj. 树脂的；树脂质的

sentences.english: Propolis is a hard resinous substance made by bees from the juices of plants.
sentences.chinese: 蜂胶是蜜蜂用植物汁液合成的像树脂一样的坚硬物质。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is resinous is like resin or contains resin

name: resilient
trans: adj. 适应力强的；有弹力的

sentences.english: Children are often very resilient.
sentences.chinese: 儿童的适应力一般都很强。

sentences.english: The company proved remarkably resilient during the recession.
sentences.chinese: 公司在经济衰退期间表现出惊人的耐挫力。

detailed_translations.english: able to become strong, happy, or successful again after a difficult situation or event

name: resilience
trans: n. 弹回;弹性 恢复力；适应力

sentences.english: And I think what we're seeing in the economy now is the inherent resilience of the American economy and the American people.
sentences.chinese: 而且我认为，我认为，在经济方面，我们现在看到的是美国经济和美国人民一直以来所固有的弹性。

detailed_translations.english: the ability of a substance such as rubber to return to its original shape after it has been pressed or bent

name: residue
trans: n. 残渣；剩余；滤渣

sentences.english: The flies leave a sticky residue on crops.
sentences.chinese: 苍蝇在庄稼上留下黏糊糊的分泌物。

sentences.english: Rinse off any soap residue.
sentences.chinese: 冲净残留的肥皂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that remains on a surface, in a container etc and cannot be removed easily, or that remains after a chemical process

name: residual
trans: n. 剩余；残渣
adj. 剩余的；残留的

sentences.english: But its decline across Europe is not uniform; in each country, the church faces a different mixture of threats and residual strengths.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在欧洲这种萎缩并不均匀，在每一个国家，教会都面对着多种不同威胁和残余的优势。

sentences.english: These, however, have been exposed to the digestive mercies of bacteria in the large intestine, and any residual goodies have been removed from them that way.
sentences.chinese: 然而这些是被暴露到大肠消化道寄生细菌产生的结果，并且任何剩余糖分都是通过这种方式被移除的。

detailed_translations.english: remaining after a process, event etc is finished

name: reservoir
trans: n. 水库 储藏, 汇集

sentences.english: All these earthquakes happened when the water level in Zipingpu reservoir was low.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些地震都发生在紫坪铺水库水位很低的时候。

detailed_translations.english: a lake, especially an artificial one, where water is stored before it is supplied to people’s houses

name: resemble
trans: vt. 类似，像

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: resemblance
trans: n. 相似, 形似

sentences.english: The resemblance between Susan and her sister was remarkable.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊和她的姐姐十分相像。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being or looking similar to sb/sth

name: reptile
trans: adj. 爬虫类的；卑鄙的
n. 爬行动物；卑鄙的人

sentences.english: Bird evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg--laid by a reptile.
sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.english: No matter how dry your skin gets, you will never turn into an alligator or any other type of reptile.
sentences.chinese: 不论皮肤多么干燥，你永远不会变成美洲鳄或任何其他一种皮肤粗糙的爬行动物。

sentences.english: This small reptile, which measures just 10 centimeters long, can swim through the sand dunes at up to 15 centimeters per second.
sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

name: reprove
trans: vt. 责骂；谴责；非难
vi. 责备；指责；非难

sentences.english: "There's no call for talk like that," Mrs. Evans reproved him.
sentences.chinese: “没有必要说那种话，”埃文斯太太责备他道。

detailed_translations.english: to criticize someone for something that they have done

name: reproductive
trans: adj. (生物)生殖的

sentences.english: the human reproductive system
sentences.chinese: 人类生殖系统

sentences.english: reproductive organs
sentences.chinese: 生殖器官

detailed_translations.english: relating to the process of producing babies, young animals, or plants

name: reprimand
trans: n. 训斥, 惩戒
vt. 申斥, 惩戒, 谴责

sentences.english: He has been fined five thousand dollars and given a severe reprimand.
sentences.chinese: 他被罚款5000美元，并且受到严厉的训斥。

detailed_translations.english: Reprimand is also a noun
to tell someone officially that something they have done is very wrong

name: reprieve
trans: vt. 缓期执行；暂时解救
n. 暂缓；缓刑

sentences.english: As for my unlikely allies, I think that I shall allow them a reprieve.
sentences.chinese: 至于我的盟友们，我想我应该给他们一个缓刑的机会。

sentences.english: You will be converted—you will be converted just as soon as every effort to compass pardon, commutation, or reprieve HAS failed—and then!
sentences.chinese: 您会痛悔前非——就在人们为您恳求赦免、申请减刑、或改判缓刑的一切努力统告失败的时候，您会痛悔前非的。

detailed_translations.english: to officially stop a prisoner from being killed as a punishment
a delay before something bad happens or continues to happen

name: repress
trans: vt. 镇压（叛乱等）；抑制；约束
vi. 镇压；抑制

sentences.english: He had long ago repressed the painful memories of his childhood.
sentences.chinese: 他长久压抑着儿时的痛苦记忆。

detailed_translations.english: if someone represses upsetting feelings, memories etc, they do not allow themselves to express or think about them

name: representation
trans: n. 表现；描述；作为…的代表（或代理人）；象征

sentences.english: The clock in the painting is a symbolic representation of the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 画上的时钟象征着光阴的流逝。

sentences.english: A group of students made representations to the college about the poor standard of the accommodation.
sentences.chinese: 一群学生就恶劣的住宿条件同校方交涉。

sentences.english: Minority groups need more effective parliamentary representation.
sentences.chinese: 少数族群需要办事更为高效的议会代表。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, sign, description etc that shows something

name: repository
trans: n. 仓库，贮藏室，存放处；智囊，知识渊博的人，知识宝典

detailed_translations.chinese: 贮藏室，仓库；知识库；智囊团
detailed_translations.english: a place or container in which large quantities of something are stored

name: replicate
trans: v. 复制；模拟；折叠
n. 复制品
adj. 复制的；折叠的

sentences.english: There is a need for further research to replicate these findings.
sentences.chinese: 需要进一步的研究来验证这些结果。

detailed_translations.english: if you replicate someone’s work, a scientific study etc, you do it again, or try to get the same result again

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制品；八音阶间隔的反覆音

name: repercussion
trans: n. （尤指坏的）影响，反响；恶果；[医]浮动诊胎法

sentences.english: It was an effort which was to have painful repercussions.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个将产生沉痛后果的尝试。

detailed_translations.chinese: 反响；弹回；反射；浮动诊胎法；令人不满意的后果
detailed_translations.english: the effects of an action or event, especially bad effects that continue for some time

name: repent
trans: vi. 忏悔；后悔
vt. 后悔；对…感到后悔

sentences.english: Those who refuse to repent, he said, will be punished.
sentences.chinese: 他说，那些不肯悔悟的人将受到惩罚。

sentences.english: repent stems

detailed_translations.english: to be sorry for something and wish you had not done it – used especially when considering your actions in a religious way

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 匍匐生根的；[动] 爬行的
detailed_translations.english: lying or creeping along the ground; reptant

name: repellent
trans: n. 驱虫剂
adj. 令人反感的;令人厌恶的

sentences.english: She found him physically repellent.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他的长相很讨厌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排斥的；防水的；弹回的；令人讨厌的
detailed_translations.english: very unpleasant

name: repatriate
trans: vt. 把(某人)遣送回国, 遣返

sentences.english: After the war, prisoners were repatriated.
sentences.chinese: 战后，战俘被遣返。

detailed_translations.english: to send someone back to their own country

name: repartition
trans: n. 重新分配
vt. 再分配，重新分配

name: reorientation
trans: n. 再定位

name: renovate
trans: v. 修复；翻新；重新粉刷；整修（尤指建筑物）

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

name: rendition
trans: n. 演唱, 表演

sentences.english: He gave a moving rendition of Lennon’s ‘Imagine’.
sentences.chinese: 他深情地演唱了列侬的《想象》。

detailed_translations.chinese: 译文；演奏；提供；引渡逃奴
detailed_translations.english: someone’s performance of a play, piece of music etc

name: rendezvous
trans: n. 约会；约会地点；汇合点
vi. 汇合；集合

sentences.english: plans for a secret rendezvous
sentences.chinese: 秘密约会的计划

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement to meet someone at a particular time and place, often secretly
to meet someone at a time or place that was arranged earlier

name: render
trans: v. 给予；提供；回报；致使，造成；递交；呈献；提交；表达；表演；（用不同的语言）表达；翻译；把…译成；粉刷；给（墙壁）抹灰；将（脂肪）熬成油；熔化
n. 墙壁的初涂；抹灰；粉刷

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered
sentences.chinese: 一张3,200美元服务费的账单

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: renaissance
trans: n. 文艺复兴, 文艺复兴时期

sentences.english: ...the Renaissance masterpieces in London's galleries.
sentences.chinese: …伦敦美术馆里文艺复兴时期的杰作。

detailed_translations.english: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

name: remunerative
trans: adj. 酬报的,报偿性的 付酬的;有利可图的

sentences.english: A doctor advised her to seek remunerative employment.
sentences.chinese: 一个医生建议她去找有酬劳的工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有利可图的；有报酬的；合算的
detailed_translations.english: making a lot of money

name: remnant
trans: n. 剩余
adj. 剩余的

sentences.english: Beneath the present church were remnants of Roman flooring.
sentences.chinese: 在目前的这座教堂下面还有残余的古罗马地板。

detailed_translations.english: a small part of something that remains after the rest of it has been used, destroyed, or eaten

name: remittance
trans: n. 汇款

sentences.english: Please enclose your remittance, making checks payable to Valley Technology Services.
sentences.chinese: 请随信附上您的汇款，支票收款方为瓦利科技服务公司。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that you send to pay for something

name: remission
trans: n. 缓和, 减轻

sentences.english: The cancer has gone into remission .
sentences.chinese: 癌症已经开始好转。

detailed_translations.english: a period when a serious illness improves for a time

name: reminiscent
trans: adj. 提醒的, 暗示的; 像…的; 使人想起…的

sentences.english: Her face wore a reminiscent smile.
sentences.chinese: 她面带微笑，沉浸在往事之中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀旧的，回忆往事的；耽于回想的
detailed_translations.english: thinking about the past

name: reminisce
trans: vi. & vt. 追忆;回想

name: remark
trans: n. 评论；备注；注意
v. 评论；注意到

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: reluctant
trans: adj. 不情愿的, 勉强的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: reluctance
trans: n. 不愿意；勉强

sentences.english: Wells finally agreed, but with reluctance.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔斯最终同意了，但很勉强。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unwilling to do something, or when they do something slowly to show that they are not very willing

name: relish
trans: v. 享受；从...获得乐趣；品味；渴望；喜欢；有滋味
n. 滋味；爱好；调味品

sentences.english: I relish the challenge of doing jobs that others turn down.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢接受挑战做别人拒绝做的工作。

sentences.english: The three men ate with relish.
sentences.chinese: 那3个人吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: to enjoy an experience or the thought of something that is going to happen
Relish is also a noun

name: religious
trans: adj. 宗教的；虔诚的；严谨的；信奉宗教的

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

name: relic
trans: n. 废墟；纪念物；遗迹，遗物

sentences.english: Roman relics found in a field
sentences.chinese: 在野外发现的古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: an old object or custom that reminds people of the past or that has lived on from a past time

name: relevance
trans: n. 中肯；关联；相关性

sentences.english: I think we can all appreciate the relevance of that now.
sentences.chinese: 我想，我们大家现在都能领会这句话中肯。

name: relentless
trans: adj. 不停的；持续强烈的；不减弱的；放弃的；严格的；苛刻的；无情的

sentences.english: her relentless determination to succeed
sentences.chinese: 她要成功的坚定决心

sentences.english: a regime that was relentless in its persecution of dissidents
sentences.chinese: 无情迫害持不同政见者的政权

detailed_translations.chinese: 无情的；残酷的；不间断的
detailed_translations.english: strict, cruel, or determined, without ever stopping

name: rejuvenate
trans: vt. 使变得年轻, 使恢复活力

sentences.english: I came back from holiday feeling rejuvenated.
sentences.chinese: 我度假回来，感到恢复了活力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使年轻；使更新；使恢复精神；使复原
detailed_translations.english: to make someone look or feel young and strong again

name: reinsert
trans: vt. 再插入，重新插入

name: reinforcement
trans: n. 援军;增援警力 (感情或思想等的)巩固,加强,强化

sentences.english: The police called for reinforcements .
sentences.chinese: 警方要求增援。

detailed_translations.english: more soldiers, police etc who are sent to a battle, fight etc to make their group stronger

name: rein
trans: n. 缰绳；驾驭；统治；支配
vt. 勒住；驾驭；控制

sentences.english: Cord held the reins while the stallion tugged and snorted.
sentences.chinese: 当那匹牡马使劲挣扎，打着响鼻的时候，科德勒紧了缰绳。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow band of leather that is fastened around a horse’s head in order to control it

detailed_translations.chinese: 勒缰使停步； 控制， 约束

name: reimbursement
trans: n. 偿还;退款 补偿;赔偿

name: rehearse
trans: vt. 排练；预演
vi. 排练；演习

sentences.english: I think we need to rehearse the first scene again.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们需要把第一场再排练一次。

detailed_translations.english: to practise or make people practise something such as a play or concert in order to prepare for a public performance

name: rehab
trans: n. 修复

name: regulatory
trans: adj. 管理的；控制的；调整的

sentences.english: Perhaps the best reason for regulators to be suspicious about innovation is that so much of it in the modern world is aimed at facilitating regulatory and tax arbitrage.
sentences.chinese: 监管者之所以对创新怀有疑虑，最关键的原因可能在于，现代社会中太多创新的目的都是为监管和税收套利提供便利。

detailed_translations.english: a regulatory authority has the official power to control an activity and to make sure that it is done in a satisfactory way

name: regress
trans: vi. 逆行，倒退；复归
n. 退回；回归

sentences.english: If your child regresses to babyish behaviour, all you know for certain is that the child is under stress.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的孩子退步到幼稚的行为，你可以肯定的是孩子正处在压力之下。

detailed_translations.english: When people or things regress, they return to an earlier and less advanced stage of development

name: registry
trans: n. 注册；登记处；挂号处；船舶的国籍

sentences.english: the registry of the vessel
sentences.chinese: 船舶登记

detailed_translations.chinese: 注册；登记处；挂号处；船舶的国籍
detailed_translations.english: a place where information used by an organization is kept, especially official records or lists

name: regiment
trans: vt. 把…编成团；严格地管制
n. 团；大量

sentences.english: the regimented routine of boarding school
sentences.chinese: 寄宿学校严格的生活规律

detailed_translations.english: to organize and control people firmly and usually too strictly
a large group of soldiers, usually consisting of several  battalion s

name: regime
trans: n. 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: regent
trans: n. 摄政者；摄政王；[美]州立大学董事会董事；[古]统治者
adj. 摄政的；[古]统治的

detailed_translations.chinese: 摄政王；摄政者；州立大学董事会董事；统治者
detailed_translations.english: someone who governs instead of a king or queen, because the king or queen is ill, absent, or still a child

name: regarding
trans: prep.关于， 至于

sentences.english: Regarding your recent inquiry, I have enclosed a copy of our new brochure.
sentences.chinese: 关于你最近的咨询，我随信附上一本我们最新的手册。

detailed_translations.english: a word used especially in letters or speeches to introduce the subject you are writing or talking about

name: refurbish
trans: vt. 刷新;擦亮;使清洁；整修

sentences.english: We have spent money on refurbishing the offices.
sentences.chinese: 我们已在这些办公室的翻新上花了钱。

detailed_translations.english: To refurbish a building or room means to clean it and decorate it and make it more attractive or better equipped

name: refractive
trans: adj. 折射的

name: refinement
trans: n. 细微的改良 优雅或高贵的动作、举止等

sentences.english: Her mother is a woman with great refinement.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲是一个非常文雅的女人。

detailed_translations.english: Refinement is politeness and good manners

name: refill
trans: vi. 被再注满
vt. 再装满；再充满

sentences.english: The waitress refilled our coffee cups.
sentences.chinese: 女服务员又把我们的咖啡杯斟满。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something again

name: referral
trans: n. 参照；提及；被推举的人；转诊病人

sentences.english: Only 39 percent of patients were seen within four weeks of referral.
sentences.chinese: 被介绍转诊的病人中，只有39%的人在四个星期内得到了诊治。

detailed_translations.chinese: n参照；提及；被推举的人；转诊病人

name: refectory
trans: n. 餐厅

sentences.english: Conclusions Using HACCP method in refectory obtained good effect.
sentences.chinese: 结论：在学校食堂应用HACCP管理是有效的。

sentences.english: Do you know if hereabout have preferable refectory for Western - style food.
sentences.chinese: 你知道附近有比较好的西餐厅吗?。

sentences.english: There is no denying that the qualities of food in our refectory have gone from bad to worse .
sentences.chinese: 不可否认的，我们学校食堂食物的质量已经每况愈下。

detailed_translations.english: a large room in a school, college etc where meals are served and eaten

name: redundancy
trans: n. （尤指文字）多余，累赘，啰唆；失业，被解雇，裁员

sentences.english: The closure of the export department resulted in over 100 redundancies.
sentences.chinese: 出口部关闭导致一百多人被解雇。

sentences.english: Two thousand workers now face redundancy.
sentences.chinese: 2,000 名工人现在面临失业。

sentences.english: An employee is not eligible for a redundancy payment unless he has been with the company for two years.
sentences.chinese: 在公司工作满两年的雇员才有资格拿遣散费。

detailed_translations.chinese: [计][数] 冗余（等于redundance）；裁员；人浮于事
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which someone has to leave their job, because they are no longer needed

name: redeem
trans: vt. 赎回；补偿；挽回；恢复；履行；兑换

sentences.english: Olivier’s performance redeemed an otherwise second-rate play.
sentences.chinese: 奥利维尔的表演补救了一出本是二流水平的戏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回；挽回；兑换；履行；补偿；恢复
detailed_translations.english: to make something less bad

name: rectum
trans: n. 直肠

name: rectify
trans: vt. 改正；[电]整流；[化]精馏

sentences.english: I did my best to rectify the situation, but the damage was already done.
sentences.chinese: 我竭尽全力去挽回局面，但损害已经造成了。

detailed_translations.english: to correct something that is wrong

name: recruiter
trans: n. 招聘人员;征兵人员

sentences.english: If that doesn't work, do a Web search on the term "recruiter" or "HR director" along with the name of your employer of choice.
sentences.chinese: 如果这招无效的话，那就在网站上输入你可选择的雇主名单加上“招聘人员”或“人力资源部经理”一起搜索。

sentences.english: If you feel the recruiter can't meet the challenge, you may need to raise the issue with the head of recruiting or human resources.
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得招聘人员无法完成这一挑战，你可能就得把问题提交给招聘或人力资源部门的负责人了。

sentences.english: Therefore, if recruiting is a major function, it may be in the company's best interest to have a professional recruiter and another employee to handle all the other functions.
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果招聘是一个重要的职能，符合该公司的最大利益的做法是，有专业的招聘人员和另一名雇员来处理所有其他职能。

name: recruit
trans: n. 招聘；新兵；新成员
vt. 征募；补充；使…恢复健康；聘用

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: recreation
trans: n. 娱乐(方式); 消遣(方式)

sentences.english: His only recreations are drinking beer and watching football.
sentences.chinese: 他唯一的消遣就是喝啤酒和看足球比赛。

sentences.english: the provision of recreation facilities
sentences.chinese: 提供娱乐设施

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement

name: recover
trans: vt. 恢复；重新获得；弥补
vi. 恢复；胜诉；[体]重新得球

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: reconnaissance
trans: n. 侦察；勘察

sentences.english: reconnaissance aircraft
sentences.chinese: 侦察机

sentences.english: a reconnaissance mission
sentences.chinese: 侦察任务

sentences.english: wartime roles such as observation and reconnaissance
sentences.chinese: 监视和侦察等战时任务

detailed_translations.chinese: [军] 侦察；勘测（等于reconnoissance）；搜索；事先考查
detailed_translations.english: the military activity of sending soldiers and aircraft to find out about the enemy’s forces

name: recoil
trans: vi. 畏缩, 退缩 报应，返回，回报
n. (尤指枪炮的)反冲, 后坐力

sentences.english: We recoil in horror from the thought of subjecting someone to extreme pain.
sentences.chinese: 想到要让一个人经受极度的痛苦，我们就会恐惧地退缩。

sentences.english: ...his small body jerking in recoil from the volume of his shouting.
sentences.chinese: …他小小身体在他大声的叫喊中畏缩地抽搐着。

detailed_translations.english: to move back suddenly and quickly from something you do not like or are afraid of
Recoil is also a noun

name: recline
trans: vi. 依赖；斜倚；靠

sentences.english: She proceeded to recline on a chaise longue.

detailed_translations.english: to lie or lean back in a relaxed way

trans: adj. 鲁莽的，不顾后果的；粗心大意的

sentences.chinese: 他被控因鲁莽驾驶致人死亡。

sentences.chinese: 他不顾危险冲入着火的房子里。

detailed_translations.english: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions

detailed_translations.english: a performance of music or poetry, usually given by one performer

trans: v. 互换；交换；报答；往返运动

sentences.chinese: 他在说话时，我也应该说点什么回应他。

trans: adj. 互相给予的; 互惠的; 相互的

sentences.chinese: 他谈及需要建立对各方都有益的互惠关系。

sentences.chinese: 此类协议规定了相互之间的权利与义务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 互惠的；相互的；倒数的，彼此相反的

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 倒数；互相起作用的事物

sentences.chinese: 各工会对这些计划反响不一。

sentences.chinese: 他大部分的演讲都用来反驳他在外交政策上受到的各种批评。

trans: n. 叛乱；反抗；谋反；不服从

sentences.chinese: 老师们安慰焦急的父母。

trans: v. 重新组装；重新集合

sentences.chinese: 得把这些设备拆开来，到各个新的地方重新组装。

sentences.chinese: 农民们俯身收割小麦。

detailed_translations.english: to cut and collect a crop of grain

trans: n. （美）房地产经纪人

sentences.english: In england they call a realtor a land agent .
sentences.chinese: 在英国他们叫作房地产经纪人。

sentences.english: Finding a house to buy was complicated enough. But that's nothing compared to all the paperwork my realtor is asking me to sign.
sentences.chinese: 这个人说，找到合适的房子已经够麻烦的了，但这跟经纪人让我签字的那些文件相比，简直就是小巫见大巫。

sentences.english: Only if you can read Chinese. These shops are restaurants, realtor, acupuncture, clinics, building materials and furniture stores. This is a sensationalized news piece.
sentences.chinese: 如果你认识中文，你会发现这些商铺是餐馆、房产中介公司、针灸按摩、诊所、建材和家具店。这是一篇耸人听闻的新闻。

detailed_translations.english: A Realtor is a person whose job is to sell houses, buildings, and land, and who is a member of the National Association of Realtors

trans: n. 不动产，房地产

name: readiness
trans: n. 准备就绪；预备；欣然；敏捷

detailed_translations.chinese: 敏捷，迅速；准备就绪；愿意

sentences.chinese: 一个男人在他的盥洗室里有五件东西：一把牙刷，剃须膏，剃刀，一盒肥皂和从假日旅馆顺来的一条毛巾。

sentences.chinese: 他通过说服自己确实是在促进和平来进一步使自己的行为合理化。

sentences.chinese: 公园管理员

sentences.chinese: 虽然开局不顺，但他振作精神，最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。

sentences.chinese: …自家煮的放有红糖和葡萄干的麦片粥。

sentences.english: a railway company
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司

detailed_translations.english: a system of tracks along which trains run, or a system of trains

name: raider

name: rage

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动

name: rag

sentences.english: He was wiping his hands on an oily rag.
sentences.chinese: 他正用一块油腻腻的抹布擦手。

to laugh at someone or play tricks on them

name: raft

sentences.english: The company has launched a whole raft of new software products.
sentences.chinese: 公司推出了大量新软件产品。

name: radius

sentences.chinese: 爆炸引起的剧烈震动在方圆40英里内都能感觉得到。

sentences.english: They are proposing radical changes to the way the company is run.
sentences.chinese: 他们建议对公司经营模式进行重大改革。

sentences.english: a radical reform of the tax system
sentences.chinese: 税收制度的彻底改革

sentences.english: There are radical differences between the two organizations.
sentences.chinese: 这两个组织有着根本差异。

sentences.chinese: 我们排放汽车散热器中的气。

sentences.english: When her cellphone rang in class one day, the teacher smashed it against the radiator.

sentences.english: It still has dingy corridors, ancient washrooms, rusting bunk beds (six to a room), a single fluorescent bulb hanging from the ceiling and an ancient radiator in front of the window.

sentences.chinese: 针对狗肥胖症的流行程度和风险因素获得流行病学数据。

trans: vt. & vi. 开药方; 指示 规定, 指定遵守

sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

name: prerogative
trans: n. 权利,特权 大主教法庭 总督委任组成的法庭

sentences.chinese: 迟到是女人的特权。

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["the rights of kings and queens"],"COLLOINEXA":["the royal prerogative"]}
sentences.chinese: 君主特权

detailed_translations.english: a right that someone has, especially because of their importance or social position

name: prerequisite
trans: n. 先决条件；前提
adj. 作为前提的；必备的

sentences.chinese: 一个人有雄心壮志是成功的先决条件。

sentences.chinese: 历史的变革使绣花鞋的制作与刺绣水平成为当地评价一个姑娘心灵手巧的先决条件。

sentences.english: Anyone has the possibility to succeed, but the prerequisite of success is your own, both industry knowledge learning and the cultivation of innovation ability, requires great effort.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都有成功的可能性，但成功的先决条件在于你自身，无论是行业知识的学习还是创新能力的培养，都需要付出极大的努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必备的， 作为先决条件的

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary before something else can happen or be done

trans: adj. 反常的,荒谬的;荒谬可笑的

sentences.english: The whole idea sounds absolutely preposterous!
sentences.chinese: 整个想法听起来荒谬透顶！

detailed_translations.english: completely unreasonable or silly

trans: adj. 首位的；初次的；女主角的
vi. 初次公演；首次露面

sentences.chinese: 这位23岁的年轻演员，在粉丝们的热情欢呼声中到达了莱斯雷特广场，今晚是他最新电影《记住我》的首映式。

sentences.english: The documentary premiered at the Jerusalem Film Festival.
sentences.chinese: 那部记录片在耶路撒冷电影节上首映。

sentences.english: Four astronauts visited for last week's premiere of the movie Space Station.
sentences.chinese: 四位宇航员到场参加了上个星期举行的电影《空间站》的首映式。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首位的；初次的；女主角的

detailed_translations.english: When a movie or show premieres or is premiered, it is shown to an audience for the first time
The premiere of a new play or movie is the first public performance of it

name: prelude
trans: n. 前奏；序幕；[音]前奏曲
vt. 成为…的序幕；演奏…作为前奏曲

sentences.english: Living together as a prelude to marriage is now considered acceptable in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 婚前同居如今在许多国家都已被接受。

detailed_translations.english: if an event is a prelude to a more important event, it happens just before it and makes people expect it

detailed_translations.chinese: 成为…的序幕；演奏…作为前奏曲

name: preliminary
trans: adj. 初步的；预备的；开始的
n. 初步行动；准备；初步措施

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition
sentences.chinese: 竞赛的预赛阶段

sentences.english: a preliminary draft
sentences.chinese: 初稿

detailed_translations.english: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 初步做法， 起始行为

trans: vt. 预先加热

name: prefabricate
trans: vt. 预制
n. 预制

detailed_translations.chinese: 预先制造；预先构思；预制构件

name: preemptive
trans: adj. 优先购买的；先发制人的

sentences.chinese: 对一个主权国家进行先发制人的攻击会引起道德和法律上的争议。

detailed_translations.english: A preemptive attack or strike is intended to weaken or damage an enemy or opponent, for example, by destroying their weapons before they can do any harm

name: predominantly
trans: adv. 占主导地位地;占优势地;显著地

sentences.chinese: 该风景看上去主要保留了乡村风貌。

detailed_translations.english: You use predominantly to indicate which feature or quality is most noticeable in a situation

sentences.chinese: 该国的经济困境

sentences.chinese: 她到办事处去说明她的难处。

trans: n. 前任, 前辈 (被取代的)原有事物, 前身

sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

trans: n. 先驱;先行者;先兆,前兆 初期形式

sentences.chinese: 它被视为更宽泛的数据开放运动的先导，它将像我们在互联网时代看到的所有重要的事物一样重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that happened or existed before something else and influenced its development

trans: vt. 妨碍；排除；阻止

sentences.english: rules that preclude experimentation in teaching methods
sentences.chinese: 禁止进行教学方法试验的规定

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something or make something impossible
