trans: vt. 促成；使 ... 沉淀；猛摔
n. 沉淀物；冷凝物 adj. 仓促的；迅猛的；感情用事的

sentences.english: The riot was precipitated when four black men were arrested.
sentences.chinese: 这场骚乱是因为四名黑人男子的被捕而突然引发的。

sentences.english: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们不应该做出仓促的决定。

detailed_translations.english: a solid substance that has been chemically separated from a liquid

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉淀；促成；猛抛；使陷入

detailed_translations.chinese: 突如其来的；猛地落下的；急促的

sentences.english: Vets took precautions to prevent the spread of the disease.
sentences.chinese: 兽医们为防止疾病蔓延采取了预防措施。

trans: adj. 依靠机会的; 不确定的 不安全的; 不稳固的

sentences.english: the company’s precarious financial position

vi. 鼓吹；说教；讲道；宣扬

sentences.chinese: 他游历南方各州宣讲福音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说教；讲道；鼓吹；传道；反复灌输

sentences.chinese: 明虾三明治

sentences.english: prawn cocktail (= a small dish of prawns in a sauce with some salad )
sentences.chinese: 大虾冷盘

detailed_translations.english: a small pink  shellfish  that can be eaten

detailed_translations.english: a trick, especially one which is played on someone to make them look silly
to dress or decorate showily or gaudily

sentences.chinese: 大约有160种珍稀鸟类栖息在这里的沼泽地和大草原上。

sentences.chinese: 有多少个下午，我同安东妮亚在大草原上这种壮丽的景色中慢慢地走着啊！

sentences.chinese: 威廉斯在管理问题上采用的是一种更务实的做法。

sentences.chinese: 咖喱粉

sentences.english: talcum powder
sentences.chinese: 滑石[爽身]粉

sentences.chinese: 把糖碾成粉末。

sentences.chinese: 一笔几百万英镑的生意

sentences.english: a five pound note
sentences.chinese: 五英镑的纸币

sentences.chinese: 她捣碎了玉米粒。

detailed_translations.english: a card that can be sent in the post without an envelope, especially one with a picture on it

sentences.chinese: 拍卖会过后几天我们才正式拿到那辆车。

sentences.chinese: ...一群记者。

sentences.english: ''Yes, he is only 33, but I think we should look at him just as a man on his own, a different manager - yes from Portugal, but a different individual, and just give him a chance to succeed.
sentences.chinese: 确实，他只有33岁，但是我认为他应该看到他自我的一面，是一名不同于别人（穆里尼奥）的教练——虽然也来自葡萄牙，但是拥有不同的风格。 只有认识到这一点他才可能成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 葡萄牙(欧洲西南部国家)

name: portrayal

sentences.chinese: …西蒙纳·马蒂尼创作的福音传道者圣约翰的感人画像。

sentences.chinese: 浪漫主义艺术家描绘的大自然是狂野而强大的。

sentences.chinese: 全家福

sentences.chinese: 她已受托为杰克逊画肖像。

sentences.chinese: 火箭的前部脱落了。

sentences.english: Do you have any children’s portions?

sentences.chinese: 瓷花瓶

sentences.chinese: 将所有的配料，连同一撮盐，放进食品加工机里。

sentences.english: When you read the testimony and examine the data, legalisation seems more of a present to a pimp and a trafficker than the courage and pragmatism of an enlightened society.
sentences.chinese: 当你阅读证词和检视数据时，你会发现与一个开明社会的勇气和实用主义相比，卖淫合法化更像是给予皮条客和贩子的一份礼物。

sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，这些性工作者是自愿参加的。 但是皮条客承认也会使用勒索，暴力，和毒品来迫使这些年轻女性进行合作。

sentences.english: The driver's window rolls down, and a female pimp — known by the girls, almost lovingly, as a Mamachka — leans inside to negotiate a price.
sentences.chinese: 车窗摇了下来，车内的女皮条客斜着身子倚着车窗和女孩们谈着价儿。 车里的这个女人就是他们熟知的“琦卡妈咪”。

detailed_translations.english: a man who makes money by controlling  prostitute s

name: pilot
trans: n. 领航员；飞行员

sentences.chinese: 航空公司飞行员

sentences.english: a fighter pilot
sentences.chinese: 战斗机驾驶员

sentences.english: The official report into the accident says that it was caused by pilot error (= a mistake by the pilot ) .
sentences.chinese: 那宗事故的官方报告称事故是由飞行员失误造成的。

sentences.english: The plan is to launch a pilot programme next summer.
sentences.chinese: 计划是在明年夏天实施一个试验性方案。

to guide an aircraft, spacecraft, or ship as its pilot

trans: n. 行窃,偷盗

trans: n. 猪尾；辫子；一种辫状烟卷

sentences.chinese: 画家桑迪·李在她的作品中使用天然颜料。

sentences.english: She felt foolish and unsure under his piercing gaze .
sentences.chinese: 在他洞悉一切的注视下，她觉得自己很愚昧，没有自信。

sentences.chinese: 浪花拍击着桥墩。

a process that is piecemeal happens slowly and in stages that are not regular or planned properly

sentences.english: a selection of cold meats and pickles
sentences.chinese: 精选的冷肉和腌菜

sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: It has at least one gene necessary for photosynthesis—so far it’s the only animal known with this ability.

sentences.chinese: 在撒哈拉沙漠下方，横贯非洲中部的植被带颜色非常深，因为植物由于光合作用吸收了大多数太阳光。

sentences.chinese: 但是随着海水变暖，它的层次会更加分明，温度更高的海水会停留在表面，而这里正是生物体进行光合作用必需的地方。

sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

sentences.chinese: 通宵药店

sentences.chinese: 制药业

sentences.english: " since a forest of petrochemical facilities and industrial sprawl lines the freeways and railways in the northern part of the state near New York.
sentences.chinese: 因为在新泽西州靠近纽约的北部地区，高速路和铁路两侧遍布着由石化厂和工业区构成的“森林”。

sentences.english: It is strong in chemical and petrochemical, automobile and engineering, agro and food processing, textiles and jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 在化工、石化、汽车、工程、农业和食品加工、纺织品和珠宝方面具有优势。

sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

sentences.chinese: 这种花有七片花瓣。

sentences.chinese: 那里是一再发生瘟疫的策源地。

sentences.chinese: 他们被那年严冬的饥荒与瘟疫逼疯了。

sentences.chinese: 他们喷撒杀虫剂给马铃薯除虫。

sentences.english: This resulted in the contamination of the bags used in that facility's fluid bed dryers with pesticide contamination.
sentences.chinese: 这导致了由于工厂的流体床干燥器被杀虫剂污染而把使用的包装袋污染。

sentences.chinese: 日本调查人员在其中至少一袋涉及中毒案的饺子的外包装袋上发现了刺孔以及杀虫剂的痕迹。

sentences.chinese: 电视暴力腐蚀了孩子们的心灵。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose sexual behaviour is considered unnatural and unacceptable

name: perverse

sentences.english: He gets perverse satisfaction from embarrassing people.
sentences.chinese: 他通过使人难堪获得变态的满足感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 堕落的，不正当的；倔强的；违反常情的

name: pervasive

sentences.english: the pervasive influence of television
sentences.chinese: 电视无所不在的影响

sentences.english: the all-pervasive mood of apathy

detailed_translations.chinese: 普遍的；到处渗透的；流行的
detailed_translations.english: existing everywhere

name: pertain

detailed_translations.english: If one thing pertains to another, it relates, belongs, or applies to it

sentences.english: In either case it is persuasive because there is somebody whom it persuades.
sentences.chinese: 不管在那种情况下，它之所以有说服力，是因为有人被说服了。

sentences.english: Providing examples of what others are saying about your suitability and skills is extremely persuasive and the more you have, the more your influence rises.
sentences.chinese: 举例说明别人对你的适合性和技能的评价十分有说服力，这样的例子越多，你的影响力增长的就越大。

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: perspicacious
trans: adj. 有洞察力的;判断力强的;有识别力的

sentences.english: ...one of the most perspicacious and perceptive historians of that period.
sentences.chinese: ...那个时期最敏锐、最有洞察力的历史学家之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有洞察力的；聪颖的；敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: good at judging and understanding people and situations

sentences.chinese: 他成了20世纪80年代金融过热时期的一个典型。

sentences.chinese: 这柿子涩。

sentences.english: Outside, a flock of white birds dip over gray-tiled rooftops and persimmon trees.
sentences.chinese: 窗外，一群白色的鸽子停在灰色的屋瓦上，点缀在柿子树丛里。

sentences.english: a partial solution to traffic congestion in Oxford
sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.english: I might be accused of being partial.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会被人指责是偏袒的。

detailed_translations.english: not complete

name: parsimonious
trans: adj. 过分节俭的;吝啬的;小气的

detailed_translations.chinese: 吝啬的；过于节俭的；质量差的
detailed_translations.english: extremely unwilling to spend money

name: paroxysm
trans: n. （疾病周期性）发作；突发

sentences.english: He exploded in a paroxysm of rage.
sentences.chinese: 他突然勃然大怒。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden expression of strong feeling that you cannot control

name: parlor
trans: n. 客厅；会客室；业务室
adj. 客厅的

sentences.english: The parlor overlooks the street.
sentences.chinese: 这客厅可俯瞰街道。

sentences.english: One day, she said, as she was leaving the priest’s parlor, he pulled her aside for a passionate kiss.
sentences.chinese: 她说，一天，在她离开那位牧师的客厅时，他把她拉到一边，激情地吻了她。

sentences.english: I thought maybe Grandpa came over and sat around the den or parlor or whatever for years before he proposed.
sentences.chinese: 我以前以为奶奶来到爷爷家，坐在私室或客厅或什么地方几年，然后爷爷才求婚的。

name: parity
trans: n. 同等；相等；平价

sentences.english: Women have yet to achieve wage or occupational parity in many fields.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们在许多领域尚有待获得薪酬或职业的平等。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平价；同等；相等；胎次；分娩
detailed_translations.english: the state of being equal, especially having equal pay, rights, or power

name: Parisian
trans: adj. 巴黎人的；巴黎的
n. 巴黎人

sentences.english: His images often depict local residents, including this piece, which was part of a 2004 Parisian project called "Portrait of a Generation".
sentences.chinese: 他的图像通常描写当地居民，其中包括这一幅，是2004年巴黎“一代人肖像”项目的组成部分。

sentences.english: He seems the only one to really understand the Parisian mentality, the importance of architecture and politics, grandeur and charm, poetry and citizenship.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎是唯一一个真正了解巴黎精神、结构和政治重要性、城市庄严与魅力、诗情画意和公民权的人。

sentences.english: The tart was so Parisian, I knew it would be a great candidate for our Paris issue—and, of course, people always love chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 这只馅饼实在是太巴黎了，我知道它一定将是这期巴黎特刊的最佳候选----并且，当然啦，人们永远都爱吃巧克力。

detailed_translations.english: someone from the city of Paris in France

name: pariah
trans: n. 贱民（印度的最下阶级）

name: parenthood
trans: n. 父母的身份

sentences.english: Story-reading should be one of the great joys of parenthood.
sentences.chinese: 读故事是做父母的最大快乐之一。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being a parent

name: parenthesis
trans: n. 插入语,插入成分 圆括号 间歇,插曲

sentences.english: In parenthesis, I should add that the results have not yet been proven.
sentences.chinese: 插一句，我想补充的是这些结果还未得到证实。

detailed_translations.english: if you say something in parenthesis, you say it while you are talking about something else in order to add information or explain something

name: pardon
trans: n. 原谅；宽恕；赦免
vt. 原谅；赦免；宽恕

sentences.english: He craved the teacher's pardon.
sentences.chinese: 他恳求老师原谅他。

sentences.english: I earnestly pray for your pardon.
sentences.chinese: 我恳切地请求你原谅。

sentences.english: I hope you will pardon me for doing so.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你原谅我这样做。

detailed_translations.english: to forgive someone for behaving badly
used to say ‘sorry’ after you have made an impolite sound such as a  burp

name: parasite
trans: n. 寄生生物；寄生虫；寄生植物；依赖他人过活者

sentences.english: Kangaroos harbour a vast range of parasites.
sentences.chinese: 袋鼠身上有各种各样的寄生虫。

detailed_translations.english: a plant or animal that lives on or in another plant or animal and gets food from it

name: paranormal
trans: adj. 超常的；超过正常范围的

sentences.english: ghosts and other paranormal phenomena
sentences.chinese: 鬼以及其他超自然现象

detailed_translations.english: paranormal events cannot be explained by science and seem strange and mysterious

name: paranoid
trans: adj. 类似妄想狂的；属于偏执狂的
n. 患妄想狂的人；偏执狂患者

sentences.english: a patient suffering from paranoid schizophrenia
sentences.chinese: 一个偏执型精神分裂症病人

sentences.english: ...these sad, deluded paranoids.
sentences.chinese: …这些可悲的、被蒙蔽的妄想狂们。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似妄想狂的；属于偏执狂的
detailed_translations.english: suffering from a mental illness that makes you believe that other people are trying to harm you

detailed_translations.chinese: 患妄想狂的人；偏执狂患者
detailed_translations.english: A paranoid is someone who is paranoid

name: parametric
trans: adj. 参(变)数的,参(变)量的

name: paramedic
trans: n. 护理人员

name: paralysis
trans: n. 瘫痪；麻痹

sentences.english: paralysis of the lower body
sentences.chinese: 下半身瘫痪

sentences.english: The snake’s poison causes paralysis.
sentences.chinese: 这种蛇的毒液会引起身体麻痹。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body or feel things in it

name: paragon
trans: n. 模范；完美之物；优秀之人
adj. 完美的

sentences.english: We don't expect candidates to be paragons of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 我们不指望候选人都是道德完人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 模范；完美之物；优秀之人
detailed_translations.english: someone who is perfect or is extremely brave, good etc – often used humorously

name: paradox
trans: n. 悖论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的话

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

name: parachute
trans: n. 降落伞；缓降物；[动]翅膜
v. 跳伞；用降落伞空投

sentences.english: a parachute jump
sentences.chinese: 跳伞

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment fastened to the back of people who jump out of planes, which makes them fall slowly and safely to the ground
to jump from a plane using a parachute

name: parabola
trans: n. [数]抛物线

sentences.english: So, we should draw maybe this downward parabola.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以画出这样的开口向下的抛物线。

sentences.english: From this one, you would not expect it to behave like a parabola.
sentences.chinese: 从这一次，你不会期待它，如抛物线般运动。

sentences.english: It is perfectly reasonable to immediately come to that conclusion because of the symmetry of the parabola.
sentences.chinese: 很理所应当的,由于抛物线的对称,立刻就会想到这个结论。

detailed_translations.english: a curve in the shape of the imaginary line an object makes when it is thrown high in the air and comes down a little distance away

name: par
trans: n. 同等；等位；常态；票面价值；[体]标准杆数
adj. 票面的；平常的；标准的

sentences.english: The last hole is a par five.
sentences.chinese: 最后一洞的标准杆数为五杆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准；票面价值；平均数量
detailed_translations.english: the number of  stroke s  a good player should take to hit the ball into a hole in the game of  golf

name: paprika
trans: n. 辣椒粉；红辣椒
adj. 用红辣椒烹制的

name: papaya
trans: n. 木瓜；番木瓜树

name: Paparazzi
trans: 狗仔队

name: pantsuit
trans: n. 长裤与衣相配成套的便服；裤套装

name: pantry
trans: n. 食品储藏室；餐具室

detailed_translations.english: a very small room in a house where food is kept

name: panting
trans: v. 脉动；晃动（pant的ing形式）
adj. 喘气的

name: panther
trans: n. 豹；美洲豹；黑豹

detailed_translations.english: a large wild animal that is black and a member of the cat family

name: panoramic
trans: adj. 全景的

sentences.english: The terrain's high points provide a panoramic view of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 这一地带的制高点可以看见洛杉矶的全景。

detailed_translations.english: If you have a panoramic view, you can see a long way over a wide area

name: panic
trans: n. 恐慌，惊慌；大恐慌
adj. 恐慌的；没有理由的

sentences.english: Her face distorted in panic.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸因恐慌而变相了。

sentences.english: The panic-stricken fled in all directions.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌的人群向四面八方逃去。

sentences.english: They ascribed courage to me for something I did out of sheer panic.
sentences.chinese: 由于我纯粹因惊慌而做的事，他们认为我很有勇气。

name: pander
trans: v. 迎合；拉皮条
n. 拉皮条者

sentences.english: He has offended the party's traditional base by pandering to the rich and the middle classes.
sentences.chinese: 他迎合富人和中产阶级，触犯了该党的传统基础。

detailed_translations.english: If you pander to someone or to their wishes, you do everything that they want, often to get some advantage for yourself

name: pancreas
trans: n. 胰腺

sentences.english: And actually it damages the pancreas itself, after a while.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，一段时间之后它对胰腺本身也会产生伤害。

sentences.english: In people with diabetes, however, the pancreas either produces little or no insulin, or the cells do not respond appropriately to the insulin that is produced.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有糖尿病的人，胰腺要么生成一点或根本没有生成胰岛素，或者是细胞没有正确的反应胰腺分泌的胰岛素。

sentences.english: The scientists claim the rat stem cells grew in the niche left by the absent mouse pancreas and so almost any organ could be produced in this way.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们声称大鼠干细胞刚好在小白鼠缺失的胰腺所在位置生长，所以几乎任何器官都可以通过这种方法生成。

detailed_translations.english: a  gland  inside your body, near your stomach, that produces  insulin  and a liquid that helps your body to use the food that you eat

name: pancake
trans: n. 薄烤饼；粉饼；平降（全称pancake landing）
vi. 平坠着陆；平展

sentences.english: The classic example is tossing a pancake so it flips over in mid-air.
sentences.chinese: 最经典的例子是摊薄饼的时候，颠勺时薄饼就会飞到半空中。

sentences.english: The package says baking and pancake mix, but the pancakes were not tasty without some major tweaking to the recipe.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上说烤焙与薄饼面料混合，但没有添加一些主要调料，薄饼是不好吃的。

sentences.english: They are so-called “ pancake people ”, they no longer concentrate their energies on one area of interest, but instead choose to spread themselves thinly over a large area.
sentences.chinese: 他们就是所谓的“煎饼人”，他们不再将精力专注于某一个感兴趣的领域，而是让自己的关注点浅浅地散布在一个很大的范围。

detailed_translations.english: a thin flat round cake made from flour, milk, and eggs, that has been cooked in a flat pan and is eaten hot

name: pamphlet
trans: n. 小册子

sentences.english: a political pamphlet
sentences.chinese: 政治宣传册

detailed_translations.english: a very thin book with paper covers, that gives information about something

name: palpitate
trans: vi. ① (心脏)悸动,突突跳,急速地跳动 颤抖

sentences.english: He felt suddenly faint, and his heart began to palpitate.
sentences.chinese: 他突然感到晕厥，心脏也开始悸动。

detailed_translations.english: If someone's heart palpitates, it beats very fast in an irregular way, because they are frightened or anxious

name: palmer
trans: n. 朝圣者；变戏法的人；毛虫（尤指北美的小舌麦蛾幼虫）

name: pallets
trans: n. 货盘；简陋的小床；盾上纹章的垂直条纹；踏板（pallet的复数）

name: pallet
trans: n. 简陋的小床；托盘

name: pallbearer
trans: n. 护柩者；棺侧送葬者

name: palette
trans: n. 颜料；调色板

sentences.english: The painter's right hand holds the brush, the left the palette.
sentences.chinese: 那位画家的右手握着画笔，左手拿着调色盘。

detailed_translations.english: a thin curved board that an artist uses to mix paints, holding it by putting his or her thumb through a hole at the edge

name: Palestinian
trans: adj. 巴勒斯坦的；巴勒斯坦人的
n. 巴勒斯坦；巴勒斯坦人

name: pale
trans: adj. 苍白的；暗淡的；无力的
n. 前哨；栅栏；范围

sentences.english: He looked very pale and drawn.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去非常苍白憔悴。

sentences.english: pale blue curtains
sentences.chinese: 淡蓝色的窗帘

detailed_translations.chinese: 苍白的,灰白的；浅的,暗淡的
detailed_translations.english: having a skin colour that is very white, or whiter than it usually is

name: palatability
trans: n. 嗜食性; 适口性;风味

name: palace
trans: n. 宫殿；豪华住宅；宅邸

sentences.english: Buckingham Palace
sentences.chinese: 白金汉宫

detailed_translations.english: the official home of a person of very high rank, especially a king or queen – often used in names

name: paganism
trans: n. 异教；异教信仰；不信教

name: paedophile
trans: n. 恋童癖者

name: paediatrics
trans: n. [医]小儿科

name: padlock
trans: n. 挂锁；关闭；禁止进入
vt. 用挂锁锁上；关闭

sentences.english: He undid the padlock and eased back the lid.
sentences.chinese: 他打开挂锁，轻轻推开箱盖。

sentences.english: Eddie parked his bicycle against a lamppost and padlocked it.
sentences.chinese: 艾迪把他的自行车停靠在一根路灯柱上，然后用挂锁锁上了。

detailed_translations.english: a lock that you can put on a gate, door, bicycle etc
If you padlock something, you lock it or fasten it to something else using a padlock

name: pad
trans: n. 衬垫；护具；便笺簿；填补
vi. 步行；放轻脚步走

sentences.english: Use an abrasive pad for stubborn stains.
sentences.chinese: 用百洁布擦洗顽固污渍。

sentences.english: Keep a telephone pad and a pen to hand.
sentences.chinese: 手边准备一本电话记事簿和一支笔。

sentences.english: All the sharp corners were padded with foam.
sentences.chinese: 所有的棱角都垫上了泡沫塑料。

detailed_translations.english: a thick flat object made of cloth or rubber, used to protect or clean something, or to make something more comfortable
to put a layer of soft material in or on sth in order to protect it, make it thicker or change its shape

name: packed
trans: adj. （常用来构成复合词）充满…的，塞满了…的
v. 包装（pack的过去分词）

sentences.english: a packed courtroom
sentences.chinese: 挤满人的法庭

detailed_translations.english: extremely full of people

name: pacemaker
trans: n. 领跑者,带头人,标兵,起搏器

sentences.english: She was fitted with a pacemaker after suffering serious heart trouble.
sentences.chinese: 她在心脏出了严重问题后装上了心脏起搏器。

detailed_translations.chinese: [基医] 起搏器；领跑者；标兵
detailed_translations.english: a small machine that is placed inside someone’s chest in order to help their heart beat regularly

name: oyster
trans: n. 牡蛎，蚝；沉默寡言的人

sentences.english: How can I pull the pearl from the burning oyster?
sentences.chinese: 我怎样做才能算是从燃烧的牡蛎中取出珍珠？

detailed_translations.english: a type of shellfish that can be eaten cooked or uncooked, and that produces a jewel called a pearl

name: owlery
trans: n. 鸮栖息地

name: owl
trans: n. [动]猫头鹰；枭；惯于晚上活动的人

sentences.english: Some of the more extreme contacts give you "cat eyes" or how about "owl eyes"?
sentences.chinese: 一些更酷的隐形眼镜可以给你一双"猫眼"或者是"猫头鹰的眼睛"。

sentences.english: A great owl, with yellow sulphurous eyes, called to him by his name, but he made it no answer.
sentences.chinese: 一只长着黄色硫磺的巨大眼睛的猫头鹰，呼唤着他的名字，但他没有应答。

detailed_translations.english: a bird with large eyes that hunts at night

name: overt
trans: adj. 明显的；公然的；[律]蓄意的

sentences.english: an overt attempt to silence their political opponents
sentences.chinese: 他们想压制政敌言论的明显企图

sentences.english: Overt race discrimination is illegal.
sentences.chinese: 公然的种族歧视是非法的。

detailed_translations.english: overt actions are done publicly, without trying to hide anything

name: overstate
trans: v. 夸大的叙述；夸张

sentences.english: To say that all motorists speed in residential areas is overstating the case.
sentences.chinese: 说所有驾驶员都在住宅区内超速行驶是言过其实了。

sentences.english: The importance of a child’s early years cannot be overstated (= is very important ).
sentences.chinese: 儿童幼年期的重要性怎么强调也不为过。

detailed_translations.english: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is

name: oversight
trans: n. 疏忽, 失察

sentences.english: I assure you that this was purely an oversight on my part.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证，这纯粹是我的一时疏忽。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake in which you forget something or do not notice something

name: overshadow
trans: v. 遮阴；使不快乐或减少乐趣；使黯然失色

sentences.english: Hester is overshadowed by her younger and more attractive sister.
sentences.chinese: 她那更年轻而且更有魅力的妹妹使赫斯特黯然失色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使失色；使阴暗；遮阴；夺去…的光彩
detailed_translations.english: If you are overshadowed by a person or thing, you are less successful, important, or impressive than they are

name: override
trans: vt. 推翻；不顾；践踏
n. 代理佣金

sentences.english: The president vetoed the bill, and the Senate failed by a single vote to override his veto.
sentences.chinese: 总统否决了议案，而参议院因一票之差未能推翻他的否决。

detailed_translations.english: If someone in authority overrides a person or their decisions, they cancel their decisions

name: overlap
trans: n. 重叠；重复
vi. 部分重叠；部分的同时发生

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: overhaul
trans: vt. 彻底检查;大修 赶上,追上;超越
n. 检查;大修

sentences.english: The car needs a complete overhaul.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车需要大修。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
detailed_translations.english: necessary changes or repairs made to a machine or system

detailed_translations.chinese: 仔细检查； 彻底检修
detailed_translations.english: to repair or change the necessary parts in a machine, system etc that is not working correctly

name: overdraw
trans: vt. 拉过度；透支；夸张
vi. 透支；夸张

sentences.english: What if I overdraw?
sentences.chinese: 如果透支了怎么办？

sentences.english: Both of these problems can lead to extremely high levels of overdraw.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题都会导致严重的透支。

sentences.english: Particles: reduce overdraw, use the simplest possible shaders.
sentences.chinese: 例子系统：降低透支，使用尽可能简单的着色器。

detailed_translations.english: to draw on (a bank account) in excess of the credit balance

name: overbearing
trans: adj. 专横的,傲慢的 难忍的

sentences.english: a bossy overbearing wife
sentences.chinese: 专横霸道的妻子

detailed_translations.english: always trying to control other people without considering their wishes or feelings

name: overall
trans: adj. 全部的；全体的；一切在内的
adv. 总的说来；全部地

sentences.english: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
sentences.chinese: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。

sentences.english: The overall result is an increase in population.
sentences.chinese: 总的结果是人口增加。

sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.

sentences.chinese: 职业病

sentences.english: Getting injured is an occupational hazard (= a risk that always exists in a particular job or activity ) of the sport.
sentences.chinese: 受伤是这项运动的职业性危害。

detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by your job

name: obtuse
trans: adj. 钝的；不尖的；钝角的；愚钝的

sentences.english: ‘But why?’ said Charles, being deliberately obtuse.
sentences.chinese: “但是为什么呢？”查尔斯故意傻傻地说道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 迟钝的；圆头的；不锋利的
detailed_translations.english: slow to understand things, in a way that is annoying

name: obtrude
trans: vt. 逼使；强迫；冲出
vi. 打扰；闯入；强加于人

sentences.english: I should not obtrude my affairs so much on the notice of my readers if very particular inquiries had not been made by my townsmen concerning my mode of life.
sentences.chinese: 如果我的生活方式已经被我的乡邻们详细的调查出来的话我是不会强迫我的读者来注意我的锁事的。

name: obstacle
trans: n. 障碍，干扰；妨害物

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: obsolete
trans: adj. 老式的；废弃的
n. 废词；陈腐的人

sentences.english: obsolete weapons
sentences.chinese: 已被淘汰的武器

sentences.english: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
sentences.chinese: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件

sentences.english: Will computers render (= make ) books obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

detailed_translations.english: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented

name: obsolescence
trans: n. 废弃 陈旧过时 (器官的)废退

sentences.english: Requirements volatility stems largely from the rapid pace at which underlying system technologies change; this leads to early obsolescence of designs and components that might otherwise be reusable.
sentences.chinese: 在底层系统技术以快速的步伐发生变化时，需求变动性就会大量地滋生；这会导致设计和组件的提早退化，否则它们是可重用的。

name: obsidian
trans: n. [矿]黑曜石

sentences.english: The Texas show includes an obsidian mask that likely traveled to Khara Khorum all the way from Egypt, Lessem says.
sentences.chinese: 德克萨斯州展出包括了一个黑曜石面具，可能是从埃及被带到哈喇和林来的，莱塞姆说。

detailed_translations.english: a type of rock that looks like black glass

name: obsessed
trans: adj. 着迷的；无法摆脱的
v. 着迷（obsess的过去式）；纠缠

sentences.english: He was obsessed with gangster movies.
sentences.chinese: 他那时迷上了警匪片。

detailed_translations.english: If someone is obsessed with a person or thing, they keep thinking about them and find it difficult to think about anything else

name: observing
trans: adj. 注意的,留心的

name: observatory
trans: n. 天文台；气象台；了望台

sentences.english: An observatory on the back side of the Moon would be a giant leap for astronomy, but there is a for more important reason to return.
sentences.chinese: 即使仅仅在月球的背面设置一个天文台，也将为天文学带来革命性的突破，何况月球的价值远远不止这些。

sentences.english: With a full-power observatory in place, that explanation, as well as a better explanation of high-energy astrophysical phenomena throughout the universe, may be available in the years to come.
sentences.chinese: 一个满负荷运作的观测站的到位，对那些热点的解释，以及对遍及宇宙的高能天文学现象的更好的解释，将会在今年内成为可能。

name: obscure
trans: adj. 无名的；鲜为人知的；晦涩的；模糊的
v. 遮掩；掩盖；使晦涩

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: obscenity
trans: n. 淫秽;猥亵;下流 淫秽的词语或行为

sentences.english: laws against obscenity
sentences.chinese: 禁止淫秽内容的法律

detailed_translations.chinese: 猥亵，淫秽；猥亵的言语（或行为）
detailed_translations.english: sexually offensive language or behaviour, especially in a book, play, film etc

name: obnoxious
trans: adj. 可憎的；不愉快的；讨厌的

sentences.english: She’s really obnoxious.
sentences.chinese: 她这人真讨厌。

sentences.english: an obnoxious idea
sentences.chinese: 令人作呕的念头

sentences.english: obnoxious odours
sentences.chinese: 难闻的气味

detailed_translations.chinese: 讨厌的；可憎的；不愉快的
detailed_translations.english: very offensive, unpleasant, or rude

name: oblige
trans: vt. 强制；赐，施恩惠；迫使；责成
vi. 帮忙；施恩惠

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

name: obligation
trans: n. 义务; 责任

sentences.english: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
sentences.chinese: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。

sentences.english: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
sentences.chinese: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。

sentences.english: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
sentences.chinese: 你不必非要买更多的书。

sentences.english: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
sentences.chinese: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。

sentences.english: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
sentences.chinese: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务

sentences.english: The government must pay for health care for war veterans – it is an obligation we owe to them.
sentences.chinese: 政府必须为退伍军人支付医疗保健费用——这是我们对他们负有的义务。

sentences.english: a moral obligation to help the poor
sentences.chinese: 帮助穷人的道德义务

sentences.english: He stayed with the team out of a sense of obligation.
sentences.chinese: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

detailed_translations.english: a moral or legal duty to do something

name: obedience
trans: n. 服从;顺从;听话

sentences.english: obedience classes for dogs and their owners
sentences.chinese: 为狗和主人安排的服从训练课

detailed_translations.english: when someone does what they are told to do, or what a law, rule etc says they must do

name: oatmeal
trans: n. 燕麦粥；燕麦片

name: oath
trans: n. 誓言，誓约；诅咒，咒骂

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: oat
trans: n. 燕麦；麦片粥，燕麦粥

sentences.english: Instead of eating hunched pleasurably over a book, I look out of the window and chew every mouthful thoroughly, aware of every single oat and nut and dried bit of apple as it goes down.
sentences.chinese: 送孩子们去学校后，我不再放松地边吃早饭边看书，而是盯着窗外，仔细地嚼着嘴里的食物：每一粒燕麦、每一颗坚果、每一片苹果干。

sentences.english: For example, you may not think a bagel tastes salty, but a typical 4-inch (10-centimeter) oat-bran bagel has about 532 mg of sodium, and even a slice of whole-wheat bread contains 132 mg of sodium.
sentences.chinese: 例如百吉饼或许尝起来不咸，但一块普普通通的4英寸（10厘米）大的燕麦百吉饼却含将近532毫克的钠，而且即便一小块全麦面包也有132毫克钠。

detailed_translations.english: an erect annual grass, Avena sativa, grown in temperate regions for its edible seed

name: oasis
trans: n. 绿洲；舒适的地方；令人宽慰的事物

sentences.english: The immaculately tended gardens are an oasis in the midst of Cairo's urban sprawl.
sentences.chinese: 那些打理得非常整洁的花园是杂乱扩张的开罗市区中的一片绿洲。

detailed_translations.english: a place with water and trees in a desert

name: nutty
trans: adj. 多坚果的；产坚果的；古怪的

name: nuts
trans: adj. 热衷的；发狂的；狂热的
int. 胡说；呸

name: nurture
trans: vt. 养育；鼓励；培植
n. 养育；教养；营养物

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: numinous
trans: adj. 精神上的；超自然的；神圣的；庄严的

sentences.english: The account of spiritual struggle that follows has a humbling and numinous power.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的关于精神挣扎的叙述有一种令人谦卑和神圣的力量。

detailed_translations.english: having a mysterious and holy quality, which makes you feel that God is present

name: numerical
trans: adj. 数字的；用数字表示的

sentences.english: a numerical code
sentences.chinese: 数字密码

sentences.english: The home team tried to utilize their numerical advantage (= the fact that they had more players than the other team ).
sentences.chinese: 主队试图利用他们在人数上的优势。

sentences.english: Make sure the files are organized in numerical order.
sentences.chinese: 务必把这些档案按数字顺序排列。

detailed_translations.english: expressed or considered in numbers

name: numerator
trans: n. (分数的)分子

sentences.english: You have to enter numerator and denominator.
sentences.chinese: 您需要输入结果的分子和分母。

sentences.english: In this exercise you have to convert a given number into a fraction by entering numerator and denominator. Do not forget to reduce the result!
sentences.chinese: 在此练习中您要将一个给定的数字转换成一个分数，输入转化结果的分子和分母。不要忘了将结果约分至最简分数！

sentences.english: In this exercise you have to convert a given number into a fraction by entering a numerator and denominator. Do not forget to reduce the result.
sentences.chinese: 在此练习中您要将一个给定的数字转换成一个分数，输入转化结果的分子和分母。不要忘了将结果约分至最简分数。

detailed_translations.english: the number above the line in a fraction, for example 5 is the numerator in 5/6

name: numbing
trans: adj. 使失去感觉的；使麻木的
v. 麻木；失去知觉（numb的ing形式）

name: nuisance
trans: n. 讨厌的东西[人, 行为]

sentences.english: He could be a bit of a nuisance when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉时会是一个有点令人讨厌的人。

detailed_translations.english: a person, thing, or situation that annoys you or causes problems

name: nugget
trans: n. 天然金块，矿块；珍闻，珍品

name: nudge
trans: n. 用肘轻推；推动；没完没了抱怨的人
vt. 用肘轻推；推进；向…不停地唠叨

sentences.english: She slipped her arm under his and gave him a nudge.
sentences.chinese: 她迅速地把胳膊放在他的胳膊下面，给了他轻轻一推。

detailed_translations.chinese: 推动；用肘轻推；没完没了抱怨的人
detailed_translations.english: Nudge is also a noun

detailed_translations.chinese: 推进；用肘轻推；向…不停地唠叨
detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone a short distance by gently pushing

name: nuanced
trans: adj. 微妙的；具有细微差别的
v. 精确细腻地表演；细致入微地描绘（nuance的过去分词）

name: nuance
trans: n. （外表、意义、声音等的）细微差别

sentences.english: He was aware of every nuance in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 他听得出她声音中的每一个细微变化。

sentences.english: subtle nuances of meaning
sentences.chinese: 含义的细微差别

detailed_translations.english: a very slight, hardly noticeable difference in manner, colour, meaning etc

name: nozzle
trans: n. 喷嘴；管口；鼻

sentences.english: If he put his finger over the nozzle he could produce a forceful spray.
sentences.chinese: 如果他把手指按在喷嘴上，就可以产生强力的喷射。

detailed_translations.english: a part that is fitted to the end of a hose, pipe etc to direct and control the stream of liquid or gas pouring out

name: nowhere
trans: adv. 无处；任何地方都不；毫无结果
n. 无处；任何地方；无名之地

sentences.english: Nowhere is drug abuse more of a problem than in the US.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么地方的吸毒问题比美国更严重。

detailed_translations.english: not in any place or to any place

name: novelty
trans: n. 新奇；新奇的事物；新颖小巧而廉价的物品

sentences.english: Many toys have no attraction beyond their novelty value.
sentences.chinese: 许多玩具除了有些新奇感之外，别无吸引力。

sentences.english: Then the Internet was still something of a novelty.
sentences.chinese: 那时因特网还是个挺新鲜的东西。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being new, unusual, and interesting

name: novelist
trans: n. 小说家

sentences.english: The key to success as a romantic novelist is absolute belief in your story.
sentences.chinese: 一个浪漫派小说家成功的关键在于对自己故事的绝对信念。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes novels

name: nous
trans: n. [哲]精神；[哲]心灵；[哲]理性；[口]常识

name: notorious
trans: adj. 臭名昭著的

sentences.english: a notorious computer hacker
sentences.chinese: 声名狼藉的电脑黑客

sentences.english: notorious cases of human rights abuses
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的践踏人权案

detailed_translations.english: famous or well-known for something bad

name: notch
trans: n. 刻痕，凹口；峡谷；等级
vt. 赢得；用刻痕计算；在…上刻凹痕

sentences.english: Cut a notch near one end of the stick.
sentences.chinese: 在手杖的一端刻一个V形记号。

detailed_translations.english: a V-shaped cut or hole in a surface or edge

name: notation
trans: n. 符号；注释；记号法；乐谱

sentences.english: Musical notation was conceived for the C major scale and each line and space represents a note in this scale.
sentences.chinese: 乐谱为C大音阶而构思，在这个音阶中的每一个线和间都代表一个音符。

detailed_translations.english: a system of written marks or signs used to represent something such as music, mathematics, or scientific ideas

name: notability
trans: n. 显著;值得注意 显著的人;名人

name: nosebleed
trans: n. 鼻出血

sentences.english: Whenever I have a cold I get a nosebleed.
sentences.chinese: 每次我一感冒都会流鼻血。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a nosebleed, blood starts flowing from your nose

name: norm
trans: n. 规范，基准；定额，分配之工作量

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: non-volatile
trans: 非易失性

name: nonstop
trans: adj. 直达的；不休息的；不着陆的
n. 直达车

sentences.english: a nonstop flight to Los Angeles
sentences.chinese: 直飞洛杉矶的航班

sentences.english: Amy and her group had driven nonstop through Spain.
sentences.chinese: 艾米和她的小组成员一刻不停地开车穿过西班牙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直达的；不休息的；不着陆的
detailed_translations.english: without any stops or pauses
Nonstop is also an adverb

name: nonsense
trans: n. 谬论；胡言乱语；愚蠢的行为；毫无意义的话
int. 荒唐

sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

name: non-ferrous
trans: adj. 有色的,非铁或钢的(金属)

name: non-compliance
trans: n. (对命令、规章等的)不服从

name: noncombustible
trans: adj. 不燃的
n. 不燃物

name: nominate
trans: vt. 提名；任命；指定；推荐

sentences.english: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
sentences.chinese: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

sentences.english: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
sentences.chinese: 明年詹克斯先生退休，布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

detailed_translations.english: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

name: nominal
trans: adj. 名义上的；有名无实的；票面上的
n. 名词性词

sentences.english: the nominal head of the rebellion
sentences.chinese: 这次叛乱名义上的领导人

sentences.english: Their conversion to Christianity was only nominal.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是名义上皈依了基督教。

detailed_translations.chinese: 名义上的， 有名无实的； 很少的， 象征性的； 名词性的
detailed_translations.english: officially described as being something, when this is not really true

name: nocturnal
trans: adj. 在夜间的；（指生物）夜间活动的

sentences.english: Hamsters are nocturnal creatures.
sentences.chinese: 仓鼠是夜行动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夜的；夜曲的；夜间发生的
detailed_translations.english: an animal that is nocturnal is active at night

name: noble
trans: adj. 贵族的；高尚的；宏伟的；惰性的
n. 贵族

sentences.english: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
sentences.chinese: 你心地真好，周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。

sentences.english: noble ideals
sentences.chinese: 崇高的理想

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的
detailed_translations.english: morally good or generous in a way that is admired
a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’

name: nitrous
trans: adj. 氮的；硝石的；含氮的

name: nitrogen
trans: n. [化]氮

sentences.english: Well, we know nitrogen has what?
sentences.chinese: 对于氮气我们知道什么？

sentences.english: The plant requires nitrogen in order to make proteins.
sentences.chinese: 植物需要氮以便制造蛋白质。

sentences.english: All of these from the group one and two through the group five and six elements, but what about elements, what about molecules like hydrogen, or nitrogen, or maybe oxygen?
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是来自于第一主族和第二组主族,到第五主族和第六组主族的悬殊，那么元素呢，比如氢气，氮气或氧气那样的分子呢？

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, and that forms most of the Earth’s air. It is a chemical element: symbol N

name: nitrate
trans: n. 硝酸盐
vt. 用硝酸处理

sentences.english: potassium nitrate
sentences.chinese: 硝酸钾

sentences.english: high levels of nitrates in drinking water
sentences.chinese: 饮用水中的大量硝酸盐

detailed_translations.english: the final state of complete knowledge and understanding that is the aim of believers in Buddhism

detailed_translations.english: If you describe something as nightmarish, you mean that it is extremely frightening and unpleasant

trans: adj. 吝啬的；小气的

n. 刻痕；缺口；情况；监狱 n. 尼克(男子名)

sentences.chinese: 这带刺的铁丝在我右眼正下方只留下了极小的划痕。

detailed_translations.english: a very small cut made on the edge or surface of something

sentences.chinese: ...统治阶级和国家间的关联。

detailed_translations.english: a connection or network of connections between a number of people, things, or ideas

sentences.chinese: 该社团一年出版两次简报。

detailed_translations.english: a short written report of news about a club, organization etc that is sent regularly to people who are interested

name: newscaster
trans: n. (电台或电视的)新闻播音员

name: neutrality
trans: n. 中立

sentences.chinese: 网络中立或不?

sentences.english: Some of the nations declared neutrality.
sentences.chinese: 有的国家宣布中立。

sentences.english: Yet in our view, the notion of “search neutrality” threatens innovation, competition and, fundamentally,your ability as a user to improve how you find information.
sentences.chinese: 但在我们看来“搜索中立”这个概念威胁创新，竞争和本质上的，你作为一个用户去提高你寻找信息的能力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of not supporting either side in an argument or war

n. 中立国；中立者；非彩色；齿轮的空档

sentences.english: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
sentences.chinese: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。

sentences.english: Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
sentences.chinese: 克莱夫决定采取中立立场。

sentences.english: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府在会谈中扮演了中立观察员的角色。

detailed_translations.english: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement

name: neuter
trans: n. 无性动物；中性名词；阉割动物
adj. 中性的；不及物的；无性的

name: nestle
trans: v. 依偎；（舒适地）安顿

sentences.english: Sarah lay there peacefully, the child nestling by her side.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉安静地躺在那儿，孩子偎依在她身边。

sentences.english: He nestled his head against her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他把头靠在她的肩膀上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适地坐定；偎依；半隐半现地处于
detailed_translations.english: to move into a comfortable position, pressing your head or body against someone or against something soft

name: nest

vt. 筑巢；嵌套

sentences.english: a bird’s nest
sentences.chinese: 鸟窝

sentences.english: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。

sentences.english: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
sentences.chinese: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

detailed_translations.english: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
to build or use a nest

name: nerve

vt. 鼓起勇气

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: nerd
trans: n. 讨厌的人；呆子

name: Nepalese
trans: n. 尼泊尔人
adj. 尼泊尔的

name: neon
trans: n. [化]氖（10号元素，符号Ne）；霓虹灯

sentences.english: Inert gases like neon and argon have eight electrons in their outer shell.
sentences.chinese: 像氖和氩这样的惰性气体，在它们的外电子层有8个电子。

detailed_translations.english: a colourless gas that is found in small quantities in the air and is used in glass tubes to produce a bright light in electric advertising signs. It is a chemical element: symbol Ne

name: negligible
trans: adj. 可忽略的, 无足轻重的

sentences.english: The damage done to his property was negligible.
sentences.chinese: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

sentences.chinese: 执行安全程序时的疏忽

sentences.chinese: 那座桥梁的建筑师被控犯有玩忽职守罪。

detailed_translations.english: failure to take enough care over something that you are responsible for

trans: vt. 否定；取消；使无效
vi. 否定；否认；无效

sentences.english: Efforts to expand the tourist industry could be negated by reports that the sea is highly polluted.
sentences.chinese: 有关海洋受到严重污染的报道可能会使拓展旅游业的努力完全白费。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from having any effect

trans: adv. 整洁地；熟练地；灵巧地

sentences.chinese: 不要做消极的否定者。

sentences.chinese: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

name: nauseous
trans: adj. 令人作呕的；厌恶的

sentences.chinese: 我觉得有点恶心。

sentences.english: The taste made me nauseous.
sentences.chinese: 那味道让我恶心。

sentences.chinese: 我感到一阵恶心。

name: nasty

sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的

sentences.chinese: 该国新生的民主

sentences.english: their nascent industries
sentences.chinese: 他们的新兴行业

trans: adv. 勉强地；严密地；狭窄地；仔细地

sentences.chinese: 他在选举中以微弱差距败北。

sentences.english: One bullet struck his car, narrowly missing him.

sentences.chinese: 周日早晨一名男子家中起火，险些丧命。

trans: n. 记叙文; 故事；叙述, 讲述; 叙述部分
adj. 叙述的; 叙事体的

sentences.english: The novel contains more narrative than dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 这部小说里的叙述比对话多。

sentences.english: If this story must be written, we must have the courage to eliminate all adjectives that tend to excite wonder: they would achieve the opposite effect, of impoverishing the narrative.
sentences.chinese: 如果必须要写这篇故事，我们必须要有勇气剔除易于激发我们想入非非的所有形容词：这些词会使叙述贫瘠无力，起到相反的效果。

name: nard

sentences.english: The truth of Johnson’s comment was recently brought home to me by the serene calm of a resident who was treating a particularly complicated narcotic-dependent patient.
sentences.chinese: 最近，一位住院医生对待一位异常复杂的麻醉药依赖病人的平静态度让我领会到了塞缪尔.约翰逊这句话的真谛。

sentences.english: As a result, almost 50 years after the agreement was adopted, adequate availability of narcotic drugs for pain treatment remains an unfulfilled promise.
sentences.chinese: 因此虽然条约早在50年前被通过，但确保治疗疼痛的麻醉药物供应充足仍是个未兑现的承诺。

a narcotic drug takes away pain or makes you sleep

name: nanny

name: namaste

detailed_translations.english: existing only in an ancient story

sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: mystery
trans: n. 神秘，秘密；神秘的事物；奥秘

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

name: myriad
trans: adj. 无数的；种种的
n. 无数，极大数量；无数的人或物

sentences.english: the myriad causes of homelessness
sentences.chinese: 导致人们无家可归的种种原因

detailed_translations.english: very many

detailed_translations.chinese: 无数，极大数量；无数的人或物
detailed_translations.english: a very large number of things

name: myopia
trans: n. 近视；目光短浅，缺乏远见

detailed_translations.chinese: [眼科] 近视；目光短浅，缺乏远见
detailed_translations.english: when someone does not think about the future, especially about the possible results of a particular action – used in order to show disapproval

trans: adj. 相互的，彼此的；共同的

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that is different in some way from others of the same kind, because of a change in its  genetic  structure

trans: n. 胡子，髭

name: Muslim
trans: n. 穆斯林；穆罕默德信徒
adj. 伊斯兰教的

sentences.english: ...Iran and other Muslim countries.
sentences.chinese: …伊朗和其他穆斯林国家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 穆斯林（的）；伊斯兰教信徒（的）
detailed_translations.english: someone whose religion is Islam

name: mushy

sentences.chinese: 煮两分钟，煮软但不要煮烂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 糊状的； 感伤的， 多情的
detailed_translations.english: soft, wet, and unpleasant

name: muse
trans: n. 沉思；冥想
vt. 沉思；沉思地说

sentences.english: The sloth-like times come when we lose touch with our inner muse.
sentences.chinese: 当我们与内心沉思失去联系的时候，懒惰就会出现。

sentences.english: I want to be a better writer and maybe my muse will provide the motivation.
sentences.chinese: 我希望成为一名更好的作者，也许我的沉思将为我提供动力。

sentences.english: Initially it will be really hard to ignore the mind that wants to plan for the future and muse about the past, but with time you will see through its insanity.
sentences.chinese: 开始时，忽视想要计划将来沉思过去的思想是很困难的，但是随着时间的推移，你将看穿它的荒谬。

detailed_translations.english: to say something in a way that shows you are thinking about it carefully

name: murky
trans: adj. 黑暗的；朦胧的；阴郁的

sentences.english: murky water
sentences.chinese: 浊水

detailed_translations.chinese: 黑暗的， 昏暗的； 朦胧的
detailed_translations.english: dark and difficult to see through

name: municipality
trans: n. 自治市; 自治区; 自治市或区的政府当局

sentences.english: the municipality of Berkeley
sentences.chinese: 伯克利市政当局

sentences.english: an elected municipality
sentences.chinese: 选举产生的市政府

detailed_translations.chinese: 市民；市政当局；自治市或区
detailed_translations.english: a town, city, or other small area, which has its own government to make decisions about local affairs, or the officials in that government

name: mung
trans: n. [植]绿豆

name: mundane
trans: adj. 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的

sentences.english: Initially, the work was pretty mundane.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始，这工作非常乏味。

sentences.english: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 摆放餐具这种无趣的事情在假日里也会变得有意思起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
detailed_translations.english: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

name: munch
trans: vt. 用力咀嚼；大声咀嚼
vi. 用力咀嚼；大声咀嚼

sentences.english: Luke munched the chicken sandwiches.
sentences.chinese: 卢克大声嚼着鸡肉三明治。

sentences.english: Across the table, his son Benjie munched appreciatively.
sentences.chinese: 桌子对面，他儿子本吉津津有味地大声咀嚼着。

detailed_translations.chinese: 用力咀嚼， 出声咀嚼
detailed_translations.english: If you munch food, you eat it by chewing it slowly, thoroughly, and rather noisily

vi. 含糊地说话

sentences.english: He bumped into someone and mumbled an apology.
sentences.chinese: 他撞到一个人，咕哝着道了歉。

sentences.english: Stop mumbling!
sentences.chinese: 别嘟嘟囔囔的！

sentences.english: He could hear the low mumble of Navarro's voice.
sentences.chinese: 他能听到纳瓦罗的低声咕哝。

detailed_translations.english: to say something too quietly or not clearly enough, so that other people cannot understand you
Mumble is also a noun

name: multipolarity

n. 拖鞋

sentences.chinese: 要是我有那么多钱，我早就另买一头骡子了。
