sentences.english: It’s a miracle you weren’t killed!
sentences.chinese: 你没有死真是奇迹！

sentences.english: By some miracle, we managed to catch the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们奇迹般地赶上了飞机。

sentences.english: the economic miracle of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济奇迹

sentences.english: She’s our miracle baby.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们的奇迹宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

name: minty
trans: adj. 有薄荷香的；有薄荷味的

name: mint
trans: n. 薄荷；造币厂，巨款
vt. 铸造，铸币

sentences.english: new potatoes sprinkled with chopped mint
sentences.chinese: 撒上薄荷屑的嫩马铃薯

sentences.english: roast lamb with mint sauce
sentences.chinese: 配薄荷调味汁的烤羔羊肉

sentences.english: Decorate with a sprig of mint .
sentences.chinese: 用小薄荷枝装饰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄荷；[金融] 造币厂，巨款
detailed_translations.english: a small plant with green leaves that have a fresh smell and taste and are used in cooking
to make a coin
looking new and in perfect condition

name: minority
trans: n. 少数民族；少数派；未成年
adj. 少数的；属于少数派的

sentences.english: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people or things within a much larger group

name: ministry
trans: n. （政府的）部门

sentences.english: the Ministry of Agriculture
sentences.chinese: 农业部

sentences.english: Converted in his early teens, he entered the ministry (= started working as a church leader ) in 1855.
sentences.chinese: 他十三四岁皈依基督教，1855年当上牧师。

sentences.english: the ministry of Jesus
sentences.chinese: 耶稣的传道工作

detailed_translations.chinese: （政府的）部；；（全体）牧师；牧师的职责
detailed_translations.english: a government department that is responsible for one of the areas of government work, such as education or health

name: mining
trans: n. 矿业；采矿

sentences.english: ...traditional industries such as coal mining and steel making.
sentences.chinese: …像采煤和炼钢这样的传统工业。

detailed_translations.english: the work or industry of getting gold, coal etc out of the earth

name: miniature
trans: adj. 小型的, 微小的
n. 微型复制品, 微小模型 微型画, 微型人像画

sentences.english: She’s her mother in miniature.
sentences.chinese: 她是她母亲的缩影。

sentences.english: a miniature railway
sentences.chinese: 微型铁路

detailed_translations.english: exactly like something or someone but much smaller
much smaller than normal

name: mineral
trans: n. 矿物；[化]无机物；（英）矿泉水；苏打水（常用复数表示）
adj. 矿物的；矿质的

sentences.english: The area is very rich in minerals .
sentences.chinese: 该地区矿产非常丰富。

sentences.english: a country with few mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 矿产资源稀少的国家

sentences.english: mineral water
sentences.chinese: 矿泉水

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is formed naturally in the earth, such as coal, salt, stone, or gold. Minerals can be dug out of the ground and used
of or containing or derived from minerals

name: mindset
trans: n. 心态；倾向；习惯；精神状态

name: mindful
trans: adj. 留心的；记住的；警觉的

name: millionaire
trans: n. 百万富翁

sentences.english: an American millionaire
sentences.chinese: 一位美国百万富翁

sentences.english: a millionaire businessman
sentences.chinese: 一位富商

detailed_translations.english: someone who is very rich and has at least a million pounds or dollars

name: millet
trans: n. 粟；稷；小米；黍的子实

sentences.english: The maize and millet were just putting forth ears.
sentences.chinese: 玉米粟子刚刚吐穗。

detailed_translations.english: the small seeds of a plant similar to grass, used as food

name: millennial
trans: adj. 一千年的

name: militant
trans: adj. 好战的
n. 富有战斗性的人；好斗者

sentences.english: militant political activists
sentences.chinese: 激进的政治活动家

sentences.english: a militant animal rights group
sentences.chinese: 激进的动物权利保护团体

sentences.english: After the assassination of Martin Luther King, black leaders became more militant.
sentences.chinese: 马丁•路德•金遇刺后，黑人领袖变得更为激进了。

sentences.english: Even now we could not be sure that the militants would not find some new excuse to call a strike the following winter.
sentences.chinese: 即使到现在，我们也不能确定这些激进分子不会找到某个新的借口在下一年冬天号召一场罢工。

detailed_translations.english: a militant organization or person is willing to use strong or violent action in order to achieve political or social change

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有战斗性的人；好斗者；激进分子
detailed_translations.english: Militant is also a noun

name: milestone
trans: n. 里程碑

sentences.english: He said the launch of the party represented a milestone in Zambian history.
sentences.chinese: 他说该党的成立代表着赞比亚历史上的一个里程碑。

detailed_translations.english: a very important event in the development of something

name: mighty
trans: adj. 有力的；有势力的；强有力的
adv. 很；极；非常

sentences.english: the mighty Mississippi river
sentences.chinese: 浩荡的密西西比河

sentences.english: a mighty army
sentences.chinese: 强大的军队

detailed_translations.chinese: 有力的；强有力的；有势力的
detailed_translations.english: very strong and powerful, or very big and impressive
very

name: middleman
trans: n. 中间人

sentences.english: He acts as a middleman for British companies seeking contracts in the Gulf.
sentences.chinese: 他给在海湾地区寻找商机的英国公司当中间人。

sentences.english: Buy direct from the manufacturer and cut out the middleman (= avoid using a middleman ) .
sentences.chinese: 从厂家直接进货，绕开中间商。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys things in order to sell them to someone else, or who helps to arrange business deals for other people

name: microscopic
trans: adj. 显微镜的；极小的；微观的

sentences.english: a microscopic speck of dust
sentences.chinese: 微小的尘粒

sentences.english: Inspectors discovered microscopic cracks in the hull of the submarine.
sentences.chinese: 检测人员发现潜艇的船身有细微的裂缝。

detailed_translations.english: extremely small and therefore very difficult to see

name: micron
trans: n. 微米（等于百万分之一米）

sentences.english: For example, if you say that something is "a few microns across", explain that a micron is one-millionth of a metre, and "about one hundredth the width of a human hair".
sentences.chinese: 例如，如果您说某事物只有几微米，那么就要解释一微米是百万分之一米，大约是人头发宽度的百分之一。

sentences.english: One micron is a thousandth of a millimeter: a pinhead is about a millimeter across.
sentences.chinese: 一微米等于千分之一毫米。 针头直径大约一毫米。

detailed_translations.chinese: 微米（等于百万分之一米）
detailed_translations.english: a unit of length equal to 10–6 metre

name: miasma
trans: n. 瘴气；臭气；不良影响

sentences.english: He looked up at me through a miasma of cigarette smoke.
sentences.chinese: 他在香烟烟雾中抬头看着我。

sentences.english: A foul miasma lay over the town.
sentences.chinese: 一阵难闻的瘴气笼罩在小镇的上空。

detailed_translations.english: dirty air or a thick unpleasant mist that smells bad

name: metropolitan
trans: adj. 大都会的, 大城市的 中心地区的, 正宗的

sentences.english: a metropolitan area of South Australia
sentences.chinese: 南澳大利亚的一个都市区

sentences.english: ...the Ukrainian Catholic representatives, Metropolitan Volodymyr and Bishop Sofron.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰的天主教代表——弗拉基米尔大主教和索夫龙主教

detailed_translations.english: relating or belonging to a very large city
a metropolitan is an important priest in the Orthodox and Catholic Churches. He has authority over other priests and is in charge of a particular area.

name: metro
trans: n. 地铁；大都市；伦敦地下铁道；麦德隆（财富500强公司之一，总部所在地德国，主要经营零售）

sentences.english: the Paris Metro
sentences.chinese: 巴黎地铁系统

sentences.english: It’ll be quicker to go on the metro.
sentences.chinese: 乘地铁更快。

sentences.english: a metro station
sentences.chinese: 地铁站

detailed_translations.english: a railway system that runs under the ground below a city

name: meticulous
trans: adj. 极仔细的; 一丝不苟的

sentences.english: He kept meticulous accounts.
sentences.chinese: 他的账记得一丝不苟。

sentences.english: Their planning and preparation were meticulous.
sentences.chinese: 他们的计划和准备工作都很周密。

sentences.english: He cleaned the tools with meticulous care.
sentences.chinese: 他十分认真地清洁了工具。

sentences.english: The book describes his journey in meticulous detail.
sentences.chinese: 这本书很详细地描述了他的旅程。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一丝不苟的；小心翼翼的；拘泥小节的
detailed_translations.english: very careful about small details, and always making sure that everything is done correctly

name: methane
trans: n. [化]甲烷；沼气

sentences.english: Methane is one of the principal gases contributing to the greenhouse effect.
sentences.chinese: 甲烷是造成温室效应的主要气体之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化] 甲烷；[能源] 沼气
detailed_translations.english: a gas that you cannot see or smell, which can be burned to give heat

name: meteorology
trans: n. 气象学

sentences.english: This is a book about meteorology.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是讲气象的。

sentences.english: It plays an increasingly important part in meteorology for cloud, precipitation, hail and thunderstorm detection as well as the navigation of aircraft and ships.
sentences.chinese: 它在对云层、降水、冰雹和雷暴的气象探测以及在船舰和飞机的导航中，起着日益重要的作用。

sentences.english: All of this depends on certain assumptions and the meteorology, the geology and the hydrology of the area plus the contours of the land around this particular power plant.
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是根据某些假设,和气象状态，地质情况，还有，水文请跨国,在加上土地的等高线,在这个特定的核能电站的周围。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of weather conditions

name: metaphorical
trans: adj. 隐喻般的;含有许多隐喻的

sentences.english: The word has a metaphorical as well as a literal meaning.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词除了字面意思还有一层比喻意思。

detailed_translations.english: a metaphorical use of a word is not concerned with real objects or physical events, but with ideas or events of a non-physical kind

name: metamorphose
trans: vt. 使变形,使变质
vi. 变形; 变质

name: metal
trans: n. 金属；合金
vt. 以金属覆盖

sentences.english: The gate is made of metal.
sentences.chinese: 这扇大门是用金属做成的。

sentences.english: a small black metal box
sentences.chinese: 一个黑色的金属小盒子

sentences.english: They traded in gold and other precious metals (= valuable metals used especially for making jewellery ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们做黄金和其他贵金属的交易。

sentences.english: The old trucks were sold as scrap metal (= old metal that is melted and used again ) .
sentences.chinese: 这些旧卡车被当作金属废料卖掉了。

detailed_translations.english: a hard, usually shiny substance such as iron, gold, or steel

name: messy
trans: adj. 肮脏的，污秽的；凌乱的，散乱的；麻烦的

sentences.english: a messy room
sentences.chinese: 凌乱的房间

sentences.english: Sorry the place is so messy, I haven’t had time to clear up.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这地方又脏又乱，我一直没时间打扫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱的，散乱的；肮脏的，污秽的；麻烦的
detailed_translations.english: dirty or untidy

name: mesmerize
trans: vt. 使入迷

sentences.english: The first time I saw Diana I was mesmerized by her beauty.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次见到戴安娜就被她的美貌迷住了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 施催眠术； 使入迷， 迷住
detailed_translations.english: if you are mesmerized by someone or something, you cannot stop watching them or listening to them because they are so attractive or have such a powerful effect

name: mesh
trans: n. 网眼；网丝；圈套
vi. 相啮合

sentences.english: The ground-floor windows are obscured by wire mesh.
sentences.chinese: 底楼的窗户被铁丝网罩着。

detailed_translations.english: Mesh is material like a net made from wire, thread, or plastic
if two ideas or things mesh, they fit together very well

name: merry
trans: adj. 愉快的；微醉的；嬉戏作乐的
n. 甜樱桃

sentences.english: He marched off, whistling a merry tune.
sentences.chinese: 他吹着一首欢快的曲子大步走了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愉快的；微醉的；嬉戏作乐的
detailed_translations.english: used to say that you hope someone will have a happy time at Christmas

name: meritocracy
trans: n. 知识界精华

name: merit
trans: n. 优点，价值；功绩；功过
vt. 值得

sentences.english: The merit of the report is its realistic assessment of the changes required.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告的优点就是它对所要求的变动进行了实事求是的评估。

sentences.english: The great merit of the project is its flexibility and low cost.
sentences.chinese: 该项目最大的优点是它的灵活性和低成本。

sentences.english: Each of these approaches to teaching has its merits .
sentences.chinese: 这些教学方法每一种都有其优点。

sentences.english: Tonight’s meeting will weigh up the relative merits of the two candidates.
sentences.chinese: 今晚的会议将对两位候选人的相对优点进行考量。

sentences.english: It’s a fascinating book which merits attention.
sentences.chinese: 这是本引人入胜的书，值得关注。

detailed_translations.english: an advantage or good feature of something
to be good, important, or serious enough for praise or attention

name: meridian
trans: adj. 子午线的；最高点的
n. 子午线，经线；顶点

sentences.english: Yes this is the…is the prime meridian if you like.
sentences.chinese: 是的，这就是本初子午线，它把地球分为东半球和西半球。

sentences.english: The prime meridian of longitude is in greenwich south london.
sentences.chinese: 经度的本初子午线在伦敦南部的格林威治。

detailed_translations.english: one of the imaginary lines from the North Pole to the South Pole, drawn on a map of the Earth

name: merger
trans: n. （企业等的）合并；并购；[法律]吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）

sentences.english: merger negotiations
sentences.chinese: 合并谈判

detailed_translations.chinese: （企业等的）合并；并购；吸收（如刑法中重罪吸收轻罪）
detailed_translations.english: the joining together of two or more companies or organizations to form one larger one

name: merciless
trans: adj. 无情的,残忍的

sentences.english: a merciless attack
sentences.chinese: 无情的攻击

sentences.english: a merciless killer
sentences.chinese: 残忍的杀手

detailed_translations.english: cruel and showing no kindness or forgiveness

name: mercenary
trans: adj. 雇用的,为钱的,唯利是图的
adv. 雇用地,唯利是图地

sentences.english: She did it for purely mercenary reasons.
sentences.chinese: 她这么做纯粹是为了钱。

sentences.english: a mercenary attitude
sentences.chinese: 唯利是图的态度

detailed_translations.english: only interested in the money you may be able to get from a person, job etc
a soldier who fights for any country or group that will pay him

name: mentor
trans: n. 指导者，良师益友

sentences.english: Leon Sullivan was my mentor and my friend.
sentences.chinese: 利昂·沙利文既是我的导师，也是我的朋友。

detailed_translations.english: an experienced person who advises and helps a less experienced person

name: mendacity
trans: n. 虚伪 谎言

sentences.english: Mr. Gore's mendacity was supposedly demonstrated by trivial anecdotes, none significant, some of them simply false.
sentences.chinese: 据称可以证明戈尔虚伪的都不过是微不足道的小事，没有一件谈得上重要，其中一些根本为不实之辞。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of not being truthful

name: menacing
trans: adj. 险恶的；威胁的
v. 恐吓；威胁（menace的ing形式）

sentences.english: dark menacing clouds
sentences.chinese: 可怕的乌云

sentences.english: a low menacing laugh
sentences.chinese: 带威胁的低声一笑

sentences.english: His tone grew more menacing.
sentences.chinese: 他的语气越来越可怕。

detailed_translations.english: making you expect something unpleasant

name: menace
trans: n. 威胁；恐吓
vi. 恐吓；进行威胁

sentences.english: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

sentences.english: There was menace in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他的语气里带着威胁。

sentences.english: The elephants are still menaced by poachers.
sentences.chinese: 大象仍然面临非法捕猎者的威胁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 有危险性的人(或物)；威胁，威吓
detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is dangerous
to threaten

name: memorabilia
trans: n. (与名人或重大事件有关的)纪念物

name: membrane
trans: n. 膜；薄膜；羊皮纸

sentences.english: Loud noise can damage the delicate membrane in the ear.
sentences.chinese: 很响的噪声会损伤脆弱的耳膜。

detailed_translations.english: a very thin piece of skin that covers or connects parts of your body

name: melody
trans: n. 旋律；歌曲；美妙的音乐

sentences.english: They played some lovely melodies.
sentences.chinese: 他们演奏了一些动听的曲子。

sentences.english: a haunting melody
sentences.chinese: 难以忘怀的曲调

detailed_translations.english: a song or tune

name: melancholy
trans: n. 忧郁, 悲哀
adj. 忧郁的, 悲伤的

sentences.english: The music suited her melancholy mood.
sentences.chinese: 这音乐很适合她的伤感情绪。

detailed_translations.english: very sad
a feeling of sadness for no particular reason

name: megger
trans: n. 高阻表；绝缘测量器

name: mega
trans: adj. 巨大的
adv. 非常
pref. 表示“大；百万”

name: medlar
trans: n. [植]枸杞；欧楂果

name: mediocre
trans: adj. 平凡的；中等的；普通的

sentences.english: I thought the book was pretty mediocre.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这本书非常一般。

sentences.english: a mediocre student
sentences.chinese: 能力一般的学生

detailed_translations.english: not very good

name: medieval
trans: adj. 中世纪的；仿中世纪的；老式的；[贬]原始的

sentences.english: These spices were first brought to Italy from the East in medieval times.
sentences.chinese: 这些香料最早是在中世纪时从东方被带到了意大利。

sentences.english: a medieval castle
sentences.chinese: 一座中世纪城堡

detailed_translations.english: connected with the Middle Ages (= the period between about 1100 and 1500 AD )

name: Medicaid
trans: n. （美）医疗补助计划

sentences.english: For her medical care, the family was forced to turn to Medicaid.
sentences.chinese: 为了她的医疗，家人被迫求助于医疗补助署。

detailed_translations.english: a system in the US by which the government helps to pay the cost of medical treatment for poor people

name: medal
trans: n. 勋章，奖章；纪念章

sentences.english: She won a gold medal at the last Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 她在上届奥运会上赢得一枚金牌。

sentences.english: The two boys were awarded medals for their bravery.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男孩因勇敢而获得勋章。

detailed_translations.english: a flat piece of metal, usually shaped like a coin, that is given to someone who has won a competition or who has done something brave

name: mechanism
trans: n. 机械装置；构造, 机制；办法, 技巧, 途径

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

name: measly
trans: adj. [医]患麻疹的；极少的；低贱的

sentences.english: All I got was a measly £5.
sentences.chinese: 我只得到了区区五英镑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 患麻疹的； 少得可怜的， 微不足道的
detailed_translations.english: very small and disappointing in size, quantity, or value – used to show disapproval

name: measles
trans: n. 麻疹；风疹

sentences.english: These antibodies work against the measles virus.
sentences.chinese: 这些抗体有对抗麻疹病毒作用。

sentences.english: This is why many viruses, such as measles, make us ill only once.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么许多病毒，如麻疹，只会使我们生病一次。

sentences.english: Imagine if we have an outbreak of measles and the information is relayed to us three months after the outbreak.
sentences.chinese: 想像一下如果我们已经爆发了麻疹，而消息是在爆发后的三个月后才传到我们这里。

detailed_translations.english: an infectious illness in which you have a fever and small red spots on your face and body. People often have measles when they are children.

name: mealy
trans: adj. 粉状的

name: meager
trans: adj. 贫乏的；瘦的
n. 兆

sentences.english: His meager wage is not enough to support their five children.
sentences.chinese: 靠他一个人的微薄工资不足以养活他们的五个孩子。

sentences.english: Do you think those savings are meager, or not worth the effort?
sentences.chinese: 你认为这些节省的开支是微薄的，或者是不值得努力获得的吗？

sentences.english: It was medieval European monks who introduced scientific brewing techniques in an effort to produce a nutritious beverage to supplement their meager diets.
sentences.chinese: 正是中世纪欧洲的僧侣们引进科学的啤酒酿造技术，制造有营养的饮料， 从而补充了他们贫乏的饮食。

name: maturity
trans: n. 成熟；到期；完备

sentences.english: Beth shows a maturity way beyond her 16 years.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝表现出一种远远超出她16岁年龄的成熟。

sentences.english: One day you’ll have the maturity to understand.
sentences.chinese: 有一天等你长大后你就明白了。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of behaving in a sensible way like an adult

name: mattress
trans: n. 床垫；褥子；空气垫

sentences.english: The ten young people sleep between two hard, narrow beds and one large mattress on the floor with no privacy at all.
sentences.chinese: 十个年轻人就睡在两张窄小的硬板床和地板上的一张大床垫上，没有任何隐私可言。

sentences.english: If someone pokes fun at your mattress on the floor, or teases you about your empty cabinets, smile and take it in stride.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人取笑你放在地板上的床垫，或揶揄你空空的橱柜，请面带微笑从容应对此事。

sentences.english: She laid a spring mattress under the sheet.
sentences.chinese: 她在床单下面铺了一个弹簧床垫。

detailed_translations.english: the soft part of a bed that you lie on

name: matrix
trans: n. 矩阵；基质；模型；脉石；母体；子宫

sentences.english: a matrix table
sentences.chinese: 矩阵表

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 矩阵；模型；[生物][地质] 基质；母体；子宫；[地质] 脉石
detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of numbers, letters, or signs in rows and  column s  that you consider to be one amount, and that you use in solving mathematical problems

name: maternity
trans: n. 母性;为母之道

sentences.english: a maternity dress
sentences.chinese: 孕妇装

detailed_translations.chinese: 母性，母道；[妇产] 妇产科医院
detailed_translations.english: the state of being a mother
relating to a woman who is  pregnant  or who has just had a baby

name: materialize
trans: vi. 具体化;成为现实

sentences.english: Problems were expected, but they never materialized.
sentences.chinese: 估计会有问题，但一直没有发生。

sentences.english: The money we had been promised failed to materialize .
sentences.chinese: 答应给我们的钱并没有兑现。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or appear in the way that you expected

name: matches
trans: n. 火柴；比赛（match的复数）
v. 匹敌；匹配（match的第三人称单数形式）

name: mat
trans: n. 地垫，垫子；团，簇
v. 缠结，缠结成一团；铺满……上

sentences.english: Wipe your feet on the mat.
sentences.chinese: 在地垫上蹭蹭你的鞋底。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of thick rough material which covers part of a floor
to tangle or weave or become tangled or woven into a dense mass

name: masturbate
trans: v.  (对 ... )进行手淫

name: mastery
trans: n. 精通；优势；统治权；征服；掌握

sentences.english: He doesn't have mastery of the basic rules of grammar.
sentences.chinese: 他没有掌握基本的语法规则。

detailed_translations.chinese: 掌握；精通；优势；征服；统治权
detailed_translations.english: thorough understanding or great skill

name: masonry
trans: n. 石工行业；石工；石造建筑

sentences.english: Several people were buried under falling masonry.
sentences.chinese: 好几个人被埋在倒塌的砖石下面。

detailed_translations.english: the bricks or stone from which a building, wall etc has been made

name: mashed
trans: adj. 捣烂的；被捣成糊状的；捣碎的
v. 捣碎；调情（mash的过去分词）

name: mascot
trans: n. 吉祥物；福神（等于mascotte）

sentences.english: the official mascot of the 2002 World Cup
sentences.chinese: 2002年世界杯的官方吉祥物

sentences.english: Rocky the Raccoon, the team mascot
sentences.chinese: 浣熊罗基，该队的吉祥物

detailed_translations.english: an animal or toy, or a person dressed as an animal, that represents a team or organization, and is thought to bring them good luck

name: Marxist
trans: n. 马克思主义者
adj. 马克思主义的

sentences.english: ...a 78-year-old former Marxist.
sentences.chinese: …一位78岁的前马克思主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who agrees with Marxism
relating to or based on Marxism

name: marvelous
trans: adj. 引起惊异的,不可思议的,非凡的

sentences.english: It is all the same God, and that God showed me that the universe in which we live is a beautiful and marvelous mystery that is connected together forever and for always.
sentences.chinese: 他们所谈的是同一个上帝，这位上帝向我展示了我们生活在其中的这个宇宙的美丽和奇妙的神秘，它们关联在一起，永永远远。

name: marvel
trans: n. 奇迹
vt. 对…感到惊异

sentences.english: ‘The man is a genius,’ marvelled Claire.
sentences.chinese: “这人是个天才。”克莱尔赞叹道。

sentences.english: The whale, like the dolphin, has become a symbol of the marvels of creation.
sentences.chinese: 鲸，和海豚一样，已经成为造物杰作的象征。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or express great surprise or admiration at something, especially someone’s behaviour
You can describe something or someone as a marvel to indicate that you think that they are wonderful

name: martyr
trans: n. 烈士;殉道者;殉教者
vt. 对坚持某种信仰者进行屠杀(或加以折磨)

sentences.english: St. Stephen, the first Christian martyr
sentences.chinese: 圣司提反，第一个基督教殉道者

sentences.english: The army has been held back because the government is reluctant to make martyrs of the protesters.
sentences.chinese: 军队后撤了，因为政府不愿意造成抗议者牺牲。

sentences.english: St. Pancras was martyred in 304 A.D.
sentences.chinese: 圣·潘克瑞斯在公元304年蒙难。

detailed_translations.english: someone who dies for their religious or political beliefs and is admired by people for this
If someone is martyred, they are killed or made to suffer greatly because of their religious or political beliefs

name: Martian
trans: adj. 火星的
n. 火星人

name: martial art
trans: n. 武术（源于东方的几种搏斗技巧）

name: martial
trans: adj. 战争的；军事的；尚武的

sentences.english: martial music
sentences.chinese: 军乐

detailed_translations.english: connected with war and fighting

name: marsh
trans: n. 湿地；沼泽
adj. 沼泽的；生长在沼泽地的

sentences.english: He led them away from a marsh.
sentences.chinese: 他把他们带离沼泽。

sentences.english: My urine and excrement are recycled by a system of ducts, pipes, wires, plants, and marsh-microbes, and redeemed into water and food which I can eat.
sentences.chinese: 由众多的导管、管线、植物和沼泽微生物构成的系统回收了我的尿液和粪便，并将其还原成水和食物供我食用。

detailed_translations.english: an area of low flat ground that is always wet and soft

detailed_translations.chinese: 沼泽的；生长在沼泽地的

name: marrow
trans: n. 髓，骨髓；精华；活力

sentences.english: a bone marrow transplant
sentences.chinese: 骨髓移植

detailed_translations.english: the soft fatty substance in the hollow centre of bones

name: maroon
trans: n. 栗色；逃亡黑人奴隶；孤立的人
v. 使孤立；放逐到无人岛上

sentences.english: I wore a maroon velvet trouser suit that my daughter chose, and most of the village came to the reception.
sentences.chinese: 那天，我穿了女儿为我挑选的栗色天鹅绒裤装，村庄里的大多数人都应邀参加了我的婚礼。

sentences.english: On an impulse I grab a little maroon dress, pull Christiane from Frau Ballin's arms—she is still wearing only her undergarments—and quickly dress her in it.
sentences.chinese: 慌乱中，我随手抓起一件栗色的连衣裙，给在巴林女士怀里的克丽丝汀换上，——可怜的克丽丝汀，她还穿着那件薄衬衣。

detailed_translations.english: a dark brownish red colour

name: marmalade
trans: n. 果子酱;果酱

sentences.english: All you have to do is flip the toaster upside down, and the toast slides right out onto your plate, ready for the application of butter and marmalade.
sentences.chinese: 你所要做的就是把它翻下来，面包就会自动滑落到你的盘子上，等待你给它们抹上黄油和果酱了。

sentences.english: At Fortnum's you'll find the finest caviar, cheeses, fresh fruit, veg, fish, poultry and meats, as well as a huge range of teas and, of course, marmalade!
sentences.chinese: 在这儿，有上好的鱼子酱、奶酪、新鲜水果、蔬菜、鱼、家禽、肉类以及大量茶叶，当然还有不能忘的——果酱！

detailed_translations.chinese: 橘子或柠檬等水果制成的果酱
detailed_translations.english: a  jam  made from fruit such as oranges,  lemon s  ,or  grapefruit  , usually eaten at breakfast

name: marlin
trans: n. 枪鱼，青枪鱼；四鳃旗鱼

sentences.english: He drank a little water before he lashed the marlin to bow and stern of his skiff.
sentences.chinese: 他喝了一点水，然后把马林鱼捆绑在他那条小船的头部和尾部。

sentences.english: It was a fierce Mako, and it came in fast to slash with raking teeth at the dead marlin.
sentences.chinese: 这是一条凶猛的尖吻鲭鲨。 它飞快地游了过来，用耙一样的牙齿撕这条死马林鱼。

sentences.english: Sustained by the pride of his calling, the only pride he has left, a broken old fisherman ventures far out into the Gulf Stream and there hooks the biggest marlin ever seen in those waters.
sentences.chinese: 故事讲到一个精神沮丧的老渔人，在他对职业的自豪感(他留下的唯一自豪感)的支持之下，冒险远航至墨西哥湾流并在那里钓住了一条该水域中从未见过的最大的马林鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a large sea fish with a long sharp nose, which people hunt for sport

name: markup
trans: n. 涨价；利润；审定

sentences.english: We all know that most wine in restaurants is over-priced: a markup of 200 percent on cost is considered normal.
sentences.chinese: 我们都知道饭店中大部分葡萄酒标价过高：在成本价上涨200％被认为是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: A markup is an increase in the price of something, for example the difference between its cost and the price that it is sold for

name: marksman
trans: n. 神射手；不能用笔署名者

sentences.english: Police marksmen opened fire.
sentences.chinese: 警察中的神枪手开了火。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神射手；不能用笔署名者

name: marital
trans: adj. 婚姻的；夫妇间的

sentences.english: marital problems
sentences.chinese: 婚姻问题

sentences.english: the increase in marital breakdown
sentences.chinese: 婚姻破裂的增多

detailed_translations.english: relating to marriage

name: marinate

vi. 浸泡在卤汁中

name: marginalize

sentences.chinese: 女性雇员抱怨被管理层边缘化。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or a group of people unimportant and powerless in an unfair way

name: marginal
trans: adj. 边缘的；末端的；临界的

sentences.chinese: 社会中的非主流群体

sentences.english: marginal notes

vt. 加边于；加旁注于

sentences.english: Someone had scribbled a note in the margin .
sentences.chinese: 有人在页边写了条批注。

sentences.english: Use double spacing and wide margins to leave room for comments.
sentences.chinese: 采用双倍行距和宽阔的页边空白，以便留出地方写评注。

sentences.english: the western margin of southern Africa
sentences.chinese: 非洲南部的西隅

detailed_translations.english: the empty space at the side of a page

name: marble
trans: n. 大理石；大理石制品；弹珠
adj. 大理石的；冷酷无情的

sentences.english: The columns were of white marble.
sentences.chinese: 柱子是白色的大理石。

sentences.english: a marble statue
sentences.chinese: 大理石雕像

detailed_translations.chinese: 大理石；大理石制品；弹珠
detailed_translations.english: a type of hard rock that becomes smooth when it is polished, and is used for making buildings,  statue s  etc

name: maple
trans: n. 枫树；淡棕色

sentences.english: ...a solid maple worktop.
sentences.chinese: …一张结实的枫木工作台。

detailed_translations.english: a tree which grows mainly in northern countries such as Canada. Its leaves have five points and turn red or gold in autumn.

name: mantra
trans: n. 颂歌；咒语（尤指四吠陀经典内作为咒文或祷告唱念的）

sentences.english: a beautiful country mansion
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的乡村宅第

detailed_translations.english: a very large house

name: manipulate
trans: vt. 熟练控制[操作]

sentences.english: He was one of those men who manipulated people.
sentences.chinese: 他是那种要摆布别人的人。

sentences.english: You have the constant feeling you are being manipulated.
sentences.chinese: 你总感觉自己是被人控制着的。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone think and behave exactly as you want them to, by skilfully deceiving or influencing them

name: manifold

adj. 多方面的，有许多部分的；各式各样的

sentences.english: The reasons for this situation are manifold.
sentences.chinese: 出现这种情况原因是多方面的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复写，复印；增多；使……多样化
多方面的，有许多部分的；各式各样的
detailed_translations.english: many and of different kinds

name: manifesto

sentences.english: the Labour Party’s election manifesto
sentences.chinese: 工党的竞选宣言

sentences.english: The Tories are due to publish their manifesto tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 保守党将于明天发表他们的宣言。

detailed_translations.english: a written statement by a political party, saying what they believe in and what they intend to do

name: manifestation

sentences.english: Different animals in the colony had different manifestations of the disease.
sentences.chinese: 同一群体的不同动物对同一疾病有不同的表现形式。

detailed_translations.english: a very clear sign that a particular situation or feeling exists

name: manifest
trans: vt. 证明，表明；显示
vi. 显示，出现

sentences.english: The shareholders have manifested their intention to sell the shares.
sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

detailed_translations.english: to show a feeling, attitude etc
a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

name: manicure
trans: n. 修指甲；修指甲的人
vt. 修指甲；修剪

sentences.english: You might also like a massage, or shoes, or clothes, or a manicure or facial. I’m not that into those things, but you might be.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以选择一次按摩、鞋子、衣服、或修一次指甲、做一次美容作为奖励，我不用这些奖励，但你可以用。

sentences.english: Hot tip: The simplest way out of this situation is to cut properly file and manicure your nails so that they do not lead to painful scratches on your partner.
sentences.chinese: 热心提示：最简单的避免这种局面的方式就是修剪指甲，这样当你紧紧抓紧你另一半时，就不会弄伤他了。

detailed_translations.english: a treatment for the hands that includes cutting and polishing the nails

name: maniac
trans: n. 疯子，躁狂者
adj. 发狂的；狂热的；癫狂的

sentences.english: He drove like a maniac to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 他像个疯子似的开车去医院。

sentences.english: Suddenly this maniac ran out into the middle of the road.
sentences.chinese: 突然这个疯子跑到路当中。

sentences.english: He could not maintain his maniac speed for much longer.
sentences.chinese: 他不能太长时间地保持这种疯狂的速度。

detailed_translations.english: someone who behaves in a stupid or dangerous way
If you describe someone's behaviour as maniac, you are emphasizing that it is extremely foolish and uncontrolled

name: manhole
trans: n. 人孔；检修孔

name: mangosteen
trans: n. 山竹果,倒捻子(原产于东南亚的一种水果)

name: mangle
trans: v. 碾压；损坏；糟蹋；乱切
n. 碾压机

sentences.english: His body was crushed and mangled beyond recognition.
sentences.chinese: 他的身体被轧得血肉模糊而无法辨认。

detailed_translations.chinese: 毁坏， 毁损； 损坏
detailed_translations.english: If a physical object is mangled, it is crushed or twisted very forcefully, so that it is difficult to see what its original shape was

name: manga
trans: n. 日本漫画

name: maneuver
trans: n. 策略；演习；调遣；机动
vi. 调遣；演习；用计谋；机动

sentences.english: The chopper shot upward in a manoeuver matched by the other pilot.
sentences.chinese: 这架直升飞机向上冲去，另一架飞机也以相同的移动方向冲了上去。

sentences.english: The president has tried to manoeuver the campaign away from himself.
sentences.chinese: 总统试图操控该活动，使其远离自身。

sentences.english: That will allow them to manoeuvre the satellite into the shuttle's cargo bay.
sentences.chinese: 那将使得他们能把人造卫星移入飞船的货物舱。

detailed_translations.english: a skilful or careful movement that you make, for example in order to avoid something or go through a narrow space
to move or turn skilfully or to move or turn something skilfully, especially something large and heavy

name: mandate
trans: n. 命令；指令；要求；授权
v. 把(某一地区)置于委任管理下

sentences.english: Matters debated in meetings do not become a mandate automatically.
sentences.chinese: 会议上讨论的事宜并不能自动成为一项指令。

detailed_translations.chinese: 授权；命令，指令；委托管理；受命进行的工作
detailed_translations.english: if a government or official has a mandate to make important decisions, they have the authority to make the decisions because they have been elected by the people to do so
to give someone the right or power to do something

name: Manchuria
trans: n. 满洲（中国东北的旧称）

name: mana
trans: n. 神力，超自然力量；威望

name: mammoth
trans: n. 长毛象；猛犸象；庞然大物
adj. 猛犸似的；巨大的，庞大的

sentences.english: One of the two mammoth museums.
sentences.chinese: 两个猛犸象博物馆中的一个。

sentences.english: Partial remains of five mastodons, three Ice Age bison and a juvenile Columbian mammoth, as well as plant matter and insects, have also been found.
sentences.chinese: 同时发现的还有五头乳齿象、三头冰河期野牛和一只少年哥伦比亚猛犸象的遗骸，以及植物和昆虫。

detailed_translations.english: an animal like a large hairy  elephant  that lived on Earth thousands of years ago
extremely large

name: mammal
trans: n. 哺乳动物

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: malpractice
trans: n. 玩忽职守, 渎职, 不法行为

sentences.english: No complaints, no malpractice lawsuits, seems friendly, well-liked.
sentences.chinese: 没有被投诉过，也没有治疗不当的诉讼，友善受欢迎。

sentences.english: She was new in the job and keen as mustard (= very keen ).
sentences.chinese: 她刚开始做这工作，热情很高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热心的； 激烈的； 敏锐的

name: karate
trans: n. 空手道（日本的一种徒手武术）

sentences.english: No, I had it when I walked out the door. Dad picked me up to drive me to karate.
sentences.chinese: 不可能，我出门的时候还带着，爸爸开车接我去上空手道的课，然后我把书包放在车里。

sentences.english: Generally you exhale on the effort, if, say, doing weights, karate or boxing, and inhale on the “return”.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，如果你在练哑铃、空手道或拳击，你呼出的是努力，吸入的是“回报”。

detailed_translations.english: a Japanese fighting sport, in which you use your feet and hands to hit and kick

name: juvenile
trans: adj. 青少年的；幼稚的
n. 青少年；少年读物

sentences.chinese: 少年犯罪

sentences.english: a juvenile court
sentences.chinese: 少年法院[法庭]

sentences.chinese: 在过去的10年中，青少年在总人口中所占的比重下降了1/5。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少年的，少年特有的；幼稚的，不成熟的

A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult

name: justification
trans: n. 理由；辩护；认为有理，认为正当；释罪

sentences.english: Hoggart felt, with some justification, that his colleagues had let him down.
sentences.chinese: 霍加特觉得同事令他失望，这是有理由的。

detailed_translations.english: a good and acceptable reason for doing something

name: jurisdiction
trans: n. 司法权; 裁判权

sentences.chinese: 英国警方对外国银行的账户没有司法管辖权。

name: junior

n. 年少者，晚辈；地位较低者；大学三年级学生

sentences.chinese: 她现在和比她小10岁的演员丹尼斯·劳森同居。

a lot of different things mixed together in an untidy way, without any order

trans: n. 枣子，枣树；枣味糖

name: jug
trans: n. 【英式】（有柄有嘴的）壶，罐；【美式】（细口带柄的）大罐；一壶，一罐（的量）；【英式、俚语】监狱，牢房
v. 在陶制容器中炖煮（肉，尤指野兔）；【俚语】关进监狱；【美式】模仿夜莺叫

sentences.english: a milk jug
sentences.chinese: 牛奶罐

detailed_translations.english: a container with a wide curved opening at the top and a handle, used especially at meals for pouring liquids

name: judo
trans: n. （日）柔道
adj. 柔道的；柔道术的

name: joystick
trans: n. 操纵杆，控制杆

sentences.english: This was to rule out any effects on the second resting scan that my have been caused by the participants still thinking about that dodgy joystick.
sentences.chinese: 这是为了排除由于参与者仍在思考如何控制躲闪操纵杆而对第二次扫描产生的影响，与实验本身无关。

sentences.english: The pilot should be able to use a joystick to control small thrusters on the side of the ship, grab a camera to take pictures, or grab a vomit bag for the inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 宇航员应该能够用操纵杆来控制在飞船一边的小推进器，抓住一台照相机来拍照，或者抓着一个呕吐袋来防止不可避免的意外。

sentences.english: You make me want to calibrate my joystick without the latest drivers.
sentences.chinese: 在没有新来的司机的情况下，你校准了我的飞机操纵杆。

detailed_translations.english: an upright handle that you use to control something such as an aircraft or a computer game

name: jostle
trans: vt. 推挤，撞；争夺
vi. 竞争，争夺；推挤

sentences.chinese: 千头万绪在我脑海中翻涌。

trans: vi. 戏弄
vt. 戏弄

sentences.english: The guys josh him and call him an egghead.
sentences.chinese: 大伙儿取笑他，叫他书呆子。

sentences.chinese: 我们沿崎岖潮湿的公路颠簸着驶过无边无际的香蕉种植园。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way

detailed_translations.chinese: 颠簸；摇晃；震惊；严重挫折

trans: n. 关节；接合处，接合点；接缝；（牛，羊等的腿）大块肉
adj. 联合的，合办的；共同的；连接的

sentences.english: The two ministers have issued a joint statement.
sentences.chinese: 两位部长发布了一项联合声明。

sentences.english: Both companies are involved in the joint development of a new medium-sized car.
sentences.chinese: 两家公司联合开发一款新的中型汽车。

sentences.english: The meal was a joint effort(= two or more people worked on it together ).
sentences.chinese: 这顿饭是大家一起做的。

sentences.english: Manchester United and Arsenal are joint favourites to win the title (= are thought to have the same chance of winning ).
sentences.chinese: 曼联和阿森纳均为夺冠的热门球队。

sentences.english: Both parties must sign the form if the account is to be in joint names(= belong to two named people ).
sentences.chinese: 如果这是联名账户的话，双方都必须在表格上签名。

trans: n. [美俚]厕所

name: jocularity
trans: n. 滑稽；诙谐

sentences.chinese: …广告短歌。

trans: adj. 不稳定的；摇晃的；[美俚]撩拨人的

sentences.chinese: 电话铃声突然把我吵醒了。

sentences.chinese: 数千个工作岗位岌岌可危。

sentences.chinese: 但是，多年来，许多海洋专家一直在说，我们需要开始热爱水母——因为在不远的将来，它们也许是我们周围最丰富的海洋物种。

sentences.chinese: 洛夫林先生和其他在海滩上的人说，过了好一会儿，大家才意识到发生了什么，因为水母蜇人在这片海滩上实属罕见。

sentences.chinese: 他很快就发现，在乡村生活中，人们狭隘善妒，喜欢传播流言蜚语。

sentences.chinese: 开车人常常从右侧超车，出租车闯红灯，骑自行车逆行，行人乱穿马路。

sentences.chinese: 碎瓶子的锯齿状边缘

sentences.chinese: 我们旅行计划的下一站是塞多纳。

sentences.chinese: 眼睛的虹膜最远可在一公尺外的距离接受摄影。

sentences.chinese: 虹膜的图案转译为数码，然后与个人资料一起储存在个人计算机数据库里。

sentences.chinese: 色彩变幻的蓝色小苍蝇

name: Iraq
trans: n. 伊拉克（西南亚国家）

sentences.english: So why go to Iraq when you can go to Canada?
sentences.chinese: 因此，如果你可以去加拿大的话，为什么要去伊拉克呢？

sentences.english: I have a picture of you and I together in Iraq.

sentences.chinese: 由于无意间向侦探撒了谎，她把自己置于一个尴尬的境地。

sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

detailed_translations.english: when someone does something, or something happens, that affects your private life or activities in an unwanted way

name: introduce

sentences.chinese: 几位参议员提交了针对性骚扰的立法议案。

name: intrinsically

sentences.chinese: 你想要和心爱的人在一起的愿望，与你想从事具有内在价值的活动的愿望一样大，甚至更大。

sentences.chinese: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious

name: intricate

sentences.english: intricate patterns
sentences.chinese: 繁复的图案

detailed_translations.chinese: 错综复杂的， 复杂精细的
detailed_translations.english: containing many small parts or details that all work or fit together

sentences.english: the intricacies of private banking
sentences.chinese: 私人银行业务的错综复杂

detailed_translations.english: the complicated details of something

name: intraocular

name: intransigent

n. 不妥协的人, 不让步者

sentences.english: an intransigent attitude
sentences.chinese: 不妥协的态度

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to change your ideas or behaviour, in a way that seems unreasonable

name: intimity
trans: n. 亲密；亲近；隐私

name: intimidation
trans: n. 恐吓，威胁

name: intimidate
trans: vt. 恐吓, 威胁

sentences.chinese: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

detailed_translations.english: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want

sentences.chinese: 如果肠功能不正常的话，这个部位总是一按就痛。

sentences.chinese: 在面试时呈递的工作成果样本
