sentences.chinese: 警方问讯

sentences.english: We’re interviewing six candidates for the job.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作我们要面试六名申请人。

detailed_translations.english: a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out whether they are suitable for a job, course of study etc
to ask someone questions during an interview

name: intervention
trans: n. 介入, 干涉, 干预

sentences.english: government intervention to regulate prices
sentences.chinese: 政府介入控制物价

detailed_translations.english: the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: interrogation
trans: n. 讯问(审问)的行为实例;讯问(审问)过程 疑问句;问题

sentences.english: ...the right to silence in police interrogations.
sentences.chinese: …在警察审问时保持沉默的权利。

detailed_translations.english: An interrogation is the act of interrogating someone

name: interrogate
trans: vt. 询问, 审问, 质问

sentences.english: The police interrogated the suspect for several hours.
sentences.chinese: 警察盘问了这名嫌疑犯好几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, sometimes using threats

name: interpretive
trans: adj. 说明的；解释的

name: interpreter
trans: n. 口译工作者;口译译员 演绎(音乐、戏剧中人物等)的人 解释程序

sentences.english: Speaking through an interpreter (= using an interpreter ), Ahmed said, ‘I’m very worried about my wife and children.’
sentences.chinese: 艾哈迈德通过口译者说:“我很担心我的妻子和孩子们。”

detailed_translations.english: someone who changes spoken words from one language into an-other, especially as their job

name: interpret
trans: vt. 解释; 说明
vt. & vi. 口译; 翻译

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: internist
trans: n. 内科医师

sentences.english: I've been to see an internist, a nutritionist, and a chiropractor.
sentences.chinese: 我已经求诊过一位内科医生、一位营养学家和一位按摩师了。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor who has a general knowledge about all illnesses and medical conditions of organs inside your body, and who treats illnesses that do not need operations

name: intern
trans: n. 住院实习医生
vt. 拘留,关押

sentences.english: ...a medical intern.
sentences.chinese: …一位实习医生。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has nearly finished training as a doctor and is working in a hospital
to put someone in prison without charging them with a crime, for political reasons or during a war

name: intermittent
trans: adj. 间歇的; 断断续续的

sentences.english: The weather forecast is for sun, with intermittent showers.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报为晴，有阵雨。

detailed_translations.chinese: 间歇的；断断续续的；间歇性
detailed_translations.english: stopping and starting often and for short periods

name: interlude
trans: n. 中间；中间时间；插曲；介在中间的事件

sentences.english: a brief interlude of peace before a return to the battlefield
sentences.chinese: 重返战场之前的短暂平静

detailed_translations.chinese: 插曲；穿插；幕间节目；[数] 插算
detailed_translations.english: a period of time between two events or situations, during which something different happens

name: interleave
trans: vt. 插入纸

name: interim
trans: adj. 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的
n. 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定

sentences.english: an interim report
sentences.chinese: 中期报告

sentences.english: He received an interim payment of £10,000.
sentences.chinese: 他收到暂时支付的一万英镑。

sentences.english: An interim government was established.
sentences.chinese: 一个临时政府成立了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 临时的，暂时的；中间的；间歇的
detailed_translations.english: intended to be used or accepted for a short time only, until something or someone final can be made or found

detailed_translations.chinese: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two events

name: interference
trans: n. 干涉, 介入 阻碍, 干扰

sentences.english: Industrial relations should be free from state interference.
sentences.chinese: 劳资关系应不受政府干预。

detailed_translations.english: an act of interfering

name: interfere
trans: vi. 干预; 调停 妨碍

sentences.english: My daughter-in-law said that I was interfering, but I was only trying to help.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿媳说我多管闲事，但我只是想帮忙。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately get involved in a situation where you are not wanted or needed

name: interestingly
trans: adv. 有趣地

sentences.english: Interestingly, none of their three children ever married.
sentences.chinese: 有趣的是，他们的三个孩子都一直没有结婚。

sentences.english: Interestingly enough, Pearson made no attempt to deny the rumour.
sentences.chinese: 很有趣的是，皮尔逊没有试图否认谣传。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a fact that you think is interesting

name: interdisciplinary
trans: adj. 各学科间的

sentences.english: an interdisciplinary research centre
sentences.chinese: 跨学科研究中心

detailed_translations.english: involving ideas, information, or people from different subjects or areas of study

name: intercourse
trans: n. 交往；交流；性交

sentences.english: social intercourse
sentences.chinese: 社交

detailed_translations.english: an exchange of ideas, feelings etc which make people or groups understand each other better

name: intercessory
trans: adj. 仲裁的,调解的

name: intercession
trans: n. 调解；仲裁；说情

sentences.english: His intercession could be of help to the tribe.
sentences.chinese: 他的调解会对该部落有帮助。

detailed_translations.english: when someone talks to a person in authority in order to prevent something bad happening to someone else

name: intercede
trans: vi. 斡旋,调解 说情

sentences.english: They asked my father to intercede with the king on their behalf.
sentences.chinese: 他们请我父亲代他们向国王求情。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in support of someone, especially in order to try to prevent them from being punished

name: interactive
trans: adj. (指至少两个人或物)一起活动或互相合作的 交互式的, 人机对话的

sentences.english: interactive computer systems
sentences.chinese: 交互式电脑系统

sentences.english: the museum’s interactive exhibits
sentences.chinese: 博物馆的互动展品

detailed_translations.chinese: 互相作用的，互相影响的
detailed_translations.english: an interactive computer program, television system etc allows you to communicate directly with it, and does things in reaction to your actions

name: interaction
trans: n. 一起活动, 合作, 配合, 相互作用

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只能在实现所有方法的情况下获得最大收益，因为它们的力量来自它们之间的交互。

sentences.english: But you only get the maximum benefit if you implement all of them, because their power comes from their interaction.
sentences.chinese: 但您只有在实现所有方法的情况下才能获得最多的收益，因为它们的力量来自于它们之间的相互作用。

sentences.english: The real power of the concept comes not from any one of these devices; it emerges from the interaction of all of them.
sentences.chinese: 这个概念的很正力量并不来自于这些设备的任何一个；它来自于这些设备之间的交互。

detailed_translations.english: a process by which two or more things affect each other

name: integrity
trans: n. 正直; 诚实, 诚恳 完整, 完全, 完善

sentences.english: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把他当作一个正直诚实的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

name: integration
trans: n. 结合;整合;一体化 (不同肤色、种族、宗教信仰等的人的)混合,融合

sentences.english: problems of racial integration
sentences.chinese: 种族融合的问题

detailed_translations.english: the combining of two or more things so that they work together effectively

name: integral
trans: adj. 必需的；不可或缺的；作为组成部分的；完整的；完备的

sentences.english: Rituals, celebrations, and festivals form an integral part of every human society.
sentences.chinese: 仪式、庆典和节日是每个人类社会不可缺少的组成部分。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing

name: integer
trans: n. 整数；完整的事物；整体

sentences.english: 6 is an integer, but 6.4 is not.
sentences.chinese: 6是整数，而6.4不是。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 整数；整体；完整的事物
detailed_translations.english: a whole number

name: intact
trans: adj. 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

name: insulin
trans: n. 胰岛素

sentences.english: diabetic patients requiring insulin
sentences.chinese: 胰岛素依赖型糖尿病患者

detailed_translations.english: a substance produced naturally by your body which allows sugar to be used for energy

name: insulation
trans: n. 隔离, 隔绝;绝缘;隔音 绝缘、隔热或隔音等的材料

sentences.english: Good insulation can save you money on heating bills.
sentences.chinese: 好的隔热效果能节省暖气费。

detailed_translations.english: when something is insulated or someone insulates something

name: insulate
trans: vt. 隔离，使孤立；[物]使绝缘，使隔热

sentences.english: an insulated attic
sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.english: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

name: insular
trans: adj. 孤立的；岛民的；海岛的；与世隔绝的

sentences.english: an insular community
sentences.chinese: 保守封闭的社团

detailed_translations.chinese: 孤立的；与世隔绝的；海岛的；岛民的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or like an island

name: institutional
trans: adj. 机构的；慈善机构的；制度上的；制度的

sentences.english: accusations of institutional racism in the police force
sentences.chinese: 对警察队伍中已形成风气的种族主义的谴责

detailed_translations.english: institutional attitudes and behaviour have existed for a long time in an organization and have become accepted as normal even though they are bad

name: instill
trans: vt. 徐徐滴入；逐渐灌输

sentences.english: We must instill a sense of duty in our children.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在我们的孩子当中灌输一种责任感。

sentences.english: I aim to instill in them the pleasure of giving.
sentences.chinese: 我的目的在于灌输给他们给予的乐趣。

name: instantaneous
trans: adj. 瞬间发生的, 即刻的

sentences.english: modern methods of instantaneous communication
sentences.chinese: 现代的即时通信方法

detailed_translations.english: happening immediately

name: instance
trans: n. 实例；情况；建议
vt. 举...为例

sentences.english: In this instance I think she was mistaken.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上我认为她弄错了。

detailed_translations.english: an example of a particular kind of situation

name: instalment
trans: n. 分期付款；（连载作品或分集戏剧等的）一部分；一集=installment(美)

sentences.english: the second instalment of a loan
sentences.chinese: 一项贷款的第二期还款

sentences.english: They’re letting me pay for the washing machine by monthly instalments.
sentences.chinese: 他们允许我以每月分期付款的方式买下这台洗衣机。

detailed_translations.english: one of a series of regular payments that you make until you have paid all the money you owe

name: installation
trans: n. 安装；装置；军事驻地

sentences.english: the installation and maintenance of alarm systems
sentences.chinese: 警报系统的安装和维护

sentences.english: The whole computer installation was nearly new.
sentences.chinese: 整套电脑设备几乎是全新的。

sentences.english: nuclear installations
sentences.chinese: 核设施

detailed_translations.english: when someone fits a piece of equipment somewhere

name: inspiration
trans: n. 灵感；妙计；吸气；鼓舞

sentences.english: The Malvern Hills have provided inspiration for many artists and musicians over the decades.
sentences.chinese: 几十年来，莫尔文丘陵为很多艺术家和音乐家提供了灵感。

sentences.english: He raised his eyes to the altar as if seeking inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他抬头看看祭坛，似乎在寻求灵感。

sentences.english: He draws inspiration from ordinary scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他从日常生活中得到灵感。

sentences.english: Mary Quant’s inspiration comes from the glam style of the seventies.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉·官的灵感来自70年代的魅惑风格。

sentences.english: He had a sudden flash of inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 他突然灵感闪现。

sentences.english: He has always been a source of inspiration for me.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人
detailed_translations.english: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

name: insomnia
trans: n. 失眠症，失眠

sentences.english: If you have insomnia, try my simple cure.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有失眠症，试试我的简单疗法。

sentences.english: In my insomnia, you have to hold me to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在我失眠的时候，你要抱着我睡。

sentences.english: I know someone with insomnia who only gets two hours of sleep each night.
sentences.chinese: 我认识一个患有失眠症的人，他每天晚上只能睡上两个小时。

detailed_translations.english: if you suffer from insomnia, you are not able to sleep

name: insight
trans: n. 洞察力；洞悉

sentences.english: a writer of great insight
sentences.chinese: 有深刻洞察力的作家

sentences.english: The book gives us fascinating insights into life in Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 这本书生动地表现了墨西哥的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

name: insidious
trans: adj. 隐伏的；暗中为害的；阴险的；诱人上当的；（疾病等）不知不觉恶化的

sentences.english: an insidious trend towards censorship of the press
sentences.chinese: 实行新闻审查的潜在趋势

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴险的；隐伏的；暗中为害的；狡猾的
detailed_translations.english: an insidious change or problem spreads gradually without being noticed, and causes serious harm

name: inscription
trans: n. 题字；碑铭；铭文

sentences.english: a Latin inscription on the memorial stone
sentences.chinese: 纪念碑上的拉丁语碑文

detailed_translations.english: a piece of writing inscribed on a stone, in the front of a book etc

name: insatiable
trans: adj. 不知足的；贪得无厌的

sentences.english: A section of the reading public has an insatiable appetite for dirty stories about the famous.
sentences.chinese: 阅读大众中有一部分人对名人的风流韵事的欲望总是无法满足。

detailed_translations.english: always wanting more and more of something

name: inroad
trans: n. 侵袭，袭击；减少

sentences.english: We haven’t made much of an inroad into the backlog of work.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有完成多少积压的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to make some progress towards achieving something difficult

name: innovation
trans: n.创新， 革新

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching
sentences.chinese: 英语教学的新创举

detailed_translations.english: the introduction of new ideas or methods

name: innate
trans: adj. 先天的；固有的；与生俱来的

sentences.english: Children have an innate ability to learn language.
sentences.chinese: 儿童学习语言的能力是与生俱来的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先天的；固有的；与生俱来的
detailed_translations.english: an innate quality or ability is something you are born with

name: inn
trans: n. 旅馆；客栈
vi. 住旅馆

sentences.english: We’re staying at the Holiday Inn.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在假日酒店。

detailed_translations.english: a small hotel or pub, especially an old one in the countryside

name: initiator
trans: n. 发起人，创始者；教导者；[计] 启动程序；引爆器

name: initiative
trans: adj. 自发的
n. 首创精神；主动权；第一步；倡议；项目

sentences.english: I wish my son would show more initiative.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我的儿子能表现得再主动一些。

sentences.english: Don’t keep asking me for advice. Use your initiative.
sentences.chinese: 别老是要我给你出主意，发挥一下你自己的决断能力吧。

sentences.english: Lt. Carlos was not obeying orders. He acted on his own initiative (= he was not told what to do ).
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯中尉没有服从命令，而是自作主张。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to make decisions and take action without waiting for someone to tell you what to do

name: iniquity
trans: n. 不公正；邪恶

sentences.english: They were trying to protect their son from iniquity.
sentences.chinese: 他们竭力保护儿子免受不公正待遇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 邪恶， 不公正， 不道德
detailed_translations.english: the quality of being very unfair or evil, or something that is very unfair

name: inhumane
trans: adj. 残忍的；无人情味的

sentences.english: the inhumane treatment of political prisoners
sentences.chinese: 对政治犯的虐待

sentences.english: I was shocked by the inhumane conditions.
sentences.chinese: 我对这非人的条件感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: extremely cruel and causing unacceptable suffering

name: inhale
trans: vt. 吸入；猛吃猛喝
vi. 吸气

sentences.english: It is dangerous to inhale ammonia fumes.
sentences.chinese: 吸入氨气是很危险的。

sentences.english: Myra lit another cigarette and inhaled deeply  (= breathed in a lot of smoke ).
sentences.chinese: 迈拉又点上一支烟，深深地吸了一口。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in air, smoke, or gas

name: ingress
trans: n. 进入；准许进入；入口；入境

sentences.english: A high seating position makes ingress and egress easy.
sentences.chinese: 较高的座椅位置使入口和出口容易。

sentences.english: The touch-screen surface eliminates pushbutton cavities which prevents liquid ingress.
sentences.chinese: 触摸屏表面没有按钮腔，这就避免了液体的进入。

sentences.english: The rugged construction is double-sealed to prevent water and dust ingress even during site wiring.
sentences.chinese: 坚固的建筑是双重密封，以防止水和灰尘进入即使在现场布线。

detailed_translations.english: the right to enter a place, or the act of entering it

name: infusion
trans: n. 灌输；注入物；浸泡；激励

sentences.english: He brought a tremendous infusion of hope to the people.
sentences.chinese: 他给人们带来极大的希望。

detailed_translations.english: the act of putting a new feeling or quality into something

name: infuse
trans: vt. 使充满；灌输；浸渍
vi. （茶叶、草药等）被泡

sentences.english: All those lives maintained in the rarefied air of the absurd could not persevere without some profound and constant thought to infuse its strength into them.
sentences.chinese: 没有某种深邃的思想一成不变地为之输入力量，所有这些在荒谬的稀薄空气中维持的生命都无法继续。

detailed_translations.english: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling or quality

name: infrared
trans: n. 红外线
adj. 红外线的

sentences.english: Both the model and the satellite sensor use infrared energy to measure clouds.
sentences.chinese: 模型和卫星传感器都使用红外能量来进行云的估算。

sentences.english: "This is an exciting result, " says Tinetti. "This is the first near-infrared spectrum of a planet.
sentences.chinese: 迪奈蒂说：“这是个令人兴奋的结果，这是行星上发现的第一个近红外光谱。

sentences.english: His discovery of the electromagnetic spectrum led to the development of television, radio, microwaves, as well as aiding in the development of radio and infrared telescopes.
sentences.chinese: 他发现的电磁特性最终导致电视、广播、微波炉的发明，并且也对无线电和红外望远镜的发明起到了重要作用。

detailed_translations.english: Infrared radiation is similar to light but has a longer wavelength, so we cannot see it without special equipment

name: informative
trans: adj. 提供消息的；情报的；见闻广博的

sentences.english: Both men termed the meeting friendly and informative.
sentences.chinese: 他们两人都称这次会晤亲切友好，使双方增进了解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供消息的, 情报的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is informative gives you useful information

name: informant
trans: n. 报告者,告密者

sentences.english: One of the witnesses was a paid informant for the FBI.
sentences.chinese: 目击者之一是联邦调查局出钱雇用的线人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 被调查者；告密者；提供消息者
detailed_translations.english: someone who secretly gives the police, the army etc information about someone else

name: influx
trans: n. 流入；汇集；河流的汇集处

sentences.english: ...problems caused by the influx of refugees.
sentences.chinese: …难民大量涌入所造成的问题。

detailed_translations.english: the arrival of large numbers of people or large amounts of money, goods etc, especially suddenly

name: inflict
trans: vt. 把…强加给, 使承受, 遭受

sentences.english: ...the damage being inflicted on industries by the recession.
sentences.chinese: …经济衰退给工业造成的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 造成；使遭受（损伤、痛苦等）；给予（打击等）
detailed_translations.english: To inflict harm or damage on someone or something means to make them suffer it

name: inflammatory
trans: adj. 煽动性的；发炎的；炎症的

sentences.english: inflammatory remarks
sentences.chinese: 煽动性言论

detailed_translations.chinese: 炎症性的；煽动性的；激动的
detailed_translations.english: an inflammatory speech, piece of writing etc is likely to make people feel angry

name: infirmity
trans: n. 体弱，虚弱 疾病，病症

sentences.english: Health is a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.
sentences.chinese: 健康是身体的、心理的及社会的达到完全安适状态，而不仅是没有疾病或身体虚弱而已。

sentences.english: Workers lose productivity by interrupting a business meeting and disrupt social gatherings because of their infirmity, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 报告中说，因为工人们的虚弱，通过中断了业务会议而失去生产效率，并且破坏了社交聚会的范围。

detailed_translations.english: bad health or a particular illness

name: infirm
trans: adj. 衰弱的；意志薄弱的；不坚固的

sentences.english: ...her aging, infirm husband.
sentences.chinese: …她那年迈体弱的丈夫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 衰弱的；意志薄弱的；不坚固的
detailed_translations.english: A person who is infirm is weak or ill, and usually old

name: infinity
trans: n. 无穷；无限大；无限距

sentences.english: In the equation below, as E goes to zero, n approaches infinity.
sentences.chinese: 在下面的方程式中，E趋向于零时，n接近无穷大。

detailed_translations.english: a number that is too large to be calculated

name: infinitive
trans: n. (动词)不定式
adj. 不定式的

sentences.english: An infinitive is a two-word form of a verb.
sentences.chinese: 一个不定式是由两个词构成的形式。

detailed_translations.english: in grammar, the basic form of a verb, used with ‘to’ in English. In the sentence ‘I want to watch television.’ ‘to watch’ is an infinitive.

name: infinite
trans: adj. 无限的，无穷的；无数的；极大的
n. 无限；无限的东西（如空间，时间）；无穷大

sentences.english: The universe is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙是无限的。

detailed_translations.english: without limits in space or time

name: infidel
trans: n. 无信仰者；异教徒
adj. 无宗教信仰的；异教徒的

name: infertility
trans: n. 不肥沃,不毛

name: inferno
trans: n. 阴间，地狱

name: inferior
trans: adj. 下级的，下等的；差的；自卑的
n. 次品；下级

sentences.english: I felt very inferior among all those academics.
sentences.chinese: 与那些大学教师在一起，我自惭形秽。

sentences.english: wine of inferior quality
sentences.chinese: 劣质葡萄酒

sentences.english: inferior goods
sentences.chinese: 质量低劣的商品

detailed_translations.english: not good, or not as good as someone or something else
someone who has a lower position or rank than you in an organization

name: infantry
trans: n. 步兵；步兵团

sentences.english: an infantry regiment
sentences.chinese: 步兵团

detailed_translations.english: soldiers who fight on foot

name: infamous
trans: adj. 无耻的；声名狼藉的；邪恶的；不名誉的

sentences.english: an infamous killer
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的杀手

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ infamous smog
sentences.chinese: 恶名远播的洛杉矶雾霾

detailed_translations.chinese: 声名狼藉的；无耻的；邪恶的；不名誉的
detailed_translations.english: well known for being bad or evil

name: infallible
trans: adj. 绝无错误的；绝对可靠的

sentences.english: He had an infallible cure for a hangover.
sentences.chinese: 他有对付宿醉绝对灵验的良方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 绝对可靠的；绝无错误的
detailed_translations.english: something that is infallible always works or has the intended effect

detailed_translations.chinese: 永远正确的人；绝无谬误的事物

name: inertial
trans: adj. 惯性的；不活泼的

name: inertia
trans: n. 惯性；惰性，迟钝；不活动

sentences.english: Inertia carried the plane onto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 飞机靠惯性着陆。

sentences.english: I can't seem to throw off this feeling of inertia.
sentences.chinese: 我好像无法摆脱这种无力的感觉。

detailed_translations.english: the force that keeps an object in the same position or keeps it moving until it is moved or stopped by another force

name: inedible
trans: adj. 不能吃的

sentences.english: The meat was so burnt that it was inedible.
sentences.chinese: 肉烧得那么焦，不能吃了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is inedible, you cannot eat it because it tastes bad or is poisonous

name: indulgence
trans: n. 放纵；纵容；嗜好；沉溺

sentences.english: An occasional glass of wine was his only indulgence.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔喝杯葡萄酒是他唯一的嗜好。

detailed_translations.english: the habit of allowing yourself to do or have whatever you want, or allowing someone else to do or have whatever they want

name: indulge
trans: vt. 迁就；纵情于；放任
vi. 放纵自己于 ...

sentences.english: Only rarely will she indulge in a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 她只是偶尔才会喝上杯葡萄酒。

sentences.english: He returned to Ohio so that he could indulge his passion for football.
sentences.chinese: 他重返俄亥俄以释放自己对足球的激情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉溺， 纵容自己， 肆意从事
detailed_translations.english: If you indulge in something or if you indulge yourself, you allow yourself to have or do something that you know you will enjoy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉溺于，满足；纵容，迁就
detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

name: inductive
trans: adj. 归纳法的；归纳的；【物理】电感应的

sentences.english: inductive reasoning
sentences.chinese: 归纳推理

detailed_translations.english: using known facts to produce general principles

name: induction
trans: n. 归纳法；感应；就职；诱发

sentences.english: Mrs Simpson is responsible for the induction of new library staff.
sentences.chinese: 辛普森太太负责图书馆新职员的入职培训。

detailed_translations.chinese: 就职； 归纳； 感应
detailed_translations.english: the production of electricity in one object by another that already has electrical or magnetic power

name: inductance
trans: n. 感应系数,自感应

name: induced
trans: adj. 感应的；诱发型
v. 引诱；说服（induce的过去分词）

name: indoctrinate
trans: vt. 向…灌输(信仰),教导

sentences.english: People were indoctrinated not to question their leaders.
sentences.chinese: 人们被灌输对领导人不得置疑的观念。

detailed_translations.english: to train someone to accept a particular set of beliefs, especially political or religious ones, and not consider any others

name: indigent
trans: adj. 贫困的；贫穷的

sentences.english: No where in the article does it mention her financial status. So…what is it that leads everyone to assume she was indigent?
sentences.chinese: 在文章中哪也没提及她的财务状况。那么…究竟是什么导致每个人都认为她是贫困的？

sentences.english: They "either fail to pay anything or pay a greatly-reduced amount designed for indigent or low income patients lacking insurance, " according to DHS.
sentences.chinese: 他们“一分钱都不付或者只支付非常少的费用，原先为贫困或短缺保险的低收入病人设定的费用。”

detailed_translations.english: very poor

name: indictment
trans: n. 起诉；控告；起诉状

name: indict
trans: vt. 控告，起诉；揭发

sentences.english: He was later indicted on corruption charges.
sentences.chinese: 他后来被控贪污。

detailed_translations.english: to officially charge someone with a criminal offence

name: indicate
trans: vt. 指出；表明；象征；预示

sentences.english: The study indicates a connection between poverty and crime.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示贫穷和犯罪有关联。

detailed_translations.english: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

name: indent
trans: vt. 缩排；定货；印凹痕
vi. 切割成锯齿状

detailed_translations.english: an official order for goods or equipment

name: incubator
trans: n. 孵卵器；早产儿保育器

sentences.english: a high-tech incubator on the east coast
sentences.chinese: 位于东海岸的高科技企业扶持机构

detailed_translations.chinese: [禽] 孵卵器；[儿科] 保温箱；早产儿保育器；细菌培养器
detailed_translations.english: a piece of hospital equipment into which very small or weak babies are put to keep them alive and warm

name: increment
trans: n. 增长 增额

sentences.english: The average yearly increment in productivity was 4.5 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 生产率的年平均增长量是4.5%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount by which a number, value, or amount increases

name: incorrigible
trans: adj. 无药可救的；积习难改的；固执的
n. 不可救药的人

sentences.english: "Sunita, you are incorrigible!" he said.
sentences.chinese: “苏尼塔，你真是屡教不改啊！”，他说道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可救药的；积习难改的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is incorrigible is bad in a way that cannot be changed or improved – often used humorously

name: incorporate
trans: v. 合并；组成公司
adj. 合并的；公司组织的

sentences.english: It allows you to harness existing technologies and incorporate them into one application.
sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

name: inconsistency
trans: n. 不一致（之处）；前后矛盾（的事情）;（行为的）反复无常，易变

sentences.english: There were several glaring inconsistencies (= very noticeable differences ) in his report.
sentences.chinese: 他的报告中有几个明显的前后矛盾之处。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which two statements are different and cannot both be true

name: incompatible
trans: adj. 合不来的, 不能和谐相处的;不协调的, 不相配的

sentences.english: Politeness and truth are often mutually incompatible.
sentences.chinese: 礼貌和实话往往互不相容。

sentences.english: Business interests are incompatible with public office.
sentences.chinese: 商业利益与公职不可兼得。

detailed_translations.english: two things that are incompatible cannot exist or be accepted together

name: inclined
trans: adj. 想（做某事）；有…倾向；很可能；（温和地表达意见）倾向于同意（或相信、认为等）；（与某些副词连用）有（某种）天赋；宁愿（做某事）；倾斜的；成某角度的

sentences.english: Commandos are inclined to shoot first and ask questions later.
sentences.chinese: 突击队员往往会先开枪，然后再问话。

sentences.english: He was inclined to self-pity.
sentences.chinese: 他爱自怜。

detailed_translations.english: to be likely to do something or behave in a particular way

name: inclination
trans: n. 倾向；意愿；趋势；斜坡；倾斜度

sentences.english: My natural inclination was to say no.
sentences.chinese: 我生性爱说“不”。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that makes you want to do something

name: incite
trans: vt. 煽动；激励；刺激

sentences.english: They were charged with inciting racial hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他们被指控煽动种族仇恨。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately encourage people to fight, argue etc

name: incisive
trans: adj. 敏锐的；深刻的；锋利的

sentences.english: He is a very shrewd operator with an incisive mind.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位非常精明的经营者，有着敏锐的头脑。

detailed_translations.english: You use incisive to describe a person, their thoughts, or their speech when you approve of their ability to think and express their ideas clearly, briefly, and forcefully

name: incision
trans: n. 切开；切口；雕刻，切割

sentences.english: The technique involves making a tiny incision in the skin.
sentences.chinese: 该技术需要在皮肤上切个小口。

detailed_translations.english: a neat cut made into something, especially during a medical operation

name: incidence
trans: n.发生率，入射

sentences.english: an area with a high incidence of crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率高的地区

sentences.english: the angle of incidence
sentences.chinese: 入射角

detailed_translations.english: the extent to which sth happens or has an effect

name: inception
trans: n. 开始, 开端, 初期

sentences.english: a CD collection covering the band from its inception in 1994
sentences.chinese: 一套包括该乐队自1994年成立以来所有曲目在内的激光唱片

detailed_translations.english: the start of an organization or institution

name: incentivize
trans: vt. 以物质刺激鼓励

name: incentive
trans: adj. 刺激的；鼓励的
n. 刺激；鼓励；动机

sentences.english: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.chinese: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

detailed_translations.english: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc

name: incarnation
trans: n. 化身；典型；道成肉身

sentences.english: She was the incarnation of wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 她是智慧的化身。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a lot of a particular quality, or represents it

name: incarcerate
trans: vt. 监禁,禁闭
n. 监禁,禁闭

sentences.english: He spent 10 years incarcerated in prison.
sentences.chinese: 他在监狱里关了十年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…关进监狱， 监禁， 禁闭
detailed_translations.english: to put or keep someone in prison

name: incandescent
trans: adj. 白热的;白炽的 十分明亮的,耀眼的 感情强烈的;激情的

sentences.english: the invention of the incandescent lamp
sentences.chinese: 白炽灯的发明

detailed_translations.chinese: 辉耀的；炽热的；发白热光的
detailed_translations.english: producing a bright light when heated

name: inbreak
trans: n. 入侵

name: inbound
trans: adj. 归本国的；回内地的；入境的
n. 入站

name: inaugural
trans: adj. 就职的, 就任的

sentences.english: the president’s inaugural address
sentences.chinese: 总统的就职演说

sentences.english: the inaugural lecture of the new Professor of American Literature
sentences.chinese: 新来的美国文学教授讲的第一堂课

detailed_translations.chinese: 开始的；开幕的；就任的，就职的
detailed_translations.english: an inaugural speech is the first given by someone who is starting an important job

name: inaudible
trans: adj. 听不见的；不可闻的

name: inalienable
trans: adj. 不能转让的,不可分割的

sentences.english: inalienable human rights
sentences.chinese: 不可剥夺的人权

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可分割的；不可剥夺的；不能让与的
detailed_translations.english: an inalienable right, power etc cannot be taken from you

name: inadvertent
trans: adj. 不注意的；疏忽的；非故意的

sentences.english: The government has said it was an inadvertent error.
sentences.chinese: 政府声称那是无意的过失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疏忽的；不注意的（副词inadvertently）；无意中做的
detailed_translations.english: An inadvertent action is one that you do without realizing what you are doing

name: inadequate
trans: adj. 不适当的；不充分的

sentences.english: inadequate resources
sentences.chinese: 资源缺乏

sentences.english: The new air conditioning system proved inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 新的空调系统不够好。

detailed_translations.english: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

name: inability
trans: n. 无能,无力

sentences.english: Her inability to concentrate could cause an accident.
sentences.chinese: 她无法集中注意力可能会导致意外。

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being unable to do something

name: impurity
trans: n. 杂质；不纯；不洁

sentences.english: All natural minerals contain impurities.
sentences.chinese: 凡天然矿物都含有杂质。

sentences.english: Our oatmeal face mask absorbs impurities from your skin.
sentences.chinese: 我们的燕麦面膜能够吸收皮肤上的杂质。

detailed_translations.english: a substance of a low quality that is contained in or mixed with something else, making it less pure

name: improvisation
trans: n. 即兴创作；即席演奏

sentences.english: It was the improvisation of the ebullition.
sentences.chinese: 它是激情迸发的即兴创作。 哟！

name: improvident
trans: adj. 不顾将来的；无远见的；不节约的；不经济的

detailed_translations.chinese: 无远见的， 不节俭的
detailed_translations.english: too careless to save any money or to plan for the future

name: improbable
trans: adj. 不可信的；未必会发生的；不大可能的，未必确实的

detailed_translations.chinese: 不大可能的, 不像会发生的, 似不可信的

name: imprisonment
trans: n. 关押,监禁

sentences.english: She was sentenced to seven years' imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 她被判处7年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: Imprisonment is the state of being imprisoned

name: imprison
trans: vt. 监禁；关押；使…下狱

sentences.english: The government imprisoned all opposition leaders.
sentences.chinese: 政府把反对派领导人全部监禁起来。

sentences.english: She was imprisoned within his strong arms.
sentences.chinese: 她被他强壮的手臂搂着。

sentences.english: Many elderly people feel imprisoned in their own homes.
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人感到待在自己家里跟坐牢一样。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone in prison or to keep them somewhere and prevent them from leaving

name: imprint
trans: vt. 刻上记号；加特征；盖印；铭记
n. 印记；痕迹；特征；印象

sentences.english: She could see the imprint of her fingers on his pale face.
sentences.chinese: 她可以看到自己的手指在他苍白的脸上留下的印痕。

sentences.english: As I arrived, the shimmering skyline of domes and minarets was imprinted on my memory.
sentences.chinese: 当我到达时，穹顶和尖塔形成的泛着微光的空中轮廓线铭刻在我的记忆中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 印记；痕迹；特征；版本说明
detailed_translations.english: the mark left by an object being pressed into or onto something
When something is imprinted on your memory, it is firmly fixed in your memory so that you will not forget it

name: impressionist
trans: n. 印象主义者；印象派作家
adj. 印象派的

sentences.english: impressionist painters
sentences.chinese: 印象派画家

detailed_translations.english: someone who uses impressionism in the paintings or music that they produce

name: impractical
trans: adj. 不切实际的；不实用的

sentences.english: The road toll scheme was dismissed as impractical.
sentences.chinese: 公路收费计划由于不切实际而遭到否定。

sentences.english: James was a foolish man, full of impractical plans.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是个愚蠢的人，满脑子都是不切实际的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or possible for practical reasons

name: imposter
trans: n. 冒名顶替者；骗子

name: implication
trans: n. 暗示；牵连，卷入；含义

sentences.english: They are called ‘Supertrams’, the implication being that (= which is meant to suggest that ) they are more advanced than earlier models.
sentences.chinese: 它们被称作“超级电车”，这是暗指它们比先前的型号更先进。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion that is not made directly but that people are expected to understand or accept

name: implicate
trans: vt. 牵连, 涉及

sentences.english: The allegations implicated Abe to such an extent he was forced to resign.
sentences.chinese: 安倍深受指控牵连，不得不辞职。

detailed_translations.english: to show or suggest that someone is involved in a crime or dishonest act

name: implementation
trans: n. 贯彻，执行

sentences.english: They do, however, greatly affect the implementation of those patterns.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它们的确对那些模式的 实现影响很大。

sentences.english: If I now scroll down to the actual implementation, now does this work or not work?
sentences.chinese: 如果现在我向下滚动到实际的执行中，这个是可用的还是不可用的呢？

sentences.english: One file describes the interface to your service, while the other file describes your implementation of it.
sentences.chinese: 一个文件描述到您的服务的接口，而另一个文件描述这个接口的实现。

name: impetus
trans: n. 促进；动力；冲力

sentences.english: The discovery gave fresh impetus to the research.
sentences.chinese: 这个发现为研究带来新动力。

detailed_translations.english: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

name: impetuous
trans: adj. 冲动的, 鲁莽的；轻率的，草率的

sentences.english: He was high-spirited and impetuous.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪高昂，行事鲁莽。

sentences.english: She might live to regret this impetuous decision.
sentences.chinese: 她可能会一辈子为这个鲁莽的决定感到后悔。

detailed_translations.english: tending to do things very quickly, without thinking carefully first, or showing this quality

name: impertinently
trans: adv. 不切题地,不恰当地,不礼貌地

name: imperialist
trans: n. 帝国主义者
adj. 帝国主义的

sentences.english: He claims that imperialists are trying to re-establish colonial rule in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他声称帝国主义者正试图在该国重建殖民统治。

sentences.english: The developed nations have all benefited from their imperialist exploitation.
sentences.chinese: 发达国家都从他们帝国主义的剥削中获益。

detailed_translations.english: An imperialist is someone who has imperialist views
Imperialist means relating to or based on imperialism

name: imperative
trans: adj. 紧要的；必要的；祈使的
n. 紧要的事；命令；义务；驱使

sentences.english: It is imperative that politicians should be good communicators.
sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的
detailed_translations.english: extremely important and needing to be done or dealt with immediately

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: impending
trans: adj. 即将发生的；迫在眉睫的

sentences.english: On the morning of the expedition, I awoke with a feeling of impending disaster.
sentences.chinese: 远征出发的那天早上，我醒来就有一种大难临头的感觉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 即将发生的；迫切的；悬挂的
detailed_translations.english: an impending event or situation, especially an unpleasant one, is going to happen very soon

name: impediment
trans: n. 妨碍、阻碍某事物进展或活动的人或物 身体上的某类残疾, 缺陷

sentences.english: He was satisfied that there was no legal impediment to the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 他对于这场婚姻没有法律上的障碍感到很满意。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is an impediment to a person or thing makes their movement, development, or progress difficult

name: impedance
trans: n. 阻抗

name: impecunious
trans: adj. 没钱的, 不名一文的

sentences.english: He came from a respectable if impecunious family.
sentences.chinese: 他来自一个没钱但受人尊重的家庭。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不名一文的， 没钱的
detailed_translations.english: having very little money, especially over a long period – sometimes used humorously

name: impeccable
trans: adj. 无瑕疵的；没有缺点的

sentences.english: She has taught her children impeccable manners.
sentences.chinese: 她把她的孩子教育得举止十分得体。

sentences.english: a bar with impeccable service
sentences.chinese: 服务无可挑剔的酒吧

detailed_translations.english: without any faults and impossible to criticize

name: impartial
trans: adj. 不偏不倚的；公平的，公正的

sentences.english: We offer impartial advice on tax and insurance.
sentences.chinese: 我们就税收和保险问题提供公充的建议。

sentences.english: an impartial inquiry into the deaths
sentences.chinese: 对死亡事件的公正调查

sentences.english: an impartial observer
sentences.chinese: 公正的观察员

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平的，公正的；不偏不倚的
detailed_translations.english: not involved in a particular situation, and therefore able to give a fair opinion or piece of advice

name: impaired
trans: adj. 受损的
v. 损害（impaire的过去式和过去分词）

name: immunology
trans: n. 免疫学

name: immunity
trans: n. 免疫力；免除；豁免权

sentences.english: To protect you against small pox or diphtheria, you are vaccinated with a small amount of the toxin, and then your body develops immunity against that toxin.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免你长小脓包或得白喉病，所以会给你的身体接种小量毒素，然后你的身体会针对这些毒素产生免疫力。

sentences.english: Very few people will have any immunity to this particular combination, which is what gives the concern that this will be a pandemic rather than just a normal seasonal flu outbreak.
sentences.chinese: 因为很少有人具备对这种特别的混合病毒的免疫力。 人们因此担心，这将不仅仅是正常的季节性流感疫情，而是一次传染病的大流行。

sentences.english: But a new study shows that people with true expertise in a subject have some immunity to the siren song of corporate sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 一项新的研究发现，在某一方面有真才实学的人们对广告赞助商的“糖衣炮弹”有一定的免疫力。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being immune to a disease

name: immortal
trans: adj. 长生的；不朽的；神仙的
n. 不朽人物；神仙

sentences.english: Plato believed that the soul is immortal.
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图认为灵魂不灭。

sentences.english: ...the players considered to be the immortals of the game.
sentences.chinese: …被认为是该运动项目不朽人物的运动员们。

detailed_translations.english: living or continuing for ever
An immortal is someone who will be remembered for a long time

name: immerse
trans: vt. 沉浸；使陷入

sentences.english: She immersed herself in her work.
sentences.chinese: 她埋头工作。

detailed_translations.english: to become or make sb completely involved in sth

name: immediate
trans: adj. 立即的, 即刻的; 紧迫的 目前的, 当前的 直接的 最接近的

sentences.english: Our immediate response to the attack was sheer horror.
sentences.chinese: 我们对攻击的第一反应就是非常惊恐。

sentences.english: They promise immediate action to help the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 他们承诺立即采取行动帮助失业者。

sentences.english: If the eyes are affected, seek immediate medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 如果眼睛感染了要立即就医。

sentences.english: The funeral was attended by her immediate family (= her parents, children, brothers and sisters) only.
sentences.chinese: 只有她的直系亲属参加了葬礼。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done at once and without delay

name: immanent
trans: adj. 内在的；固有的

sentences.english: Love is a force immanent in the world.
sentences.chinese: 爱是世界上一种无处不在的力量。

detailed_translations.chinese: 内在的， 固有的； 普遍存在的， 无所不在的
detailed_translations.english: a quality that is immanent seems to be present everywhere

name: imbedded
trans: adj. 嵌入的
v. 使插入；使嵌入（imbed的过去式和过去分词）

name: illustrate
trans: vt. 给…加插图 说明, 阐明; 表明

sentences.english: Let me give an example to illustrate the point.
sentences.chinese: 让我举个例子来说明这一点。

sentences.english: She illustrated her discussion with diagrams.
sentences.chinese: 她用图表来说明她的论述。

detailed_translations.english: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

name: illumination
trans: n. 照明;强度 照度 阐明；解释；启发 (-s)彩灯,灯饰

sentences.english: White candles, the only illumination, burned on the table.
sentences.chinese: 白蜡烛作为唯一的照明在桌子上燃烧着。

sentences.english: soft illumination
sentences.chinese: 柔和的光亮

detailed_translations.chinese: 照明；[光] 照度；启发；灯饰（需用复数）；阐明
detailed_translations.english: lighting provided by a lamp, light etc

name: illuminate
trans: vt. 使明亮; 照亮 装饰 说明, 阐明

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

name: illicit
trans: adj. 违法的；不正当的

sentences.english: the illicit trade in stolen cattle
sentences.chinese: 非法买卖偷来的牛

detailed_translations.english: not allowed by laws or rules, or strongly disapproved of by society

name: ignorant
trans: adj. 无知的；愚昧的

sentences.english: an ignorant and uneducated man
sentences.chinese: 不学无术的人

detailed_translations.english: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know

name: ignominious
trans: adj. 可耻的；不名誉的

sentences.english: an ignominious end to his career
sentences.chinese: 他职业生涯不光彩的终结

detailed_translations.english: making you feel ashamed or embarrassed

name: ignition
trans: n. 点火，点燃；着火，燃烧；点火开关，点火装置

sentences.english: The device automatically disconnects the ignition.
sentences.chinese: 那个装置自动断开了点火器。

detailed_translations.chinese: 点火，点燃；着火，燃烧；点火开关，点火装置
detailed_translations.english: the electrical part of a vehicle’s engine that makes it start working

name: idiom
trans: n. 成语，习语；土话

sentences.english: ..familiar idioms and metaphors, such as "turning over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: …如“翻开新的一页”这样熟悉的习语和比喻。

detailed_translations.english: a group of words that has a special meaning that is different from the ordinary meaning of each separate word. For example, ‘under the weather’ is an idiom meaning ‘ill’.

name: ideology
trans: n. 意识形态；思想意识；观念学

sentences.english: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态

sentences.english: a new ideology based on individualism
sentences.chinese: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

name: identity
trans: n. 身份；同一性，一致；恒等式；特性

sentences.english: The identity of the killer is still unknown.
sentences.chinese: 凶手的身份仍未查明。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s identity is their name or who they are

name: identical
trans: adj. 同一的

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: iconic
trans: adj. [计]图标的，形象的

trans: n. 布洛芬,异丁苯丙酸

detailed_translations.chinese: 布洛芬，异丁苯丙酸（抗炎，镇痛药）
detailed_translations.english: a medicine that reduces pain, inflammation, and fever

name: hysteresis
trans: n. 滞后现象

name: hypo
trans: n. 定影剂；海波；吸毒成瘾者

name: hypnotize
trans: vt. 施催眠术；使恍惚；使着迷

sentences.english: We were completely hypnotized by her performance of the Haydn.
sentences.chinese: 我们完全陶醉在她演奏的海顿作品之中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使着迷；对…施催眠术；使恍惚
detailed_translations.english: to produce a sleep-like state in someone so that you can influence their thoughts and actions

name: hypertension
trans: n. 过度紧张；高血压

detailed_translations.english: a medical condition in which your  blood pressure  is too high

name: hypercritical
trans: adj. (尤指对小错误)吹毛求疵的;过于苛刻的

sentences.english: He's as big a geek as Zuckerberg, but of a different type: the hypercritical, even sometimes nasty type.
sentences.chinese: 他与扎克伯格一样，是个超级极客，只不过是另一种类型的：他吹毛求疵，有时甚至令人讨厌。

sentences.english: I know it's time to grow up, stop being hypercritical and just enter the dating pool, with all its clichés and absolute disappointments.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，是时候要长大了，我该停止吹毛求疵，去约会，不管它有多老套，有多让人失望。

detailed_translations.english: too eager to criticize other people and things, especially about small details

name: hyperbole
trans: n. 夸张的语句；夸张法

sentences.english: It was not hyperbole to call it the worst storm in twenty years.
sentences.chinese: 称它是20年来最大的风暴并不为过。

detailed_translations.english: a way of describing something by saying it is much bigger, smaller, worse etc than it actually is

name: hymn
trans: n. 赞美诗；圣歌；欢乐的歌
vt. 唱赞美歌

sentences.english: He liked to sing hymns as he worked.
sentences.chinese: 他工作时喜欢唱赞美诗。

detailed_translations.english: a song of praise to God

name: hygrostat
trans: n. 恒湿器

name: hygiene
trans: n. 卫生学；卫生；保健法

sentences.english: the importance of personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 个人卫生的重要性

sentences.english: a food hygiene training course
sentences.chinese: 食品卫生培训课程

detailed_translations.english: the practice of keeping yourself and the things around you clean in order to prevent diseases

name: hyena
trans: n. 鬣狗，土狼

name: hydroxide
trans: n. 氢氧化物

sentences.english: Thus, sodium hydroxide was used in this work for the pretreatment of ramie fiber.
sentences.chinese: 因此，氢氧化钠是在这项工作中所使用的预处理苎麻纤维。

sentences.english: Precious metals: hydroxide precipitation and sedimentation plus precious metal recovery, e. g. evaporation, ion exchange, etc.
sentences.chinese: 贵金属：氢氧化物沉淀+贵金属回收，如蒸发，离子交换等等。

sentences.english: The former includes graphite metallic disulfide etc; and the latter consists of layered silicate metallic double hydroxide etc.
sentences.chinese: 前者包括石墨、金属硫化物等；后者包括层状硅酸盐、金属双氢氧化物等。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical  compound  that contains an oxygen atom combined with a  hydrogen  atom

name: hydrogen
trans: n. 氢

sentences.english: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水含有氢和氧。

sentences.english: Water can be reduced to oxygen and hydrogen by electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 水通过电解可以分解为氧和氢。

sentences.english: The first bubbles to escape from the liquid are a mixture of air and hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 从该液体中最先逸出的气泡是空气和氢的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: Hydrogen is a colourless gas that is the lightest and commonest element in the universe

name: hydraulic
trans: adj. 液力的,液压的,水力学的

sentences.english: a hydraulic pump
sentences.chinese: 水压泵，液压泵

sentences.english: hydraulic brakes
sentences.chinese: 液压制动器

detailed_translations.chinese: 液压的；水力的；水力学的
detailed_translations.english: moved or operated by the pressure of water or other liquid

name: hydrate
trans: n. [化]氢氧化物；[化]水合物
vt. 使成水化合物

sentences.english: After you run, drink plenty of water to stay well hydrated.
sentences.chinese: 跑步后要多喝水，以保持体内水分充足。

detailed_translations.english: to supply someone or something with water to keep them healthy and in good condition
a chemical substance that contains water

name: hut
trans: n. 小屋；临时营房
vt. 使住在小屋中；驻扎

sentences.english: a wooden hut
sentences.chinese: 小木屋

detailed_translations.english: a small simple building with only one or two rooms

name: husky
trans: adj. 声音沙哑的；有壳的；强壮的
n. 强壮结实之人；爱斯基摩人

sentences.english: ‘Come quickly,’ she said in a husky whisper.
sentences.chinese: “快来。”她用沙哑的嗓音低声说道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声音沙哑的；有壳的；强壮的
detailed_translations.english: a husky voice is deep, quiet, and attractive

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮结实之人；爱斯基摩人
detailed_translations.english: a dog with thick hair used in Canada and Alaska to pull  sledges  over the snow

name: husker
trans: n. 玉米去苞叶机

name: husk
trans: n. 皮；外壳；无价值之物
vt. 削皮；以粗哑的嗓音说

sentences.english: There you are, in the coffin, or in an urn, your body reduced to a husk of meant-to-be's.
sentences.chinese: 你现在是这副样子，躺在棺材里，或者骨灰盒里。 你的身体沦为一张毫无意思的臭皮囊。

sentences.english: All the days of his separation shall he eat nothing that is made of the vine tree, from the kernels even to the husk.
sentences.chinese: 在一切离俗的日子，凡葡萄树上结的，自核至皮所作的物，都不可吃。

sentences.english: How can we remove the husk of the grains?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样去掉谷物的外皮？

detailed_translations.english: to remove the husks from grains, seeds etc
the dry outer part of corn, some grains, seeds, nuts etc

name: hush
trans: vt. 安静；缄默；肃静
n. 安静；沉默；肃静

sentences.english: Ella asked them to hush their voices.
sentences.chinese: 埃拉叫他们别作声。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone stop shouting, talking, crying etc
a period of silence, especially when people are expecting something to happen

name: hurl
trans: v. 用力投掷；愤慨地说出；丢下

sentences.english: Demonstrators were hurling bricks through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 示威者在向窗里掷砖块。

sentences.english: He hurled a chair across the set, smashing lamps and vases.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起一把椅子扔向片场的那头，把灯和花瓶都砸得粉碎。

detailed_translations.english: to throw something with a lot of force, especially because you are angry

name: hurdle
trans: n. 障碍；跳栏；栏
vt. 克服

sentences.english: Finding enough money for the project was the first hurdle.
sentences.chinese: 第一道难关是为该项目筹措足够的资金。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or difficulty that you must deal with before you can achieve something

name: hungarian
trans: n. 匈牙利人；匈牙利语
adj. 匈牙利的；匈牙利人的；匈牙利语的

name: hunch
trans: n. 预感；大块；肉峰
vt. 耸肩；预感到；弯腰驼背 vi. 隆起；向前移动

sentences.english: I had a hunch that Susan and I would work well together.
sentences.chinese: 我凭直觉感到我和苏珊共事会很融洽。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a hunch that something is true or will happen, you feel that it is true or will happen

name: hump
trans: n. 圆形隆起物；驼背；驼峰
vi. 隆起；弓起；努力；急速行进

sentences.english: the hump of a hill
sentences.chinese: 山冈

detailed_translations.english: a large round shape that rises above the surface of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 隆起；弓起；努力；急速行进

name: humming
trans: adj. 发嗡嗡声的；精力旺盛的
n. 哼唱

name: humiliation
trans: n. 丢脸，耻辱；蒙羞；谦卑

sentences.english: the humiliation of having to ask her parents for money
sentences.chinese: 不得不开口伸手向她父母要钱的难堪

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of shame and great embarrassment, because you have been made to look stupid or weak

name: humiliating
trans: adj. 丢脸的；伤自尊的

sentences.english: a humiliating defeat
sentences.chinese: 丢脸的失败

detailed_translations.english: making you feel ashamed, embarrassed, and angry because you have been made to look weak or stupid

name: humiliate
trans: vt. 使 ... 蒙羞；使丢脸

sentences.english: Her boss humiliated her in front of all her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她的老板在所有同事面前羞辱了她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed or stupid, especially when other people are present

name: hum
trans: vi. 发低哼声
vt. 用哼声表示

sentences.english: He began to hum a tune.
sentences.chinese: 他开始哼唱一支曲子。

detailed_translations.english: to sing a tune by making a continuous sound with your lips closed
a low continuous sound

name: hue
trans: n. 色调；色彩；样子；意味；信仰；喊叫

sentences.english: a golden hue
sentences.chinese: 一种金黄色调

detailed_translations.english: a colour or type of colour

name: hubris
trans: n. 傲慢；狂妄自大

sentences.english: ...a tale of how an honourable man pursuing honourable goals was afflicted with hubris and led his nation toward catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: ...一个有关追求崇高目标的磊落君子如何因自高自大、而将自己的国家引向灾难的故事。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride

name: howler
trans: n. 大声叫喊者；嚎叫的人或动物；滑稽可笑的错误

sentences.english: I felt as if I had made an outrageous howler.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己似乎犯了个不可容忍的低级错误。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大声叫喊者；嚎叫的人或动物；滑稽可笑的错误
detailed_translations.english: a stupid mistake that makes people laugh

name: hover
trans: vi. 盘旋，翱翔；徘徊
n. 徘徊；盘旋；犹豫

sentences.english: Her younger brother hovered in the background watching us.
sentences.chinese: 她的弟弟在后面走来走去，观察着我们。

detailed_translations.english: if a bird, insect, or  helicopter  hovers, it stays in one place in the air

name: household
trans: n. 家庭；户
adj. 家庭的；家喻户晓的

sentences.english: household chores
sentences.chinese: 家务杂活

sentences.english: ...growing up in a male-only household.

detailed_translations.english: relating to looking after a house and the people in it
A household is all the people in a family or group who live together in a house

name: hotshot

adj. 高手的；特快的

trans: n. 旅社，招待所（尤指青年旅社）

sentences.english: The 260-bed hostel on Second Street, just two blocks from the beach, had come highly recommended by an Angeleno I’d met on a recent trip to the Caribbean.
sentences.chinese: 这家有260张床位的招待所离海滩只有两个街区，是我在最近一次去加勒比海的旅途上遇见的一个洛杉矶人极力推荐的。

detailed_translations.english: a place where people can stay and eat fairly cheaply

name: hose
trans: n. 连裤袜, 长筒袜, 短统袜 软管, 胶管, 水龙头
vt. 用软管浇[冲洗]

sentences.chinese: 发动机舱里的水由一条软管吸走。

detailed_translations.english: A hose is a pipe made of rubber or plastic, along which a liquid or gas flows, for example from one part of an engine to another
to wash or pour water over something or someone, using a hose

sentences.english: The area has a long tradition of horticulture.
sentences.chinese: 园艺是这个地区源远流长的传统。

sentences.english: Thus, to earn a Plant Science merit badge, a scout can choose between agronomy, horticulture, or field botany.
sentences.chinese: 因此，为了赚取植物科学奖章，一个童子军可以选择农学，园艺，或田野植物学。

sentences.english: All volunteers first go through orientation sessions, which are followed with one of three more specific training tracks:horticulture, “Ambassadors, ” and animal care.
sentences.chinese: 所有的志愿者先要通过新成员训练，然后再在三种特殊训练规划（园艺、“大使”和动物照料）中选择一种。

detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of growing flowers, fruit, and vegetables

detailed_translations.chinese: 可怕的；恐怖的；极讨厌的

sentences.english: a horrible smell

sentences.chinese: 那食物看上去很糟，可吃起来还不错。

trans: n. 冬青树（等于holm oak）

vi. 形成空洞

sentences.chinese: 你这个贪婪鬼！

sentences.english: I would rather hoe in the garden than run about on the playground.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿在花园里锄草，不愿在运动场上跑来跑去。

sentences.english: I would rather hoe in the garden than run about on the playground .
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿在花园锄草，也不愿在运动场上跑来跑去。

sentences.chinese: 罢工期间囤积食品的家庭

sentences.chinese: 任何一个蜂房中最重要的成员都是蜂王。

sentences.chinese: 人们一定要记住的是，一个蜂巢很快会变成两个，两个变成四个，四个变成八个。

sentences.chinese: 蛇发出的嘶嘶声

sentences.chinese: 那只猫咝咝叫着退开了。

name: hippopotamus
trans: n. 河马

sentences.english: Still, now we knew for sure where whales came from and that the hippopotamus theory wasn't complete science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 虽然，我们现在已肯定知道鲸来自何处，但是我们也清楚了，河马之说还不够完整。

sentences.english: Only two-and-a-half weeks old but already weighing in at 40kg (88lb) a baby hippopotamus swims alongside her mother, Kathi.
sentences.chinese: 这只有两周半大却重达40公斤（88磅）的河马宝宝正游曳在妈妈凯瑟琳旁边。

sentences.english: We were walking along the bank of the Niger river, searching for the tracks of a hippopotamus that was ravaging the corn on Karim's farm.
sentences.chinese: 当时，我们正走在尼日尔的河岸上，寻找着毁坏克莱姆村农场农作物的罪魁祸手河马的踪迹。

detailed_translations.english: a large grey African animal with a big head and mouth that lives near water

name: hippo
trans: n. 河马；吐根

sentences.english: This photo of a hippo at Disney World has absolutely nothing to do with this post and only serves to confuse things.
sentences.chinese: 这张迪斯尼世界河马照片绝对与本文章毫无关联，放这里只会让你莫名其妙。

sentences.english: "One thing we know about the Herto people, they had a taste for meat, especially hippos, " White said, brushing some sand off a hippo skull.
sentences.chinese: “我们知道赫托人已经开始吃肉了，尤其是河马肉，”怀特一边说着，一边将一具河马头骨上的沙土拭去。

sentences.english: Described as one of the most aggressive creatures in the animal kingdom, an adult hippo can apply several tons of pressure in a single bite.
sentences.chinese: 成年河马是动物王国里最有攻击力的家伙之一，它一嘴咬下来的压力就能有好几吨。

sentences.chinese: 耆那教不相信任何神的存在，但他们也和印度教和佛教一样信奉因果报应和轮回转世。

name: hilarious
trans: adj. 十分有趣的, 非常滑稽的 欢闹的

sentences.chinese: 这些注意力完全放在衣服和欢闹的设计上了。

sentences.chinese: 即时它摧毁了我的家，但现在十分我喜欢我糟糕的生活，当我不能使其他人确信是我发现它是欢闹的。

sentences.chinese: 她在公司一步一步升到了总裁的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance

sentences.chinese: 一条很难看的连衣裙

sentences.chinese: 婴儿在进食时或进食后常常会打一阵嗝儿。

sentences.english: Dormice hibernate from October to May.
sentences.chinese: 睡鼠从10月到5月冬眠。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒
detailed_translations.english: if an animal hibernates, it sleeps for the whole winter

name: hexagonal
trans: adj. 六角形的；六边的；底面为六角的

sentences.english: Instead it is the Desert Express that pulls in, its nine coaches in smart blue, orange and white livery with large hexagonal windows.
sentences.chinese: 然而驶进车站的是沙漠快车，它的九节车厢漆成漂亮的蓝色、橙色和白色，带有六边形的车窗。

sentences.english: He has instead looked to the hexagonal matrices of snowflakes, which as structurally supported objects combine high volume with low weight.

sentences.english: In fact, I have kept a souvenir of those days: a dark green hexagonal glass spittoon that is now a very original flowerpot.
sentences.chinese: 说真的，我还保存了一个那个时代的纪念品--一个深绿色六角形的玻璃痰盂，如今，它成为了我的一个很别致的花盆。

detailed_translations.english: A hexagonal object or shape has six straight sides

sentences.chinese: 她拯救家人的英勇行为

sentences.english: Lawrence’s heroic struggle against his destiny
sentences.chinese: 劳伦斯与命运的勇敢抗争

sentences.english: She portrayed him as a heroic figure .
sentences.chinese: 她把他描述为英雄人物。

sentences.english: He said his advice was: "No heroics, stay within the law."
sentences.chinese: 他说他的意见是：“不要有逞能行为，要依法办事。”

If you describe someone's actions or plans as heroics, you think that they are foolish or dangerous because they are too difficult or brave for the situation in which they occur

sentences.chinese: 它的电影业以奇特而封闭的方式运作。

name: hereditary

vi. 预示

sentences.english: A flash of lightning heralded torrential rain.
sentences.chinese: 一道闪电预示着暴雨即将来临。

sentences.english: Flashing blue lights heralded the arrival of the police.
sentences.chinese: 闪烁的蓝色灯光预示警察就要到达。

sentences.english: I welcome the report as a herald of more freedom.
sentences.chinese: 我欢迎这份报告，认为它预示着更多的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to be a sign of something that is going to come or happen soon

detailed_translations.chinese: 信使； 预示， 预兆
detailed_translations.english: Something that is a herald of a future event or situation is a sign that it is going to happen or appear

name: hemp
trans: n. 大麻；麻类植物；大麻烟卷
adj. 大麻类植物的

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the US does not discriminate between hemp and marijuana, so growing it for food and fiber in this country is illegal.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，美国不区分毒品大麻和能量大麻，因此在该国把它添加它到粮食和用作提取纤维是非法的。

sentences.english: But there are also a lot of other fibers that we can use like hemp silks, a very green fabric that gives back nitrogen to the soil," she said.
sentences.chinese: 但其实还有很多其他的纤维，例如我们可以使用类似大麻纤维丝，这是一种很绿色织物，它可以将氮元素返还到土壤中“她说。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大麻；麻类植物；大麻烟卷
detailed_translations.english: a type of plant that is used to make rope and sometimes to produce the drug  cannabis

name: helmet
trans: n. 钢盔，头盔

sentences.english: The Sword split the Knight's helmet and bit him fatally.
sentences.chinese: 剑劈开了骑士的头盔并致命地刺进他。

sentences.english: Instead, he was told the last time that she loved him, got a hug from her, put his helmet on her so that she can live, and die himself...
sentences.chinese: 相反，他叫女孩最后一次说她爱他，最后一次拥抱他，并让她戴上自己的头盔，因而，女孩可以幸免于难，而他自己却离开了人世……

sentences.english: Without Christ we are defenseless against the Devil, but with "the helmet of salvation" our minds are protected by God.
sentences.chinese: 没有基督，我们无力防御魔鬼的攻击；但有救恩的头盔，我们的心思便有神的保护。

detailed_translations.english: a strong hard hat that soldiers,  motorcycle  riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads

name: helical
trans: adj. 螺旋形的

name: heiress
trans: n. 女继承人

sentences.english: ...the heiress to a jewellery empire.
sentences.chinese: …一家大型珠宝公司的女继承人。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who will receive or has received a lot of money or property after the death of an older member of her family

name: heir
trans: n. 继承人；后嗣；嗣子

sentences.english: Jonson was his political heir as leader of the party.
sentences.chinese: 琼森是他的政治接班人，他将担任该党派的领袖。

detailed_translations.english: the person who has the legal right to receive the property or title of another person when they die

name: hegemony
trans: n. 霸权；领导权；盟主权

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which one state or country controls others

name: heft
trans: n. 重量；分量；重要性
v. 举起试重量；举起

name: hedonism
trans: n. 快乐主义；快乐论

sentences.english: ...the life of hedonism that she embraced in her youth.
sentences.chinese: …她年轻时所奉行的享乐主义生活。

detailed_translations.english: Hedonism is the belief that gaining pleasure is the most important thing in life

name: heavier
trans: adj. 更沉重的；更巨大的

sentences.english: Just as in the sun, the chain reaction in the second stage fuses the hydrogen atoms into heavier helium atoms and releases vast amounts of energy in the process.
sentences.chinese: 正如在太阳上所进行的反应一样，第二阶段连锁反应将氢原子聚合成较重的氦原子并在这一过程中释放出巨大的能量。

sentences.english: The animal was heavier than Gerard had expected, shifting its weight mysteriously from one corner of the box to another as he carried it out into the snow and set it on the seat beside him.
sentences.chinese: 这个动物要比杰拉德想象的要重些，当勃兹曼顶着雪走出来并把它放在杰拉德座位旁边时，箱子里动物的重量神秘的从箱子的一角偏向另一角。

name: healer
trans: n. 医治者（尤指用宗教迷信方式给人治病的人）；治疗物；治病术士

detailed_translations.english: A healer is a person who heals people, especially a person who heals through prayer and religious faith

name: headwater
trans: n. 上游(河源)

name: head-on
trans: adj. 正面的

name: headgear
trans: n. 帽子；马首挽具；[矿]井架；[口]牙齿矫正器

detailed_translations.chinese: 帽子；马首挽具；[矿业] 井架；牙齿矫正器
detailed_translations.english: hats and other things that you wear on your head

name: hay
trans: n. 干草
vt. 把晒干

sentences.english: bales of hay.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 一捆捆的干草。

detailed_translations.english: long grass that has been cut and dried, used as food for cattle

name: havoc
trans: n. 大破坏；浩劫；蹂躏
vt. 严重破坏

sentences.english: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震对这座城市造成了大破坏。

sentences.english: He points out that some past offenders in Michigan have been released only to cause havoc and end up in jail again.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，过去密歇根释放的一些犯人只是与造成严重破坏的人有关，而且最后又都重新回到监狱里。

sentences.english: The earthquake wreaked havoc on the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震对这个城市造成了大破坏。

name: haunt
trans: vt. 常出没于…；萦绕于…；经常去…
vi. 出没；作祟

sentences.english: The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former landlord.
sentences.chinese: 据说这个酒吧里经常有一位前任房主的鬼魂出没。

detailed_translations.chinese: 常出没于；使苦恼，使担忧；萦绕在心头，缠绕
detailed_translations.english: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often
a place that someone likes to go to often

name: haul
trans: n. 用力拖拉；努力得到的结果；拖，拉；捕获物；一网捕获的鱼量；拖运距离
vt. 拖运；拖拉

sentences.english: the steam locomotive which hauled the train
sentences.chinese: 拖动火车的蒸汽机车

sentences.english: I hauled the door shut behind me.
sentences.chinese: 我用力拽上了门。

detailed_translations.english: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖， 拉， 托运； 一次获得的数量
detailed_translations.english: the amount of fish caught when fishing with a net

name: hatchback
trans: n. 装有向上开的后车门的小轿车

name: hasty
trans: adj. 匆忙的；轻率的；草率的；性怠的

sentences.english: He soon regretted his hasty decision.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就对自己仓促作出的决定感到后悔了。

sentences.english: a hasty breakfast
sentences.chinese: 匆忙吃下的一顿早餐

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻率的；匆忙的；草率的；懈怠的
detailed_translations.english: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

name: hash
trans: n. 剁碎的食物；混杂，拼凑；重新表述
vt. 搞糟，把…弄乱；切细；推敲

detailed_translations.chinese: 剁碎的食物；混杂，拼凑；重新表述

name: harp
trans: n. 竖琴
v. 反复诉说；唠叨

sentences.english: She began to harp us to drink after dinner.
sentences.chinese: 用餐后，她开始弹奏起竖琴让我们饮酒消食。

sentences.english: She swept her fingers over the strings of the harp.
sentences.chinese: 她用手指划过竖琴的琴弦。

sentences.english: I never learned how to tune a harp, or play upon a lute; but I know how to raise a small and obscure city to glory and greatness...where to all kindreds of the earth will pilgrim.
sentences.chinese: 我从未学习过如何为竖琴调弦，也不知如何弹奏鲁特琴。 但我懂得如何使一座偏僻的无名小镇发展成辉煌而伟大的城市，使世界各国的子民前来朝圣。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弹奏竖琴；喋喋不休；不停地说

detailed_translations.english: a large musical instrument with strings that are stretched across a vertical frame with three corners, and that you play with your fingers

name: harness
trans: n. 马具, 挽具
vt. 给(马等)装上挽具 治理, 利用

sentences.english: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以利用风力发电。

detailed_translations.english: to control and use the natural force or power of something

name: harmony
trans: n. 协调；融洽；调和；和睦

sentences.english: the gorgeous vocal harmonies on ‘Mexicali Rose’
sentences.chinese: 《墨西哥玫瑰》的精彩和声演唱

sentences.english: three-part harmonies
sentences.chinese: 三部和声

detailed_translations.english: notes of music combined together in a pleasant way

name: harmonisation
trans: n. 和谐；融洽；悦耳

name: harmonica
trans: n. 口琴

sentences.english: Usually Gus would bring his harmonica and, after talking for a little while, they’d play a few songs together.
sentences.chinese: 通常盖斯会带着他的口琴，在聊了一会儿以后，他们会一起演奏几首歌。

sentences.english: In 1995, when the ban went into effect, the only instrument allowed in the Cumberland prison was the harmonica, but inmates who already had a guitar or electronic keyboard were allowed to keep them.
sentences.chinese: 1995年该禁令实行后，坎伯兰监狱的囚犯们被允许拥有的乐器就只剩下口琴了，但在此之前已经有电吉他或键盘的囚犯被批准可以保留这些乐器。

sentences.english: He made a harmonica out of the corncob.
sentences.chinese: 他把玉米棒子弄得象口琴一样。

detailed_translations.english: a small musical instrument that you play by blowing or sucking and moving it from side to side near your mouth

name: harem
trans: n. 为一个雄性动物所控制的许多雌性动物；闺房里的妻妾群；闺房（伊斯兰教教徒的）

sentences.english: A long, plump, pillowed sofa stretched the length of one wall, and upon it four women were disposed like odalisques in a harem.
sentences.chinese: 一张松软带靠垫的长沙发沿墙放着，四个女人像穆斯林闺房中的妇女一样散坐在上面。

detailed_translations.english: part of a Muslim house that is separate from the rest of the house, where only women live

name: hare
trans: n. 野兔

sentences.english: Because it makes its home in an extreme environment, the desert hare is biologically designed to radiate excess heat through its lanky limbs and oversized ears.
sentences.chinese: 因为生长在极端环境中，沙漠兔子形成了独特的生物学构造，通过瘦长的四肢和超大的耳朵辐射多余的热量。

sentences.english: He found the shin-bone of a hare lying on the grass.
sentences.chinese: 他在草地上发现一根野兔的胫骨，骨头上有个洞；

detailed_translations.english: an animal like a rabbit but larger, which can run very quickly

name: harassment
trans: n. 骚扰, 扰乱

sentences.english: African-Americans have been complaining about police harassment for years.
sentences.chinese: 美国黑人多年来一直抱怨受到警察的骚扰。

detailed_translations.english: when someone behaves in an unpleasant or threatening way towards you

name: harass
trans: vt. 使烦恼；使困扰；反复袭击

sentences.english: A number of black youths have complained of being harassed by the police.
sentences.chinese: 一些黑人青年投诉称受到警察骚扰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使困扰；使烦恼；反复袭击
detailed_translations.english: to make someone’s life unpleasant, for example by frequently saying offensive things to them or threatening them

name: hangover
trans: n. 宿醉；遗物；残留物

sentences.english: I had a terrible hangover the next day.
sentences.chinese: 第二天我的宿醉反应很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: a pain in your head and a feeling of sickness that you get the day after you have drunk too much alcohol

name: hanging
trans: n. 绞刑；帘子，幔帐；悬挂
adj. 悬挂着的

name: handy
trans: adj. 手边的，就近的；便利的；容易取得的；敏捷的

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

name: handshake
trans: n. 握手

sentences.english: He greeted me with a handshake and a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 他与我握手问候，并递给我一杯酒。

sentences.english: Her handshake was warm and firm.
sentences.chinese: 她的握手温暖而有力。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking someone’s right hand and shaking it, which people do when they meet or leave each other or when they have made an agreement

name: handouts
trans: n. 讲义；宣传册子，宣传品（handout的复数形式）

name: handicraft
trans: n. 手工艺品；手艺；技巧

sentences.english: a shop selling handicrafts
sentences.chinese: 一家出售手工艺品的商店

detailed_translations.english: an activity such as sewing or making baskets, in which you use your hands in a skilful way to make things

name: handicap
trans: n. 障碍；不利条件，不利的因素
vt. 妨碍，阻碍；使不利

sentences.english: Not speaking the language is a real handicap.
sentences.chinese: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes it difficult for someone to do what they want
to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do

name: hamper
trans: vt. 妨碍；束缚；使困累
n. 食盒，食篮；阻碍物

sentences.english: She tried to run, but was hampered by her heavy suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 她想跑，但沉重的旅行箱拖累了她。

sentences.english: An attempt to rescue the men has been hampered by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 对那几名男子的营救行动受到恶劣天气的阻碍。

detailed_translations.english: to make it difficult for someone to do something
a basket with a lid, which is used for carrying food or sending it to someone as a present

name: hammock
trans: n. 吊床；吊铺；吊带
vt. 睡吊床

sentences.english: Hang a hammock; lie in it.
sentences.chinese: 挂上一个吊床，然后躺在里面。

sentences.english: Many nights, I cried silently in my hammock, tears of self-pity streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 许多个晚上，我在吊床上静静地哭泣，自伤自怜的泪水顺着脸往下淌。

sentences.english: But when I started to read the journals that I'd written in my hammock each night, I realised that I'd been pretty miserable for large parts of the journey.
sentences.chinese: 但是当我开始阅读在旅行中我每个夜晚在吊床上写下的文字时，我才意识到，在这次旅程的大部分时间里，我都是倍受折磨和煎熬的。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of cloth that is hung between two trees or posts so that you can sleep in it

name: halve
trans: vt. 二等分；把……减半

sentences.english: Cash cuts have halved the number of places available on training courses.
sentences.chinese: 经费削减使培训名额减少了一半。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something by a half

name: halting
trans: adj. 犹豫的；蹒跚的；跛的
v. 停止；蹒跚；犹豫（halt的ing形式）

sentences.english: We carried on a rather halting conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我们断断续续地交谈。

name: halter
trans: n. 绞索；缰绳
vt. 给…套上缰绳；束缚

sentences.english: When the man saw this he put a halter on the ass at once, and gave him back to his owner.
sentences.chinese: 当这个男人看到这个情景后，他立刻把缰绳套在驴上，把它还给了它的主人。

detailed_translations.english: a rope or leather band that fastens around a horse’s head, usually used to lead the horse

name: halt
trans: vi. 停止；踌躇，犹豫；立定
n. 停止；立定；休息

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: halo
trans: n. 光环；荣光
vt. 使有晕轮；围以光环

sentences.english: Wearing a bee halo, Mark hopped over one fence, then another.
sentences.chinese: 戴着蜜蜂的光环，马克跳过一个又一个篱笆。

sentences.english: There is a strict halo of seriousness around science in Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 在埃及，科学被一个严肃性的严格光环包围着。

sentences.english: But what this experiment demonstrates is that although we can understand the halo effect intellectually, we often have no idea when it is actually happening.
sentences.chinese: 但是上面这个实验所证明的是，虽然我们在智力上可以理解光环效应，但是我们通常不知道它到底什么时候在起作用。

detailed_translations.english: a bright circle that is often shown above or around the heads of holy people in religious art

name: hallucination
trans: n. 幻觉，幻想；错觉

sentences.english: The patients suffered hallucinations caused by the drug.
sentences.chinese: 病人受药物影响产生了幻觉。

detailed_translations.english: something which you imagine you can see or hear, but which is not really there, or the experience of this

name: hallucinate
trans: v. 幻听，幻视，产生幻觉

sentences.english: Hunger made him hallucinate.
sentences.chinese: 饥饿使他产生了幻觉。

detailed_translations.english: to see or hear things that are not really there

name: hallmark
trans: n. 品质证明；特点
vt. 给…盖上品质证明印记；使具有…标志

detailed_translations.english: an idea, method, or quality that is typical of a particular person or thing

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…盖上品质证明印记；使具有…标志
detailed_translations.english: to put a hallmark on silver, gold, or platinum

name: halcyon
trans: adj. 平稳的；宁静的
n. 翡翠鸟；神翠鸟

sentences.english: It was all a far cry from those halcyon days in 1990, when he won three tournaments on the European tour.
sentences.chinese: 这和1990年的那些美好时光迥然不同，当时他在欧洲巡回赛中赢了三场锦标赛。

detailed_translations.english: A halcyon time is a time in the past that was peaceful or happy

name: Hakka
trans: n. （汉）客家；客家人；客家语

name: hail
trans: n. 冰雹；致敬；招呼；一阵
vt. 招呼；猛发；致敬；向...欢呼；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

name: hag
trans: n. 丑老太婆；女巫

sentences.english: Then, the wrinkled hag watching every portion you eat forces you to eat that vomit.
sentences.chinese: 然后，这个看着你吃的有皱纹的丑陋的老太婆强迫你吃你吐的东西。

detailed_translations.english: an ugly or unpleasant woman, especially one who is old or looks like a witch

name: hack
trans: n. 砍，劈；出租马车
vt. 砍；出租

sentences.english: One more hack and the branch was off.
sentences.chinese: 又砍了一下树枝就掉下来了。

detailed_translations.english: a taxi, or a taxi driver
to cut something roughly or violently

name: habitus
trans: n. 习惯；体质；状态

name: gymnastics
trans: n. 体操

sentences.english: a gymnastics display
sentences.chinese: 体操表演

sentences.english: We don’t do gymnastics at school.
sentences.chinese: 我们学校没有体操训练。

detailed_translations.english: a sport involving physical exercises and movements that need skill, strength, and control, and that are often performed in competitions

name: gymnastic
trans: adj. 体操的；体育的

sentences.english: On our return from school our drawing and gymnastic masters would be ready for us.
sentences.chinese: 放学回来，我们的图画和体操老师已在家里恭候多时了。

sentences.english: Sylvia didn’t have any gymnastic classes but she was tall, strong, and she was popular.

trans: n. 锣；钟状物；[英俚]奖章

detailed_translations.english: a round piece of metal that hangs in a frame and which you hit with a stick to give a deep ringing sound. It is used as a musical instrument or to announce that a meal is ready.

detailed_translations.chinese: 鸣锣传唤；鸣锣命令驾车者停驶

name: goddess
trans: n. 女神，受崇拜的女性

sentences.english: Aphrodite, goddess of love
sentences.chinese: 爱神阿佛洛狄忒

detailed_translations.english: a female being who is believed to control the world or part of it, or represents a particular quality

name: gobble
trans: vt. 狼吞虎咽；很快用完；发出咯咯叫声
n. 咯咯叫声

sentences.english: The gobble sound, from the male turkeys, on the other hand, sounds exactly like you’d expect from the name and they do this all the time.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面来说，雄火鸡发出的咯咯声听上去绝对就是你从它们的名字就能预料到的那样，而火鸡一直如此。

detailed_translations.english: to make a sound like a  turkey
the loud rapid gurgling sound made by male turkeys

trans: n. （赶牲口用的）刺棒；刺激；激励
vt. 刺激；激励；用刺棒驱赶；煽动

sentences.english: The offer of economic aid was a goad to political change.
sentences.chinese: 提供经济援助是政治改革的推动力。

sentences.chinese: 查尔斯老是刺激我。

detailed_translations.english: something that forces someone to do something

name: gnawed
trans: adj. 缺刻状的
v. 咬；侵蚀（gnaw的过去分词）

trans: vt. 咬；折磨；侵蚀
vi. 咬；折磨；侵蚀

sentences.english: Dexter gnawed his pen thoughtfully.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特若有所思地咬着钢笔。

sentences.english: A rat had gnawed a hole in the box.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠在箱子上咬了一个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to keep biting something hard

name: gluttonous
trans: adj. 暴食的,饕餮的,贪吃的

sentences.english: ...a selfish, gluttonous and lazy person.
sentences.chinese: ...一个自私、贪食而又懒惰的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: If you think that someone eats too much or is greedy, you can say they are gluttonous

trans: adj. 黏的,胶质的

sentences.chinese: 这种粘酱尝起来感觉不自然。

sentences.english: ...soft and glutinous mud.
sentences.chinese: ...柔软粘稠的泥巴。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is glutinous is very sticky

name: glug

trans: vi. 发热；洋溢；绚丽夺目

sentences.english: The fireplace was still glowing with the remains of last night’s fire.
sentences.chinese: 壁炉中，隔夜的余烬依然在微微发光。

sentences.english: The red tip of his cigarette was glowing in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 他那红红的烟头在黑暗中幽幽发光。

sentences.english: The moisturizer gave my face a healthy glow that lasted all day.
sentences.chinese: 这种润肤霜给我脸上带来了持续整天的一种健康的红光。

A glow is a pink colour on a person's face, usually because they are healthy or have been exercising

name: glossary
trans: n. 术语（特殊用语）表；词汇表；专业词典
