detailed_translations.english: a list of special words and explanations of their meanings, often at the end of a book

sentences.chinese: 她梦想着将来能得到奥运冠军的荣誉。

sentences.english: Goran’s moment of glory came when he defeated Rafter.
sentences.chinese: 戈兰击败拉夫特，迎来了荣耀的一刻。

name: gloomy
trans: adj. 黑暗的；沮丧的；阴郁的

sentences.chinese: 这篇报告描绘了一幅惨淡的经济现状。

sentences.english: Don't gloat,the same misfortune may happen to you one day.
sentences.chinese: 不要幸灾乐祸，说不定同样的不幸会落到你的头上。

sentences.english: Yet, in announcing the news to the United States and the world, Obama was careful not to gloat, as his predecessor George W Bush might well have done had the killing taken place under his watch.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在向美国和世界宣布这个消息时，奥巴马却显的小心谨慎，没有表现出一点幸灾乐祸，因为他的前任乔治·布什任期内没有完成的事情被他完成了。

sentences.english: It is easy to gloat when the cool jock with the hot girlfriend wrecks his sweet car, especially if he seems kind of smug.
sentences.chinese: 当酷酷的大学运动员和热辣的女友坐他的爱车失事后，特别是这人有些自以为是，那么幸灾乐祸的想法是很自然会产生的。

name: glitch
trans: n. 小故障；失灵；短时脉冲波干扰

trans: vi. 闪光，闪亮

detailed_translations.english: to shine and look wet or oily

trans: n. 一瞥，一看

sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

detailed_translations.english: if your eyes glaze over, they show no expression, usually because you are very bored or tired
to cover plates, cups etc made of clay with a thin liquid that gives them a shiny surface
a liquid that is used to cover plates, cups etc made of clay to give them a shiny surface

sentences.chinese: 于是他们又送我一只…长颈鹿。

sentences.chinese: 镀金框

trans: adj. 巨大的，庞大的

sentences.chinese: 奇点的地缘政治学和社会经济学基础是什么？

trans: adj. 真实的，真正的；诚恳的

detailed_translations.chinese: 烹饪法，美食法；享乐主义

sentences.chinese: “我的腿！”他倒抽一口气喊道，“我觉得腿断了！”

when you take in a breath suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain

sentences.chinese: 他们的汽油不够了。

sentences.chinese: “咦~~~~”难闻死了，像是汽油和花香混在一起。

sentences.chinese: 她已经做好了蔬菜，正给烤肉配饰菜。

detailed_translations.english: to add something to food in order to decorate it

sentences.english: Durham had garnered three times as many votes as Carey.
sentences.chinese: 德拉姆获得的选票数是凯里的3倍。

sentences.chinese: 我看见，昨夜我为你编结的花环依然松松地垂在你的发上。

sentences.chinese: 一件朴素的黄衫，一个野花扎成的花环，就是他们所需要的全部装饰。

sentences.english: In the others a series of dramatic situations were strung on a thread of melody; this was a garland of songs with just a thread of dramatic plot running through.
sentences.chinese: 在头两个里，一系列戏剧性的场景，是串在一根歌曲的线上；而在这一个里，一花环的歌曲，只用一个戏剧情节的线头贯穿。

sentences.english: an automatic garage door
sentences.chinese: 车库自动门

name: gangster

sentences.chinese: …一部黑帮片。

detailed_translations.english: to shock or surprise someone so that they do something to solve a problem, improve a situation etc

name: gallbladder

name: gale

sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风

detailed_translations.english: A gadget is a small machine or device which does something useful. You sometimes refer to something as a gadget when you are suggesting that it is complicated and unnecessary.

name: gadfly

name: fuzzy

sentences.english: Some of the photos were so fuzzy it was hard to tell who was who.
sentences.chinese: 有些照片模糊不清，看不出谁是谁。

sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子挑食。

sentences.english: ‘Do you want to go out or just rent a movie?’ ‘I’m not fussy’ (= I don’t mind ) .

sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯说他最好回来，否则就会有人小题大做了。

name: fang
trans: n. 尖牙

sentences.english: The cobra sank its venomous fangs into his hand.
sentences.chinese: 眼镜蛇将毒牙咬进他的手。

detailed_translations.english: a long sharp tooth of an animal such as a snake or wild dog

name: fancy
trans: n. 想像力；爱好；幻想
adj. 想象的；奇特的；精选的；昂贵的

sentences.english: Harry took me to a fancy restaurant for our anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 哈里带我去了一家豪华餐厅，庆祝我们的结婚纪念日。

detailed_translations.english: fancy hotels, restaurants, cars etc are expensive and fashionable
an idea or opinion that is not based on fact
to like or want something, or want to do something

name: fanciful
trans: adj. 想像的；稀奇的

sentences.english: a fanciful story
sentences.chinese: 想象出来的故事

sentences.english: The suggestion that there was a conspiracy is not entirely fanciful.
sentences.chinese: 说有人在搞阴谋，这并不完全是臆想。

detailed_translations.english: imagined rather than based on facts – often used to show disapproval

name: falter
trans: vi. 蹒跚地走；支吾
vt. 支吾地说；结巴地讲出

sentences.english: Laurie’s voice faltered as she tried to thank him.
sentences.chinese: 劳丽想谢谢他，却说得结结巴巴的。

sentences.english: ‘I can’t,’ she faltered.
sentences.chinese: “我做不到。”她支支吾吾地说道。

detailed_translations.english: to speak in a voice that sounds weak and uncertain, and keeps stopping

name: falsify
trans: vt. 伪造；歪曲；篡改；证明...虚假
vi. 撒谎

sentences.english: The file was altered to falsify the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 文件被动了手脚，以此伪造证据。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伪造；篡改；歪曲；证明虚假
detailed_translations.english: to change figures, records etc so that they contain false information

name: fairy
trans: n. 仙女，小精灵；[美俚]漂亮姑娘
adj. 仙女的

sentences.english: In his dream, he became a fairy.
sentences.chinese: 在梦中，他变成了一个小精灵。

detailed_translations.english: a small imaginary creature with magic powers, which looks like a very small person

name: faint
trans: adj. 头晕的；虚弱的；模糊的；衰弱的
vi. 昏倒；变得微弱；变得没气力

sentences.english: She gave a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

sentences.english: a very faint noise
sentences.chinese: 很微弱的声响

sentences.english: the faint light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 微弱的晨光

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；头晕的；虚弱的；[医] 衰弱的
detailed_translations.english: difficult to see, hear, smell etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 昏倒；变得微弱；变得没气力
detailed_translations.english: to suddenly become unconscious for a short time
an act of becoming unconscious

name: Fahrenheit
trans: n. 华氏温标；华氏温度计
adj. 华氏的

sentences.english: By mid-morning, the temperature was already above 100 degrees Fahrenheit.
sentences.chinese: 到上午10点左右，气温已超过华氏100度了。

detailed_translations.english: Fahrenheit is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 32 degrees and boils at 212 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °F.
a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 32˚ and boils at 212˚

name: faculty
trans: n. 能力；全体教员；科，系

sentences.english: Both faculty and students oppose the measures.
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生都反对这些措施。

detailed_translations.english: all the teachers in a university

name: facility
trans: n. 设备；灵巧；容易；设施

sentences.english: What recreational facilities are now available?
sentences.chinese: 什么娱乐设施现在是可用的？

detailed_translations.english: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

name: facial
trans: adj. 面部的，表面的；脸的，面部用的
n. 美容，美颜；脸部按摩

sentences.english: Victor’s facial expression didn’t change.
sentences.chinese: 维克托脸上的表情没有变化。

sentences.english: facial hair
sentences.chinese: 脸部的汗毛

detailed_translations.chinese: 面部的，表面的；脸的，面部用的
detailed_translations.english: on your face or relating to your face
if you have a facial, you have a beauty treatment in which your face is cleaned and creams are rubbed into it

name: facetious
trans: adj. （常为不当地）引人发笑的；诙谐的

sentences.english: Don’t be so facetious!
sentences.chinese: 别这么乱开玩笑！

sentences.english: facetious comments
sentences.chinese: 不当的戏谑评论

detailed_translations.chinese: 诙谐的；爱开玩笑的；滑稽的；(尤指在不合适的时候)开玩笑的
detailed_translations.english: saying things that are intended to be clever and funny but are really silly and annoying

name: facade
trans: n. 正面；表面；外观

sentences.english: an impressive building with a red brick facade
sentences.chinese: 正面为红砖的雄伟建筑

detailed_translations.english: the front of a building, especially a large and important one

name: fabulous
trans: adj. 难以置信的；传说的，寓言中的；极好的

sentences.english: the Duke’s fabulous wealth
sentences.chinese: 那位公爵的巨额财富

sentences.english: You look fabulous!
sentences.chinese: 你看上去美极了！

sentences.english: a fabulous meal
sentences.chinese: 丰盛的一餐

sentences.english: The room has fabulous views across the lake.
sentences.chinese: 那个房间可以看到美丽的湖景。

detailed_translations.english: very large in amount or size

name: fabricate
trans: vt. 编造, 捏造, 虚构; 伪造 建造

sentences.english: The police were accused of fabricating evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方被控捏造证据。

sentences.english: The discs are expensive to fabricate.
sentences.chinese: 这些磁盘的生产成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: to invent a story, piece of information etc in order to deceive someone

name: fabric
trans: n. 织物；构造；建筑物；组织；布

sentences.english: our new range of fabrics and wallpapers
sentences.chinese: 我们新的织物和墙纸系列

sentences.english: The country’s social fabric is disintegrating.
sentences.chinese: 该国的社会结构正在瓦解。

detailed_translations.english: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

name: fable
trans: n. 寓言；无稽之谈
vi. 编寓言；虚构

sentences.english: the fable of the fox and the crow
sentences.chinese: 狐狸和乌鸦的寓言故事

detailed_translations.english: a traditional short story that teaches a moral lesson, especially a story about animals

name: eyelash
trans: n. 睫毛

sentences.english: Then we found a study that showed there was a material that seemed to have stimulated eyelash growth.
sentences.chinese: 随后我们找到了一项研究，研究表明的确有一种物质可以刺激睫毛增长。

sentences.english: Longtime readers of the Beauty Brains are familiar with all that we have written about eyelash growth products.
sentences.chinese: 美丽头脑的老读者都已经非常熟悉我们所写的，有关于睫毛增长产品的文章了。

detailed_translations.english: one of the small hairs that grow along the edge of your eyelids

name: extrusion
trans: n. 挤出,推出,喷出,赶出

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤出， 推出， 挤压
detailed_translations.english: Extrusion is the act or process of extruding something

name: extremism
trans: n. 极端主义；过激论

sentences.english: Greater demands were being placed on the police by growing violence and left and right-wing extremism.
sentences.chinese: 不断增加的暴行和左翼右翼极端主义使得需要更多警力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极端主义（尤指政治上的极右或极左）；极端性；过激主义
detailed_translations.english: opinions, ideas, and actions, especially political or religious ones, that most people think are unreasonable and unacceptable

name: extravagant
trans: adj. 奢侈的, 铺张的 过度的, 过分的, 放肆的

sentences.english: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.chinese: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.english: an extravagant lifestyle
sentences.chinese: 奢侈的生活方式

sentences.english: an extravagant display of loyalty
sentences.chinese: 过分表露忠诚

sentences.english: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
sentences.chinese: 不要酗酒。

detailed_translations.english: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

name: extrapolate
trans: vt. (由已知资料对未知事实或价值)推算,推断

sentences.english: Extrapolating from his latest findings, he reckons about 80% of these deaths might be attributed to smoking.
sentences.chinese: 从他最近的发现推断，他估计大约80%的这类死亡可能归因于吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to use facts about the present or about one thing or group to make a guess about the future or about other things or groups

name: extraordinary
trans: adj. 非常奇怪的 非同寻常的, 特别的 额外安排的, 临时的

sentences.english: It took an extraordinary amount of work.
sentences.chinese: 这费了相当多的功夫。

sentences.english: It’s extraordinary that he should make exactly the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 真想不到他又犯了完全相同的错误。

sentences.english: The U.S. has called for an extraordinary emergency meeting of the UN Human Rights Commission to examine the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国已要求召开一次联合国人权委员特别紧急会议来调查这次危机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非同寻常的；特别的（会议）
detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

name: extraordinarily
trans: adv. 非常(格外)

sentences.english: We were extraordinarily lucky.
sentences.chinese: 我们极其幸运。

detailed_translations.english: extremely

name: extraneous
trans: adj. 外部的,外来的 无关的,不相干的,无联系的

sentences.english: extraneous noises
sentences.chinese: 外面传来的噪声

detailed_translations.chinese: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的
detailed_translations.english: coming from outside

name: extradite
trans: v. 引渡回国；拿获归案

sentences.english: A judge agreed to extradite him to Texas.
sentences.chinese: 一位法官同意将他引渡到德克萨斯州。

detailed_translations.english: to use a legal process to send someone who may be guilty of a crime back to the country where the crime happened in order to judge them in a court of law

name: extortion
trans: n. 敲诈,勒索,逼取;被勒索的财物
n. 敲诈者,勒索者,逼取者

sentences.english: He has been charged with extortion and abusing his powers.
sentences.chinese: 他被控犯有敲诈勒索罪和滥用职权罪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 勒索；敲诈；强夺；被勒索的财物
detailed_translations.english: Extortion is the crime of obtaining something from someone, especially money, by using force or threats

name: extort
trans: vt. 敲诈；侵占；强求；牵强地引出

sentences.english: Corrupt government officials were extorting money from him.
sentences.chinese: 腐败的政府官员那时正向他勒索钱财。

detailed_translations.english: to illegally force someone to give you something, especially money, by threatening them

name: extent
trans: n. 范围；程度；长度

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

name: extemporize
trans: vt. 即兴创作,即席演奏

sentences.english: He completely departed from the text and extemporized in a very energetic fashion.
sentences.chinese: 他完全脱了稿并以一种精力非常充沛的样子即席演说。

detailed_translations.english: to speak or perform without preparation or practice

name: exquisite
trans: adj. 精致的, 精美的 敏感的, 细致的

sentences.english: the most exquisite craftsmanship
sentences.chinese: 最精美的工艺

detailed_translations.chinese: 精致的；细腻的；优美的，高雅的；异常的；剧烈的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful and very delicately made

name: exponent
trans: n.（观点、理论的）拥护者，鼓吹者，倡导者；（某种活动的）能手，大师；【数】指数；幂

sentences.english: The fatigue life increases with decreasing modulus of surface layer in a power function with a negative exponent.
sentences.chinese: 沥青面层的疲劳寿命随着面层材料模量的降低以负指数的幂函数形式增加；

sentences.english: In addition, this paper also suggests that the reason for high burning rate-pressure exponent is deflagration of some components in propellant.
sentences.chinese: 此外，本文还提出，火药中某些组分的爆燃是导致一些火药燃速压力指数较高的原因。

sentences.english: Examining the influence of the sports factors on the step exponent of colleges students with the experiment method, questionnaire survey method and Mathematical Statistics method.
sentences.chinese: 采用实验法、问卷调查法和数理统计法，观察运动因素对大学生台阶指数的影响。

detailed_translations.english: a sign written above and to the right of a number or letter to show how many times that quantity is to be multiplied by itself

name: explicit
trans: adj. 清楚的；明确的；直率的；详述的

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: expired
trans: adj. 失效的；过期的
v. 期满（expire的过去分词）

name: expire
trans: vi. 终止；期满；死亡；呼气
vt. 呼出（空气）

sentences.english: My passport expires next week.
sentences.chinese: 我的护照下周就到期了。

sentences.english: Ophelia expires in Act IV of Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 奥菲莉娅在《哈姆雷特》第四幕中死去。

detailed_translations.english: (of a document, an agreement, etc.) to be no longer valid because the period of time for which it could be used has ended

name: expiate
trans: vt. 赎罪；补偿
vi. 赎罪；补偿

sentences.english: It seemed that Alice was expiating her father's sins with her charity work.
sentences.chinese: 看来爱丽丝要用自己的善行来赎她父亲的罪恶。

detailed_translations.english: If you expiate guilty feelings or bad behaviour, you do something to indicate that you are sorry for what you have done

name: expertise
trans: n. 专门知识或技能

sentences.english: She was not an accountant and didn't have the expertise to verify all of the financial details.
sentences.chinese: 她不是会计，不具有核查所有这些财政细目的专业知识。

detailed_translations.english: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice

name: expenses
trans: n. 开支；费用（expense的复数形式）
v. 向…收取费用；被花掉（expense的第三人称单数形式）

name: expenditure
trans: n. 花费, 使用 (尤指金钱的)支出额

sentences.english: huge cuts in public expenditure
sentences.chinese: 大幅度削减公共开支

sentences.english: government expenditure on education
sentences.chinese: 政府的教育开支

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["spending by a company on buildings, machinery, equipment etc"],"COLLOINEXA":["capital expenditure"]}
sentences.chinese: 〔公司的〕资本开支

detailed_translations.chinese: 经费， 支出额； 花费， 支出， 消耗
detailed_translations.english: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

name: expel
trans: vt. 驱逐；开除

sentences.english: Two girls were expelled from school for taking drugs.
sentences.chinese: 两名女生因吸毒而被学校开除。

sentences.english: Foreign priests were expelled from the country.
sentences.chinese: 外国牧师被驱逐出境。

sentences.english: As the lungs exhale this waste, gas is expelled into the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 当肺呼出这股废气，气体就被排到空气中。

detailed_translations.english: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization

name: expat
trans: v. 逐出国外,脱离国籍,放逐;移居国外
n. 亡命国外者

name: exotic
trans: adj. 外来的；异国的；异国情调的

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

name: exert
trans: vt. 运用，发挥；施以影响

sentences.english: They exerted considerable influence within the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: Environmental groups are exerting pressure on the government to tighten pollution laws.
sentences.chinese: 环境保护组织在向政府施加压力，要求从严执行环保法律法规。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

name: exemption
trans: n. 免除(税)

name: exempt
trans: vt. 免除；豁免
adj. 被免除的；被豁免的

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: exemplary
trans: adj. 杰出的;值得效仿的
adv. 杰出地;值得效仿地 n. 杰出,模范

sentences.english: a company with an exemplary record on environmental issues
sentences.chinese: 在处理环境问题方面可作为楷模的公司

detailed_translations.chinese: 可作楷模的， 典范的
detailed_translations.english: excellent and providing a good example for people to follow

name: exclude
trans: vt. 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出

sentences.english: a special diet that excludes dairy products
sentences.chinese: 不包含奶制品的特别食谱

sentences.english: The judges decided to exclude evidence which had been unfairly attained.
sentences.chinese: 法官裁决不接纳以不正当手段获取的证据。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately not include something

name: exclaim
trans: vi. 呼喊，惊叫；大声叫嚷
vt. 大声说出

sentences.english: ‘No!’ she exclaimed in shock.
sentences.chinese: “不！”她惊呼道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

name: excitation
trans: n. 刺激；激动；激发

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of exciting or state of being excited

name: excessive
trans: adj. 过度的, 过分的; 极度的

sentences.english: his excessive drinking
sentences.chinese: 他的酗酒

sentences.english: $15 for two beers seems a little excessive.
sentences.chinese: 两杯啤酒要15美元，似乎有点过分。

detailed_translations.english: much more than is reasonable or necessary

name: excess
trans: n. 超过；过量；过剩
adj. 过量的；额外的

sentences.english: The government was unable to curb the excesses of the secret police.
sentences.chinese: 政府无法约束秘密警察的过分行为。

sentences.english: the worst excesses of journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作中那些最糟糕的越轨行为

detailed_translations.english: harmful actions that are socially or morally unacceptable

name: exceptional
trans: adj. 优越的, 杰出的 例外的; 独特的, 异常的

sentences.english: an exceptional student
sentences.chinese: 出类拔萃的学生

sentences.english: A review panel concluded that there were no exceptional circumstances that would warrant a lesser penalty for him.
sentences.chinese: 一个评估小组作出结论：没有什么例外情况可使他获得从轻惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: unusually good

name: excel
trans: vt. 优于，胜过；擅长
vi. 胜过他人；优秀

sentences.english: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

detailed_translations.english: to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people

name: excavator
trans: n. 打洞机；挖掘者；开凿者

name: exaggerate
trans: vt. & vi. (使)扩大, (使)增加 夸大, 夸张

sentences.english: I couldn’t sleep for three days – I’m not exaggerating.
sentences.chinese: 我三天没睡觉了——一点不夸张。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

name: ex
trans: prep. 不包括，除外
n. 前妻或前夫

name: evoke
trans: vt. 引起，唤起；博得

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取出内脏, 除去精华

an evergreen tree or bush does not lose its leaves in winter

name: evenly
trans: adv. 平衡地；平坦地；平等地

sentences.english: The profits will be split evenly between the three of us.
sentences.chinese: 利润将由我们三人平分。

sentences.english: ‘I warned you not to phone me, ’ he said evenly.
sentences.chinese: “我告诫过你不要给我打电话。”他平静地说。

detailed_translations.english: divided in an equal way

name: evasive
trans: adj. 逃避的；托辞的；推托的

sentences.english: an evasive reply

detailed_translations.english: not willing to answer questions directly

trans: n. 逃避；回避；借口

sentences.english: I’m tired of his lies and evasions.
sentences.chinese: 我听腻了他的谎言和托词。

detailed_translations.english: when you deliberately avoid talking about something or answering a question

trans: v. 蒸发；失去水分；消失

sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

trans: vt. 逃避；规避；逃脱

sentences.english: You can’t go on evading your responsibilities in this way.
sentences.chinese: 你不能这样继续逃避责任。

sentences.english: You’re simply trying to evade the problem.
sentences.chinese: 你根本是在设法逃避问题。

detailed_translations.english: to not do or deal with something that you should do

trans: n. 撤空;撤离;撤退;疏散 排泄;排泄物

sentences.chinese: 我下令撤离所有的美国人，并派部队去保证他们的安全。

sentences.english: The impact of evacuation and relocation on those with health or functional impairments can be tremendous .
sentences.chinese: 撤离和重新安置对这些健康状况欠佳或身体残疾的人影响极大。

sentences.english: However, it is not only harmful to escape, but also beneficial for smoke to spread quickly to other floors if the smoke moves into the vertical escape evacuation routes while it is on fire.
sentences.chinese: 但是火灾发生后，作为人员逃生的竖向疏散通道如果遭受烟气侵害，不仅对人员的逃生不利，而且会加快烟气向其他楼层的蔓延。

name: euphemism

sentences.english: ‘Pass away’ is a euphemism for ‘die’.
sentences.chinese: “去世”是“死”的委婉语。

detailed_translations.english: a polite word or expression that you use instead of a more direct one to avoid shocking or upsetting someone

name: eunuch
trans: n. 太监；阉人

name: eugenic
trans: adj. 优种的；优生学的

sentences.english: Force In order to eugenic and superior nurture, schumann formulated a series of family planning, hope the best with integrity.
sentences.chinese: 为了优生优育，舒曼制定了一系列的最佳生育计划，希望正直配合。

sentences.english: To regard reducing the achromatopsia and counting the proportion as the goal, it designs two kinds of eugenic schemes, and finds out its eugenic law.
sentences.chinese: 根据遗传规律得到遗传平衡方程，以减少色盲数比例为目标，设计出两种优生方案，并找出其优生规律。

sentences.chinese: 从语源学上讲，人类学是研究人的科学。

sentences.english: So the real etymology is that it appeared, evidently as slang, in around 1700.
sentences.chinese: 真正的词源似乎是这样的：它作为俚语出现在1700年左右。

sentences.english: Some of it is about etymology, about the nature of words and their casual links with the elements around us.
sentences.chinese: 有一些故事是关于语源学的，关于语言的本质以及那些词语与我们周围的元素的偶然联系。

trans: n. 种族划分；属于少数民族

trans: adj. 种族的；人种的

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的

trans: n. [化]乙醇，酒精

sentences.english: But the significance of the quarrel goes well beyond ethanol.
sentences.chinese: 但是这场争论的意义远远不止于乙醇问题。

sentences.english: No cars in Brazil run on pure gasoline anymore. The government requires that all vehicles run on blended fuel of about one-quarter ethanol.
sentences.chinese: 如今巴西不再使用单纯靠汽油驱动的汽车，政府要求所有机动车均采用含四分之一乙醇的混合燃料。

sentences.english: This includes construction of 15 ethanol plants with assistance from Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 这包括在巴西的帮助下建设15个乙醇生产厂。

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化] 乙醇，[有化] 酒精

sentences.chinese: 激光器用于在光盘的光滑表面刻录图案。

sentences.chinese: 乡村的庄园

trans: n. 食道

sentences.chinese: 不要试图强迫狗狗呕吐，因为这样会烧坏食管和胃，并更进一步引起并发症。

sentences.english: You will be laid on your side or back in a comfortable position as the endoscope is gently passed through your mouth and into your esophagus, stomach and duodenum.
sentences.chinese: 当你找到一个舒服的正卧或侧卧姿势躺好后，医务人员会从你的口轻轻放入内视镜。 内视镜通过口、食管，到达胃和十二指肠。

sentences.english: Heartburn also know as acid reflux is caused by progesterone relaxing the valve separating the esophagus from the stomach allowing acids to seep up the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 胃灼热，同时也被叫做胃酸倒流，这是因为黄体酮使瓣膜松弛把食道和胃分开了，这会让胃酸渗到食管里。

detailed_translations.chinese: [解剖] 食管；[解剖] 食道

sentences.chinese: 为人递上一杯饮料或咖啡，做一些零星杂务，为别人提供一份差使等等使人感激的事情。 真的。

sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

name: ergo

sentences.chinese: …为保护树篱的临时栅栏的搭建。

sentences.chinese: 计算机瘫痪了，我们所有的记录都被删除了。

name: equestrian

sentences.chinese: 马术运动

detailed_translations.english: relating to horse-riding

name: equation
trans: n. 方程式，等式；相等；反应式

sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

sentences.chinese: 他得到消息时显得异常镇静。

detailed_translations.english: calmness in the way that you react to things, which means that you do not become upset or annoyed

sentences.english: The king’s death marked the end of an epoch.
sentences.chinese: 这位国王的去世标志着一个时代的结束。

sentences.english: the beginning of a new epoch
sentences.chinese: 新纪元的开始

sentences.chinese: 史诗

sentences.chinese: 从本质上说，时尚不过是一时的潮流。

name: enzyme
trans: n. 酶

sentences.english: It is believed that it inhibits an enzyme that promotes cell proliferation in tumours.
sentences.chinese: 据信它能抑制一种能在肿瘤中促进细胞增殖的酶的生成。

sentences.english: This enzyme accumulates in the larvae to a level where it becomes toxic and kills them.
sentences.chinese: 这种酶在幼虫体内积累到一定浓度，就会变得有毒并杀死它们。

sentences.english: Apparently, though, CYP2E1 affects how sensitive the brain is to alcohol, perhaps because it —unlike the enzyme in the liver —generates free radicals, tiny molecules that can damage cells.
sentences.chinese: 虽然表面上是这样，CYP2E1却影响着大脑对酒精的敏感度，或许因为它—不像在肝脏中的酶—产生了自由基，能损害细胞的微小分子。

name: envy

vt. 羡慕；嫉妒，妒忌

sentences.english: I really envy you and Ian, you seem so happy together.
sentences.chinese: 我真是羡慕你和伊恩，你俩在一起看起来多幸福。

sentences.english: She has a lifestyle which most people would envy.
sentences.chinese: 她的生活方式会令大多数人感到羡慕。

sentences.english: She could see that all the other girls were green with envy(= feeling a lot of envy ).
sentences.chinese: 她看得出其他女孩都很眼红。

the feeling of wanting something that someone else has

name: enumerate

sentences.chinese: 我将必须要做的工作一一列举出来。

detailed_translations.english: to name a list of things one by one

sentences.chinese: 思想作为一个独立的实体存在。

sentences.english: Good design brings a house and garden together as a single entity.
sentences.chinese: 优秀的设计能把一所房子和花园合为一体。

sentences.chinese: 他们开始工作时就丧失了享受福利的权利。

name: enthral

sentences.english: The passengers were enthralled by the scenery.

n. 限定继承，限定继承权；限定继承的财产

sentences.english: A new computer system entails a lot of re-training.
sentences.chinese: 使用新的计算机系统需要大量的再培训。

sentences.english: Some foreign travel is entailed in the job.
sentences.chinese: 做这份工作有时要到国外出差。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使需要，必需；承担；遗传给；蕴含

name: ensconce
trans: vt. 安置；安顿下来；使…隐藏

sentences.english: ensconced in a chair

sentences.english: The place at once enraptured me.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方立刻把我迷住了。

sentences.english: The 20,000-strong audience listened, enraptured.
sentences.chinese: 两万多名观众听得入了迷。

sentences.english: ...an enraptured audience.
sentences.chinese: ...一场观众如痴如醉。

detailed_translations.english: If something or someone enraptures you, you think they are wonderful or fascinating

name: enrage
trans: vt. 激怒；使暴怒

sentences.english: Many readers were enraged by his article.
sentences.chinese: 许多读者被他的文章激怒了。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone very angry

name: enlist
trans: vt. 征募；使入伍；获得...支持
vi. 入伍；参与

name: enhancement
trans: n. 提高，增加，增强

sentences.english: Progressive enhancement helps us to do that because it forces us to focus on the content and build out from there.
sentences.chinese: 渐进增强能够帮助我们做到这一点，因为它让我们关注内容并且从内容开始构建。

name: engulf
trans: vt. 吞没；吞食，狼吞虎咽

sentences.english: despair so great it threatened to engulf him
sentences.chinese: 几乎要将他压垮的绝望情绪

detailed_translations.english: if an unpleasant feeling engulfs you, you feel it very strongly

name: engrave
trans: vt. 雕刻；铭记

sentences.english: Your wedding ring can be engraved with a personal inscription at no extra cost.
sentences.chinese: 你的结婚戒指可以刻上个人题字不另收费。

sentences.english: The shop will also engrave your child's name on the side.
sentences.chinese: 商店也将在一侧刻上你孩子的名字。

sentences.english: ...a bottle engraved with her name.
sentences.chinese: …一个刻有她名字的瓶子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雕刻；  铭记， 深印于 ， 铭刻
detailed_translations.english: If you engrave something with a design or words, or if you engrave a design or words on it, you cut the design or words into its surface

name: engage
trans: vt. 雇佣；吸引，占用；使订婚；使参加；预定
vi. 答应，保证；从事；交战；啮合

sentences.english: She engaged the clutch and the car moved.
sentences.chinese: 她踩下离合器，汽车便开动了。

sentences.english: The wheel engages with the cog and turns it.
sentences.chinese: 轮子咬住轮齿并带动它转动。

detailed_translations.english: if you engage part of a machine, or if it engages, it moves so that it fits into another part of the machine

name: energise
trans: vt.  供给 ... 能量； 使精力充沛
vi.  释放出能量

name: endorsement
trans: n. 背书,批注;违章记录 赞同,支持

sentences.english: There should be no suggestion of endorsement of the product or the company by WHO.
sentences.chinese: 世卫组织不得对任何产品或公司提供支持建议。

name: endian
trans: n. [计算机]字节序

name: endeavour
trans: n. 〈英〉尽力,竭力

sentences.english: But I will endeavour to banish every painful thought, and think only of what will make me happy: your affection, and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt.
sentences.chinese: 可是我一定会竭力打消一切苦痛的念头，只去想一些能使我高兴的事───譬如想想你的亲切以及亲爱的舅父母对我始终如一的关切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）
detailed_translations.english: to try very hard

name: endeavor
trans: n. 努力；尽力（等于endeavour）
vi. 努力；尽力（等于endeavour）

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

name: encrypt
trans: v. 把…编码；把…加密

name: encouraging
trans: adj. 鼓励的;赞助的;促进的

name: encounter
trans: vt. 遇到, 遭遇 偶然碰到, 邂逅
n. 突然遇到

sentences.english: The doctor had encountered several similar cases in the past.
sentences.chinese: 那位医生过去曾碰到过好几个类似病例。

detailed_translations.english: to experience something, especially problems or opposition
an occasion when you meet someone, or do something with someone you do not know

name: encompass
trans: vt. 围绕；包围；包括；完成

sentences.english: The study encompasses the social, political, and economic aspects of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究涵盖了这一局势的社会、政治和经济三方面。

detailed_translations.english: to include a wide range of ideas, subjects, etc

name: enclosure
trans: n. 圈占, 围绕 圈占地, 圈用地 附件, 装入物

sentences.english: the bear enclosure at the zoo
sentences.chinese: 动物园中的熊园

sentences.english: the enclosure of arable land for pasture
sentences.chinese: 将耕地圈起来用作牧场

detailed_translations.english: an area surrounded by a wall or fence, and used for a particular purpose

name: encircle
trans: vt. 环绕；围绕；包围

sentences.english: The island was encircled by a dusty road.
sentences.chinese: 那座岛屿为一条尘土飞扬的公路所环绕。

detailed_translations.english: to surround someone or something completely

name: encampment
trans: n. 露营,宿营,营地

sentences.english: a military encampment
sentences.chinese: 军营

detailed_translations.english: a large temporary camp, especially of soldiers

name: enamel
trans: n. 珐琅；瓷釉；搪瓷；指甲油
vt. 涂以瓷釉；彩饰

sentences.english: ...a white enamel saucepan.
sentences.chinese: …一个白色搪瓷煮锅。

detailed_translations.english: a hard shiny substance that is put onto metal, clay etc for decoration or protection

name: emulator
trans: n. 竞争者；仿真器，模拟器

name: employability
trans: n. 可用性；适于雇用；受雇就业能力

name: empirical
trans: adj. 以观察或实验为依据的

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: emphatic
trans: adj. 加强语气的；着重的；显著的

sentences.english: an emphatic denial
sentences.chinese: 断然否认

detailed_translations.english: expressing an opinion, idea etc in a clear, strong way to show its importance

name: emergent
trans: adj. 紧急的；浮现的；新兴的；处于发展初期的

sentences.english: Discovering these patterns is the key to emergent design.
sentences.chinese: 发现这些模式是紧急设计的关键。

sentences.english: The real trick in emergent design is discovering these patterns.
sentences.chinese: 紧急设计的真正诀窍就是发现这些模式。

name: emerald
trans: n. 绿宝石，翡翠；祖母绿；翠绿色
adj. 翠绿色的；翡翠的

sentences.english: As far as colors go, this year we will be seeing some brights like orange, yellow, fuchsia, apple green, emerald, and amethyst.
sentences.chinese: 至于颜色的流行趋势，今年我们将会看到一些明亮的颜色如橘色、黄色、桃红色、苹果绿、翠绿色和紫色。

sentences.english: In terms of colour, black, red and jewel tones like sapphire blue and emerald GREen are in, while pumpkins and yellows are out, Ms Stanger said.
sentences.chinese: 至于衣服的颜色，斯坦格说，黑色、红色以及宝蓝、祖母绿这样的宝石色调比较时髦，而南瓜色和黄色则显得老土。

detailed_translations.english: a valuable bright green stone that is often used in jewellery

name: embryo
trans: n. [动]胚胎；[植]胚芽；初期
adj. 初期的；胚胎的

sentences.english: The system already exists in embryo.
sentences.chinese: 该体系已具雏形。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or human that has not yet been born, and has just begun to develop

name: embezzle
trans: vt. 盗用；挪用；贪污

sentences.english: Two managers were charged with embezzling $400,000.
sentences.chinese: 两名经理被控挪用了40万美元。

detailed_translations.english: to steal money from the place where you work

name: ember
trans: n. 灰烬，余烬

sentences.english: glowing embers
sentences.chinese: 发光的余烬

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wood or coal that stays red and very hot after a fire has stopped burning

name: embed
trans: v. (使)插入；(使)嵌入；深留脑中

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

name: embark
trans: vi. 上船或飞机；从事，着手
vt. 使上船；使从事

sentences.english: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 他正开始一个当作家的新生涯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上船； 着手， 开始工作
detailed_translations.english: to go onto a ship or a plane, or to put or take something onto a ship or plane

name: embankment
trans: n. (道路的)路堤;(河流的)岸堤

sentences.english: They climbed a steep embankment.
sentences.chinese: 他们爬上了一个陡峭的堤岸。

detailed_translations.english: a wide wall of earth or stones built to stop water from flooding an area, or to support a road or railway

name: elusive
trans: adj. 难以捉摸的;难以找到的;不易记住的

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: ellipse
trans: n. [数]椭圆形，椭圆

sentences.english: The Earth orbits in an ellipse.
sentences.chinese: 地球沿椭圆形轨道运动。

detailed_translations.english: a curved shape like a circle, but with two slightly longer and flatter sides

name: elk
trans: n. [动]麋鹿；软鞣粗皮；驼鹿皮革

sentences.english: I covered the elk with a tarp and sat down near it, wrapping myself in blankets.
sentences.chinese: 我用一块防水布盖住了麋鹿，然后用毯子把自己裹起来，坐在它旁边。

sentences.english: When the elk got up, the tarp slid off.
sentences.chinese: 麋鹿站起来的时候，防水布从它身上滑落。

detailed_translations.english: a very large brown North American, European, and Asian animal with wide flat horns

name: elite
trans: n.（社会）上层集团；掌权人物；出类拔萃的人，精英
adj. （社会）上层集团的；掌权人物的；精英的

sentences.english: a struggle for power within the ruling elite
sentences.chinese: 统治阶层内部的争权夺利

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

name: elicit
trans: vt. 引出, 探出

sentences.english: My letters to her have elicited no response.
sentences.chinese: 我写给她的信没有得到回应。

detailed_translations.english: If you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions

name: elevation
trans: n. 提升；海拔；高度；提高；立视图

sentences.english: The city is at an elevation of 2 000 metres.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市海拔2000米。

detailed_translations.english: the height of a place, especially its height above sea level

name: elevated
trans: adj. 提高的；高尚的；严肃的；欢欣的
v. 抬起；提高；振奋；提拔（elevate的过去分词）

sentences.english: elevated philosophical language
sentences.chinese: 充满智慧的哲学语言

detailed_translations.chinese: 提高的；高尚的；严肃的；欢欣的
detailed_translations.english: elevated thoughts, words etc seem to be intelligent or of high moral standard

detailed_translations.chinese: 提高；抬起；振奋；提拔（elevate的过去分词）

name: electrostatic
trans: adj. 静电的；静电学的

sentences.english: When a head dissociates, one charge remains stuck at the interface, and the other, attracted to the surface by electrostatic forces, wanders only a short distance away.
sentences.chinese: 当一个头电离之后，一个电荷保留在表面上，而另一个电荷则由于静电力的吸引而在很短的一段距离外游动。

sentences.english: Another BI system, recently deployed with promising results, features an electrostatic pad that presses against the offender’s upper arm at all times, chemically “tasting” sweat for signs of alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 最近另外一种BI公司发明的系统也获得了良好的成效。 这种静电发射的装置通过按压违法者的上臂来 “品尝”他体内的酒精含量。

detailed_translations.english: of, concerned with, producing, or caused by static electricity

name: electron
trans: n. 电子

sentences.english: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleus of an atom

name: electrode
trans: n. 电极

sentences.english: The monkeys have electrodes implanted into the brain to measure their brain activity.
sentences.chinese: 这些猴子的脑中植入了电极，以监测其大脑活动。

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of metal or a wire that is used to send electricity through a system or through a person’s body

name: electrify
trans: vt. 使电气化 使兴奋

sentences.english: She would sit at the piano and sing, electrifying us all.
sentences.chinese: 她会边弹钢琴边唱歌，使我们大家兴奋不已。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使电气化；使充电；使触电；使激动
detailed_translations.english: if a performance or a speech electrifies people, it makes them feel very interested or excited

name: electric
trans: adj. 电的；导电的；电动的；发电的；令人震惊的
n. [美口]电气车辆；电；带电体

sentences.english: an electric blanket
sentences.chinese: 电热毯

detailed_translations.english: needing electricity to work, produced by electricity, or used for carrying electricity

name: electoral
trans: adj. 选举的;选举人的

name: elastic
trans: adj. 有弹性的；易伸缩的；灵活的
n. 松紧带；橡皮圈

sentences.english: a piece of elastic
sentences.chinese: 一根橡皮带

sentences.english: the horny elastic pad in a horse’s hoof
sentences.chinese: 马蹄上粗硬而有弹性的肉掌

detailed_translations.english: a type of rubber material that can stretch and then return to its usual length or size
a material that is elastic can stretch and then go back to its usual length or size

name: elapse
trans: vi. 时间过去；消逝
n. 时间的过去；流逝

sentences.english: Several months elapsed before his case was brought to trial.
sentences.chinese: 过了几个月他的案子才开审。

sentences.english: The assignment must be completed within an overall elapsed time of one week.
sentences.chinese: 这项任务总的时限为一周，必须按时完成。

detailed_translations.english: if a particular period of time elapses, it passes

name: elaborate
trans: vi. 详尽说明
vt. 详细制定
adj. 复杂的; 精心制作的

sentences.english: pure silks embroidered with elaborate patterns
sentences.chinese: 绣有精美图案的真丝衣服

sentences.english: A spokesman declined to elaborate on a statement released late yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 发言人拒绝对昨天晚些时候发表的一份声明作出更多说明。

detailed_translations.chinese: 复杂的； 精心制作的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of small parts or details put together in a complicated way
If you elaborate on something that has been said, you say more about it, or give more details

name: egress
trans: n. 外出；出口
vi. 外出

name: egotism
trans: n. 自负；自我中心

sentences.english: The improper performances rise from selfish egotism, or what he called "Me-ism", said Roberts. Such thinking leads people to break rules.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯茨表示，种种不良行为很多时候是基于一种狭隘的自我为中心的意识，他用了一个词"Me-ism"来形容，正是这种凡事都先想到"我"的思维方式，造成了人们不顾秩序，不守规章。

sentences.english: Even as late as the 19th century, the poet Samuel Coleridge, in one of his essays on Shakespeare, could describe the villain Iago as “the very alcohol of egotism.”
sentences.chinese: 就在十九世纪，诗人萨缪尔·柯勒律治 (Samuel Coleridge) 在他论述莎士比亚的一篇短文中还将反面角色伊阿古描述为“the very alcohol of egotism” (自尊自大的化身)。

detailed_translations.english: the belief that you are much better or more important than other people

name: ego
trans: n. 自我；自我意识；自负

sentences.english: That promotion really boosted her ego (= made her feel better about herself ).
sentences.chinese: 那次晋升确实增强了她的自信心。

sentences.english: I need someone to massage my bruised ego (= when you feel less confident than before ).
sentences.chinese: 我需要有人来安抚我受挫的自信心。

sentences.english: a fragile ego
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的自尊心

detailed_translations.chinese: 自我，自己，个人思考和感觉能力
detailed_translations.english: the opinion that you have about yourself

name: eggplant
trans: n. 茄子
adj. 深紫色的

sentences.english: Spinach and eggplant.
sentences.chinese: 菠菜和茄子。

sentences.english: I said, "it is eggplant, olives and tomatoes.
sentences.chinese: 我说， “这是茄子，橄榄和西红柿。

sentences.english: However, eggplant and capsicums should be stored open in the crisper as they sweat if stored in plastic bags.
sentences.chinese: 而茄子和辣椒应该敞开存放在新鲜蔬菜保存盒中，因为当它们存放在塑料袋里时会冒汗。

detailed_translations.english: a large vegetable with smooth purple skin

name: efficacious
trans: adj. (药、措施等)有效的

sentences.english: an equally efficacious method of treatment
sentences.chinese: 同样有效的治疗方法

detailed_translations.english: working in the way you intended

name: effective
trans: adj. 有效的; 生效的 事实上的, 实际的 给人印象深刻的

sentences.english: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating arthritis.
sentences.chinese: 较便宜的药品对治疗关节炎同样有效。

sentences.english: the painting’s highly effective use of colour
sentences.chinese: 绘画中得心应手的色彩运用

sentences.english: Training is often much less effective than expected.
sentences.chinese: 训练的效果往往远低于预期。

sentences.english: the most effective ways of reducing inner city congestion
sentences.chinese: 减少旧城区交通拥挤最有效的办法

detailed_translations.english: successful, and working in the way that was intended

name: eel
trans: n. 鳝鱼；鳗鱼

sentences.english: ...smoked eel.
sentences.chinese: …熏鳗。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin fish that looks like a snake and can be eaten

name: edible
trans: adj. 可食用的
n. 食物；食品

sentences.english: These berries are edible, but those are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 这些浆果可以吃，但那些有毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可以吃的， 可食用的
detailed_translations.english: something that is edible can be eaten

name: eddy
trans: n. 漩涡；涡流；逆流
vi. 旋转；起漩涡

sentences.english: The racing river caused swirling eddies.
sentences.chinese: 湍急的河水形成了许多漩涡。

detailed_translations.english: a circular movement of water, wind, dust etc
if water, wind, dust etc eddies, it moves around with a circular movement

name: ecstatic
trans: adj. 狂喜的；入迷的
n. 狂喜的人

sentences.english: an ecstatic welcome from the thousands who lined the streets
sentences.chinese: 数千人狂热的夹道欢迎

detailed_translations.english: feeling extremely happy and excited

name: ecstasy
trans: n. 狂喜；入迷
n. 摇头丸

sentences.english: ...a state of almost religious ecstasy.
sentences.chinese: …一种近乎宗教极乐的状态。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme happiness

name: eclipse
trans: n. 日或月食；丧失；没落
vt. 形成日或月食；使 ... 黯然失色

sentences.english: The economy had eclipsed the environment as an election issue.
sentences.chinese: 经济作为竞选话题已经盖过环境问题。

detailed_translations.english: to become more important, powerful, famous etc than someone or something else, so that they are no longer noticed
an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun

name: eclectic
trans: adj. 兼收并蓄的；不拘一格的；折中的，折中主义的
n. 兼收并蓄的人；折中派的人，折中主义者

sentences.english: But they are the tip of an eclectic iceberg in the country.
sentences.chinese: 其实这只不过是折衷主义在这个国家表现出来的冰山一角。

sentences.english: One of my (several) frustrations in life is the eclectic way the word “science” is used in human discourse.
sentences.chinese: 我在生活中遇到的挫折之一，是试图改变人类在使用“科学”一词时的折衷的态度。

detailed_translations.english: to become worse

name: detergent
trans: n. 洗涤剂

sentences.english: During dry place, keep within the new air circulation, avoid rain and insolate, also can use some detergent to remove odor.
sentences.chinese: 在晾置期间，要保持新居内空气的流通，避免雨淋及曝晒，还可采用一些去除气味的清洁剂。

detailed_translations.english: a liquid or powder used for washing clothes, dishes etc

name: deter
trans: vt. 制止，阻止；使打消念头

sentences.english: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

name: detention
trans: n. 拘留, 扣押 监禁

sentences.english: ...the detention without trial of government critics.
sentences.chinese: …对政府批评者未经审判而进行的关押。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being kept in prison

name: detach
trans: vt. 分离；派遣；使超然

sentences.english: Please detach and fill out the application form.
sentences.chinese: 请撕下申请表并填好。

detailed_translations.english: to remove sth from sth larger; to become separated from sth

name: destiny
trans: n. 命运，定数，天命

sentences.english: Nancy wondered whether it was her destiny to live in England and marry Melvyn.
sentences.chinese: 南希想知道她生活在英格兰又嫁给梅尔文是不是命运的安排。

sentences.english: We are masters of our own destiny.
sentences.chinese: 我们是自己命运的主人。

detailed_translations.english: the things that will happen to someone in the future, especially those that cannot be changed or controlled

name: descendant
trans: n. 后代, 后裔

sentences.english: If you must use descendant selectors, prefer child selectors, which at least only require evaluation of one additional node, not all the intermediate nodes up to an ancestor.
sentences.chinese: 如果您必须使用后代选择器，尽量使用子代选择器，这最少只需评估一个额外的节点，而非中间直至祖先的所有节点。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

name: derrick
trans: n. 起重机，转臂起重机；油井的铁架塔

detailed_translations.chinese: 起重机，[机] 转臂起重机；油井的铁架塔
detailed_translations.english: a tall machine used for lifting heavy weights, especially on ships

name: derive
trans: vt. & vi. 得到 源于

sentences.english: Mr. Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.
sentences.chinese: 英先生是那种助人为乐的快活人。

detailed_translations.english: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
to develop or come from something else

name: derivative
trans: n. 派生物；派生词；【数】导数，微商
adj. 缺乏独创性的；模仿他人的

sentences.english: the derivatives market
sentences.chinese: 金融衍生品市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 衍生物，派生物；导数
detailed_translations.english: something that has developed or been produced from something else

name: deprivation
trans: n. 剥夺；免职；匮乏；丧失

sentences.english: Sleep deprivation can result in mental disorders.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏睡眠会引起精神紊乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 剥夺；损失；免职；匮乏；贫困
detailed_translations.english: the lack of something that you need in order to be healthy, comfortable, or happy

name: depreciation
trans: n. 贬值；减价；折旧

sentences.english: the depreciation of the dollar
sentences.chinese: 美元的贬值

detailed_translations.english: a reduction in the value or price of something

name: depreciate
trans: vi. 贬值, 跌价;减价
vt. 贬低, 蔑视, 轻视

sentences.english: New cars depreciate in value quickly.
sentences.chinese: 新车掉价很快。

detailed_translations.english: to decrease in value or price

name: deprecation
trans: n. 强烈不赞成,祈免,反对

sentences.english: He merely lifted his eyebrows in placid deprecation of himself and everybody else.
sentences.chinese: 他仅仅掀掀眉毛，平心静气地表示他自己和其他人的反对。

name: deprecate
trans: vt. 不赞成, 反对

sentences.english: As a lawyer, I would deprecate any sort of legal control on gene therapy at this stage.
sentences.chinese: 作为律师，我会反对在现阶段对基因疗法进行任何形式的法律管制。

sentences.english: Though the environment doesn't have a mouth to deprecate what humans have done to her, she retaliates through action.
sentences.chinese: 尽管环境没有嘴巴来反对人类对她所做的一切，她通过行动来报复。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly disapprove of or criticize something

name: depravity
trans: n. 堕落,腐败 恶行,堕落腐化的行为

sentences.english: ...the absolute depravity that can exist in war.
sentences.chinese: ...能够存在于战争中的绝对堕落。

detailed_translations.english: Depravity is very dishonest or immoral behaviour

name: depot
trans: n. 仓库；航空站；停车场
vt. 把…存放在储藏处

sentences.english: the company’s distribution depot
sentences.chinese: 公司的发货仓库

sentences.english: a fuel storage depot
sentences.chinese: 燃料储存仓库

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are stored until they are needed

name: deposit
trans: v. 放置；(使)沉淀；存储；付(订金等)；寄存
n. 存款；定金；堆积物；矿床

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

name: deploy
trans: vt. (尤指军事行动)使展开; 施展; 部署

sentences.english: So far, however, we have said nothing about how to deploy it.
sentences.chinese: 到现在，我们还没说任何如何部署的内容。

sentences.english: You can then customize and deploy these artifacts in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 然后，您可以以常规的方式定制和部署这些工件。

sentences.english: Now that you have seen the anatomy of each component, you can deploy them.
sentences.chinese: 您已经了解了对每个组件的剖析，现在可以部署它们了。

name: depletion
trans: n. 消耗;用尽

sentences.english: The influence of light stabilizer depletion in the agricultural film processing on product quantity is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析光稳定剂在农膜生产过程中的消耗对产品质量的影响。

sentences.english: Nitrogen oxides releases directly by supersonic aircraft into the stratosphere contribute directly to the depletion of the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: 由超音速飞机直接排放到平流层中的氧化氮会直接导致臭氧的消耗。

sentences.english: This decreases the device thickness and depletion voltage and consequently reduces material quality requirements and cost of the detector material.
sentences.chinese: 这减少了设备的厚度和电压损耗，从而降低材料的质量要求和探测器的材料成本。

name: deplete
trans: vt. 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

name: depict
trans: vt. 描画；描述

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

name: dependence
trans: n. 依赖,依靠 信任,信赖 对药物(尤指毒品)之依赖;毒瘾

sentences.english: ...the city's traditional dependence on tourism.
sentences.chinese: …这个城市对旅游业的传统依赖。

detailed_translations.english: when you depend on the help and support of someone or something else in order to exist or be successful

name: deodorant
trans: n. (尤指去除体臭的)除臭剂

sentences.english: But in 2002, researchers at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center in Seattle conducted a study to address this rumor—and found no link between deodorant or antiperspirant and breast cancer.
sentences.chinese: 在2002年，西雅图的费雷德哈钦森癌症中心进行了一项研究，该研究结果表明除臭剂或止汗剂与乳腺癌没有关系，从而澄清了这一谣言。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance that you put on the skin under your arms to stop you from smelling bad

name: dental
trans: adj. 牙齿的，牙的；牙科的
n. 齿音

sentences.english: Good oral hygiene and regular dental care are important, whatever your age.
sentences.chinese: 无论年龄大小，良好的口腔卫生和定期的牙齿保健都非常重要。

detailed_translations.english: relating to your teeth

name: dent
trans: n. 凹痕；削弱；减少；[机械学]齿
vi. 产生凹陷；凹进去；削减

sentences.english: Eight years of effort have hardly put a dent in drug trafficking.
sentences.chinese: 八年的努力几乎没有减少贩毒活动。

detailed_translations.english: a hollow area in the surface of something, usually made by something hitting it
if you dent something, or if it dents, you hit or press it so that its surface is bent inwards

name: dense
trans: adj. 浓厚的；稠密的；愚钝的

sentences.english: a dense rurally-based population
sentences.chinese: 居住在乡村的密集人口

sentences.english: dense fog/smoke/fumes
sentences.chinese: 浓雾 / 烟；浓烈的气体

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of people, things, plants, etc. with little space between them

name: denounce
trans: vt. 谴责；告发；公然抨击；通告废除

sentences.english: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
sentences.chinese: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

sentences.english: She denounced him to the police.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方告发了他。

detailed_translations.english: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

name: denote
trans: vt. 表示，指示

sentences.english: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
sentences.chinese: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

detailed_translations.english: to mean something

name: Denmark
trans: n. 丹麦（欧洲国家）

sentences.english: They tried to chart the sea area between Norway and Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 他们企图绘制挪威与丹麦之间的海域图。

sentences.english: I think they should be careful about that, but I applaud them for taking up the mantle out there in Denmark.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他们应该注意那一点，但是我赞赏他们为填补丹麦在这方面的空白所作出的贡献。

sentences.english: If it does, then the happiest countries in 2011 are likely to be rich countries like Denmark and Switzerland.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以的话，那么在2011年最幸福的国家可能会是像丹麦和瑞士这样富有的国家。

name: denim
trans: n. 坚韧的斜纹粗棉布, 牛仔布

detailed_translations.chinese: 斜纹粗棉布，丁尼布；劳动布
detailed_translations.english: a type of strong cotton cloth used especially to make  jean s

name: demystify
trans: vt. 使非神秘化

name: demote
trans: vt. 使降职；使降级

sentences.english: The sergeant was demoted to private.
sentences.chinese: 这名中士被降为列兵。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone’s rank or position lower or less important

name: demoralize
trans: v. 使士气低落；使失去斗志

sentences.english: Clearly, one of the objectives is to demoralize the enemy troops in any way they can.
sentences.chinese: 很清楚，目的之一是他们想尽一切办法瓦解敌军的士气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使道德败坏；使堕落；使士气低落
detailed_translations.english: If something demoralizes someone, it makes them lose so much confidence in what they are doing that they want to give up

name: demonstration
trans: n. 示范；表达；实证；示威游行

sentences.english: Supporters staged a demonstration outside the US embassy.
sentences.chinese: 支持者在美国大使馆外举行了示威游行。

sentences.english: Police opened fire on a peaceful demonstration.
sentences.chinese: 警察朝和平示威的人群开了枪。

detailed_translations.english: an event at which a large group of people meet to protest or to support something in public

name: demonstrate
trans: vt. 证明；演示；示范
vi. 示威

sentences.english: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

sentences.english: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
sentences.chinese: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说明， 论证； 表露
detailed_translations.english: to show or prove something clearly

name: demon
trans: n. 魔鬼；精力充沛的人；恶魔；邪恶的事物

sentences.english: He was speeding down the motorway as if pursued by a demon.
sentences.chinese: 他在高速公路上飞速行驶，就像有魔鬼在追赶他似的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恶魔；魔鬼；精力充沛的人；邪恶的事物
detailed_translations.english: an evil  spirit  or force

name: demolition
trans: n. 毁坏,破坏;拆毁

sentences.english: The project required the total demolition of the old bridge.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程要求那座旧桥的彻底拆除。

detailed_translations.english: The demolition of a structure, for example, a building, is the act of deliberately destroying it, often in order to build something else in its place

name: demographics
trans: n. 人口特征

name: democracy
trans: n. 民主国家；民主；民主制

sentences.english: a return to democracy after 16 years of military rule
sentences.chinese: 16年军人统治后民主制度的恢复

detailed_translations.english: a system of government in which every citizen in the country can vote to elect its government officials

name: demise
trans: n. 死亡，终止；传位；转让
vt. 遗赠；禅让

sentences.english: the mystery surrounding Elena’s untimely demise
sentences.chinese: 埃琳娜猝然早逝之谜

detailed_translations.english: the end of something that used to exist

name: demeanor
trans: n. 行为；举止；风度

sentences.english: If you know your cat well you will be able to tell the difference in his demeanor.
sentences.chinese: 如果你足够了解你的猫咪，那你应该能够分辨它行为上的不同。

sentences.english: She is acutely aware of the discrepancy between her inner state and her public demeanor.
sentences.chinese: 她很敏锐地意识到自己内心状态和公众行为之间的不同。

sentences.english: Your walk and posture and general physical demeanor before you talk to any potential one night stands is just as important, if not moreso.
sentences.chinese: 在你寻找任何潜在的一夜情之前，你走路的姿势和行为举止都非常重要，不然的话就需要更多的信心。

name: demean
trans: vt. 贬低...的身分；举止

sentences.english: Some groups say that pornography demeans women and incites rape.
sentences.chinese: 一些组织声称色情作品贬低妇女，并引发强奸案。

detailed_translations.english: To demean someone or something means to make people have less respect for them

name: demarcate
trans: vt. 定…的界线;区分

sentences.english: A special UN commission was formed to demarcate the border.
sentences.chinese: 一个特别联合国委员会被设立以期划定边界。

detailed_translations.english: If you demarcate something, you establish its boundaries or limits

name: delve
trans: v.（在手提包、容器等中）翻找；探究，钻研

sentences.english: Tormented by her ignorance, Jenny delves into her mother's past.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮为自己不了解真相而痛苦，她开始深入调查母亲的过去。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find more information about someone or something

name: delusion
trans: n. 错觉；幻想；迷惑，欺骗

sentences.english: I was under the delusion that he intended to marry me.
sentences.chinese: 我有一种错觉，他要娶我。

detailed_translations.english: a false belief about yourself or the situation you are in

name: delphis
trans: n. 海豚

name: delirious
trans: adj. 精神混乱的 非常激动的

sentences.english: I was delirious and blacked out several times.
sentences.chinese: 我当时神志不清，几次昏过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发狂的；神志昏迷的；精神错乱的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is delirious is unable to think or speak in a sensible and reasonable way, usually because they are very ill and have a fever

name: delicate
trans: adj. 微妙的；易碎的；清淡可口的；柔和的；精美的，雅致的；纤弱的

sentences.english: his delicate hands
sentences.chinese: 他纤细的手

sentences.english: delicate hand-cut glass
sentences.chinese: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃

sentences.english: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
sentences.chinese: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

detailed_translations.english: small and having a beautiful shape or appearance

name: delicacy
trans: n. 精致, 精美;娇嫩 精美的食物 棘手；微妙 对…感到棘手

sentences.english: Snails are considered a delicacy in France.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，蜗牛被认为是一种珍贵的美食。

detailed_translations.chinese: 美味；佳肴；微妙；精密；精美；敏锐，敏感；世故，圆滑
detailed_translations.english: something good to eat that is expensive or rare

name: deleterious
trans: adj. 有害的

sentences.english: the deleterious effects of smoking
sentences.chinese: 吸烟的害处

detailed_translations.english: damaging or harmful

name: deject
trans: vt. 使…沮丧；使…灰心
adj. 沮丧的；气馁的

name: deja vu
trans: 似曾相识的感觉；[心]记忆幻觉

name: degrade
trans: v. 降格；使屈辱；贬低；退化；降解

sentences.english: a movie that degrades women
sentences.chinese: 贬损女性的影片

sentences.english: How can you degrade yourself by writing such trash?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能写这种垃圾作品来自贬身份呢？

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone without respect and make them lose respect for themselves

name: degradation
trans: n. 下降,降低;降级 堕落;丢脸 陵削,剥蚀 革除神职

sentences.english: ...air pollution, traffic congestion, and the steady degradation of our quality of life.
sentences.chinese: …空气污染、交通阻塞以及我们生活质量的持续恶化。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something changes to a worse condition

name: defy
trans: vt. 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空；经受住；顶住；抗住
n. 挑战；对抗

sentences.english: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空
detailed_translations.english: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way

name: defunct
trans: adj. 死的；不能使用的；非现存的；失效的
n. 死者

sentences.english: the now-defunct nuclear reactor
sentences.chinese: 现已废弃的核反应堆

detailed_translations.english: not existing any more, or not useful any more

name: defile
trans: vt. 污损，弄脏；染污
n. 狭谷；隘路

sentences.english: Hallam’s tomb had been defiled and looted.
sentences.chinese: 哈勒姆的坟墓遭到了亵渎和洗劫。

detailed_translations.english: to make something less pure and good, especially by showing no respect

name: defection
trans: n. 背叛；变节；缺点；脱党

name: defect
trans: n. 缺点，缺陷；不足之处
vi. 叛变；变节

sentences.english: All the cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。

sentences.english: a genetic defect
sentences.chinese: 遗传缺陷

detailed_translations.english: a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect
to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

name: defamation
trans: n. 诽谤, 中伤

sentences.english: He sued the newspaper for defamation of character .
sentences.chinese: 他起诉那家报纸诽谤人格。

detailed_translations.english: the act of defaming someone

name: defacto
trans: adj. （拉）事实上的；实际上的
adv. （拉）事实上

name: deed
trans: n. 行动；证书；[法]契据
vt. 立契转让

sentences.english: After the morning’s good deeds he deserved a rest.
sentences.chinese: 上午做了好事之后，他理应休息一下。

detailed_translations.english: a hard dry type of bread in small flat shapes, that is often eaten with cheese

vi. 爆裂；破裂
n. 裂缝，缝隙；噼啪声

sentences.chinese: 不要把沸水倒进这个玻璃杯里，否则它会破裂的。

a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

sentences.english: And on that bed there is a granny, a snoring granny on a cozy bed in a napping house, where everyone is sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 那张床上有一位老奶奶，在那打瞌睡的房子里，一个打着鼾奶奶睡在舒适的床上，在那里每个人都在睡觉。

vt. 向…献殷勤；设法获得；招致（失败、危险等）

sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

if two or more facts, ideas etc correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other

sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.chinese: 每组包含一对眼睛，拥有复杂的晶状体、视网膜、虹膜和角膜，却没有一个中枢神经系统，科学家们并不确定它们如何处理所视图像。

sentences.chinese: 在所有器官中，最常受到移植的是心脏、肾脏、肺、肝脏、胰腺脏、小肠和角膜。

sentences.chinese: 会谈在友好的气氛中进行。

sentences.chinese: 他说他来做这份工作，给他几个铜板就行。

sentences.english: His hair has reverted back to its original copper hue.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发恢复到了原来的铜色。

sentences.english: That's me, the copilot, and one of the air stewardesses.
sentences.chinese: 那是我、副驾驶员还有我们的一名女乘务员。

sentences.english: That's me, the copilot, and one of the air stewardesses is a recording.
sentences.chinese: 那是我、 副驾驶员还有我们的一名女乘务员。

adj. 同等的；等位的；(大学)男女分院制的

sentences.chinese: 颜色协调的包和饰品使全套服装的颜色搭配齐全了。

name: coo

vt. 咕咕地叫；轻轻地说

sentences.chinese: 蒸发器有助于冷却空气，冷凝器帮助准备冷却过程中的制冷剂，压缩机有助于制冷剂在它们之间移动来回。

sentences.english: agricultural commodities

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

sentences.chinese: 该报获得了“英国新闻奖”的高度褒奖。
