sentences.english: He has not ventured outside his tiny house for years because his wife is in a coma, and he does not want her to wake up and find him gone.
sentences.chinese: 多年来他都没有走出自己的小房子出去冒险，因为他的妻子一直昏迷着，他不希望妻子醒来的时候发现自己已经离开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: （因严重疾病或重伤引起的）昏迷

name: colossal
trans: adj. 巨大的；异常的，非常的

sentences.english: a colossal statue of the King
sentences.chinese: 国王的巨大雕像

sentences.english: This whole holiday was a colossal waste of money.
sentences.chinese: 这次度假浪费了大量的钱财。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is extremely large

name: colonial
trans: n. 殖民地居民
adj. 殖民地的，殖民的

sentences.english: the struggle against colonial rule
sentences.chinese: 反抗殖民统治的斗争

sentences.english: Britain was the largest colonial power .
sentences.chinese: 英国曾是最大的殖民强国。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a country that controls and rules other countries, usually ones that are far away

name: colonel
trans: n. 陆军上校

sentences.english: Nothing remained of the colonel.
sentences.chinese: 上校身后毫无遗物。

sentences.english: The captain jumped several grades and now was a colonel.
sentences.chinese: 这名上尉一连跳过了好几级，现在是上校了。

sentences.english: What if they go on to behave as murderously as the colonel and his paid killers?
sentences.chinese: 如果他们像他们的是上校和他的杀手们一样继续表现为杀气腾腾的又该怎么办？

detailed_translations.english: a high rank in the army, Marines, or the US air force, or someone who has this rank

name: colon
trans: n. [解剖学]结肠；冒号（用于引语、说明、例证等之前）；科郎（哥斯达黎加货币单位）

sentences.english: In the U.S., there are 60,000 deaths a year from colon cancer.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，每年有６万人死于结肠癌。

detailed_translations.chinese: [解剖] 结肠；冒号（用于引语、说明、例证等之前）；科郎（哥斯达黎加货币单位）
detailed_translations.english: the lower part of the  bowels  , in which food is changed into waste matter

name: colloquial
trans: adj. 口语的, 会话的

sentences.english: ...a colloquial expression.
sentences.chinese: …一个口语表达法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 白话的；通俗的；口语体的
detailed_translations.english: language or words that are colloquial are used mainly in informal conversations rather than in writing or formal speech

name: collective
trans: adj. 集体的, 共同的, 共有的

sentences.english: a collective decision made by all board members
sentences.chinese: 董事会所有成员作出的集体决定

sentences.english: our collective responsibility for the environment
sentences.chinese: 我们对环境的共同责任

detailed_translations.english: shared or made by every member of a group or society

name: collateral
trans: n. 附属担保品
adj. 相关的

sentences.english: There may be collateral benefits to the scheme.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划可能有附带的益处。

detailed_translations.english: relating to something or happening as a result of it, but not as important

detailed_translations.chinese: 抵押品；[法] 担保品；旁系亲属
detailed_translations.english: property or other goods that you promise to give someone if you cannot pay back the money they lend you

name: collar
trans: n. 衣领；颈圈
vt. 给…上领子；给…套上颈圈；[口]抓住

sentences.english: He grabbed me by the collar.
sentences.chinese: 他抓住我的衣领。

sentences.english: He loosened his collar and tie .
sentences.chinese: 他松开了领子和领带。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a shirt, coat etc that fits around your neck, and is usually folded over

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓住；给…上领子；给…套上颈圈
detailed_translations.english: to catch someone and hold them so that they cannot escape

name: collaborate
trans: vi. 合作 勾结叛国
n. 协作者,合作者;勾结者

sentences.english: Much later he collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production.
sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

detailed_translations.english: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

name: col
trans: n. 山坳；出口；峡路

name: coke
trans: n. 焦炭；可卡因
vi. 焦化

sentences.english: ...a coke-burning stove.
sentences.chinese: …一个烧焦炭的炉子。

detailed_translations.english: the drink Coca-Cola, or a bottle, can, or glass of this drink

name: coincide
trans: vi. 一致，符合；同时发生

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: coherent
trans: adj. 连贯的，一致的；凝聚性的；明了的；清晰的；互相偶合的；粘在一起的

sentences.english: The three years of the course are planned as a coherent whole.
sentences.chinese: 这三年的课程是作为连贯的整体来安排的。

sentences.english: a coherent account of the incident
sentences.chinese: 对该事件条理分明的陈述

sentences.english: He's so calm when he answers questions in interviews. I wish I could be that coherent.
sentences.chinese: 他如此镇定地回答了访谈中的问题。我希望我也能那样有条不紊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一致的，协调的；(话语等)条理清楚的
detailed_translations.english: if a piece of writing, set of ideas etc is coherent, it is easy to understand because it is clear and reasonable

name: cognitive
trans: adj. 认识的；认知的；有认识力的

sentences.english: cognitive psychology
sentences.chinese: 认知心理学

detailed_translations.english: related to the process of knowing, understanding, and learning something

name: cognition
trans: n. 认识；认识力；认知

sentences.english: the regions of the brain that are responsible for memory and cognition
sentences.chinese: 大脑主管记忆与认知的区域

detailed_translations.english: the process of knowing, understanding, and learning something

name: codify
trans: vt. 编纂；将...编成法典；编成法典

sentences.english: The latest draft of the agreement codifies the panel's decision.
sentences.chinese: 该协议的最新草案将专家小组的决定编篡成了法规条款。

detailed_translations.chinese: 编纂；将编成法典；编成法典
detailed_translations.english: to arrange laws, principles, facts etc in a system

name: cockroach
trans: n. 蟑螂

sentences.english: He stumbled to the door and found a six-foot cockroach standing there.
sentences.chinese: 他跌跌撞撞地去打开门，见到一只六英尺高的蟑螂站在那儿！

sentences.english: He saw the cockroach scurry under it with the gecko far behind struggling to go under.
sentences.chinese: 蟑螂急匆匆的从冰箱底下跑过去，壁虎在后面也努力的想要钻过去。

sentences.english: Competitions include Skating Around Poverty and Welfare Hurdles. Mascots include a cockroach and a rat.
sentences.chinese: 比赛项目包括贫穷和福利绕障碍滑冰，吉祥物是蟑螂和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: a large black or brown insect that lives in dirty houses, especially if they are warm and there is food to eat

name: cockpit
trans: n. (飞机, 小船或赛艇的)驾驶室 斗鸡场

name: cocaine
trans: n. [药]可卡因

sentences.english: To investigate, his team injected cocaine, capsaicin or both at once into the abdomens of several groups of about 30 mice.
sentences.chinese: 他的团队将辣椒素或可卡因中的一种，或同时将两种注射进几组老鼠的腹部，每组约30只。

sentences.english: Then the researchers repeated the experiment, but this time they injected rats with a dose of cocaine or morphine on one side and with a neutral saline solution on the other.
sentences.chinese: 然后，研究人员重复这项实验，但是这次他们给一边的小白鼠注射小剂量的可卡因或吗啡，而另一边注射中性盐水。

detailed_translations.english: a drug, usually in the form of a white powder, that is taken illegally for pleasure or used in some medical situations to prevent pain

name: cobra
trans: n. 眼镜蛇；（澳）头颅

sentences.english: A set of changes in the mongoose’s receptor makes it resemble the cobra’s own resistant receptor.
sentences.chinese: 猫鼬受体的一系列变化使得它们类似于眼镜蛇自己的抗毒液性受体。

sentences.english: Sometimes an attacking mongoose is bitten, but it has another line of defense against the venom — its acetylcholine receptor has also evolved so that the cobra neurotoxin cannot bind to it.
sentences.chinese: 有时猫鼬也会被咬到，但它还有除了反应之外的第二种防御毒液的方式——它的乙酰胆碱受体同样进化到了不怕眼镜蛇神经毒素的地步。

sentences.english: However, when cornered, these snakes will raise their heads, sometimes with a third of their body off the ground, spread their cobra-like neck-flap, open their black mouths and hiss.
sentences.chinese: 但是，当被逼到角落时，这些蛇就会抬起头部，有时会有三分之一脱离地面，舒展开它们眼镜蛇般的脖颈，打开黑色的嘴发出嘶嘶的声音。

detailed_translations.english: a poisonous African or Asian snake that can spread the skin of its neck to make itself look bigger

name: coaxial
trans: adj. 同轴的，共轴的

name: coax
trans: vt. 哄诱；慢慢将…弄好；哄
vi. 哄骗；劝诱

sentences.english: ‘Please, Vic, come with us,’ Nancy coaxed.
sentences.chinese: “求你了，维克，跟我们一起去吧。”南希哄劝道。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them in a kind, gentle, and patient way

name: coattail
trans: n. 男士上衣后摆；燕尾服的燕尾

name: coaster
trans: n. 沿岸贸易船；杯托，小托盘；雪橇

detailed_translations.chinese: 沿岸贸易船；杯托，小托盘；雪橇
detailed_translations.english: A coaster is a small mat that you put underneath a glass or cup to protect the surface of a table

name: coastal
trans: adj. 海岸的；沿海的

sentences.english: the coastal waters of Britain
sentences.chinese: 英国的近海水域

sentences.english: the coastal path
sentences.chinese: 海滨小道

detailed_translations.english: in the sea or on the land near the coast

name: coarsely
trans: adv. 鄙俗地；粗俗地；粗糙地

name: coal
trans: n. 煤；木炭
vt. 烧成炭；供应煤
vi. 加煤；装煤

sentences.english: Put some coal on the fire.
sentences.chinese: 往火里加点煤。

sentences.english: the coal mining industry
sentences.chinese: 采煤业

sentences.english: a lump of coal
sentences.chinese: 一块煤

sentences.english: Red hot coals glowed in the grate.
sentences.chinese: 炽热火红的煤块在炉栅里面发着光。

detailed_translations.english: a hard black mineral which is dug out of the ground and burnt to produce heat

name: clutter
trans: n. 杂乱，混乱
vt. 使凌乱；胡乱地填满

sentences.english: Could you get rid of some of that clutter in your bedroom?
sentences.chinese: 你能把你卧室那些杂物清理掉一些吗？

detailed_translations.english: a large number of things that are scattered somewhere in an untidy way
to cover or fill a space or room with too many things, so that it looks very untidy

name: clownery
trans: n. 滑稽；粗鲁

name: closure
trans: n. 关闭；终止，结束
vt. 使终止

sentences.english: Several military bases are threatened with closure .
sentences.chinese: 几处军事基地面临关闭。

detailed_translations.english: when a factory, school, hospital etc has to close permanently

name: close-up
trans: n. 特写镜头；细致的观察

name: closet
trans: n. 壁橱；议事室，密室；小房间
adj. 秘密的，私下的；空谈的

sentences.english: a closet full of beautiful clothes
sentences.chinese: 满是漂亮衣服的壁橱

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁橱；议事室，密室；小房间
detailed_translations.english: a cupboard built into the wall of a room from the floor to the ceiling
to shut someone in a room away from other people in order to discuss something private, to be alone etc

name: clog
trans: v. 阻塞；障碍
n. 障碍；木底鞋

sentences.english: tourists whose cars clog the roads each summer
sentences.chinese: 每年夏天开着汽车堵塞道路的游客

detailed_translations.english: to block something or become blocked
a shoe made of wood with a leather top that covers the front of your foot but not your heel

name: cloak
trans: n. 斗蓬；宽大外衣；托词
vt. 遮掩；隐匿

sentences.english: She threw off her cloak with an abandoned gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她以一种放纵的姿势脱掉了斗篷。

detailed_translations.english: a warm piece of clothing like a coat without sleeves that hangs loosely from your shoulders
to deliberately hide facts, feelings etc so that people do not see or understand them – used especially in news reports

name: clitoris
trans: n. [解]阴蒂；[解]阴核

name: clitoral
trans: adj. 阴核的；阴蒂的

name: clipboard
trans: n. 付有纸夹的笔记板；剪贴板

name: cling
trans: vi. 紧贴；附着；依恋；坚持
n. 紧抓；紧贴

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: climax
trans: n. 高潮；顶点；层进法；极点

sentences.english: The festival reaches its climax with the traditional boat-burning ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 传统的烧船仪式将节庆活动推向了高潮。

sentences.english: the climax of his naval career
sentences.chinese: 他海军生涯的巅峰

detailed_translations.english: the most exciting or important part of a story or experience, which usually comes near the end

name: cliche
trans: n. 陈词滥调；铅版；陈腐思想
adj. 陈腐的

sentences.english: His article is stuffed with cliche.
sentences.chinese: 他的文章中满是一些陈词滥调。

sentences.english: A cliche, I know, and until then I had not grasped what that feels like.
sentences.chinese: 我知道过于陈词滥调，但是我知道我已经抓不住那种感觉了。

sentences.english: Enjoy your life when you're young – it's a true cliche that you only have your youth once – but work harder than most people think you should.
sentences.chinese: 当你年轻时，享受你的生活— 因为青春只有一次，这是陈词滥调— 但别忘了要比别人想象的更努力工作。

name: clerical
trans: adj. 牧师的；办事员的；书记的
n. 牧师

name: clearance
trans: n. 净空, 余隙 许可, 批准 (银行)票据交换, 清算

sentences.english: She’ll race if she gets medical clearance from her doctor.
sentences.chinese: 如果取得了医生的许可，她就会参加比赛。

sentences.english: Morris did not have a security clearance .
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯没有安全审查许可。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting official permission or approval for something

name: claw
trans: n. 爪；螯，钳；爪形器具
vi. 用爪抓（或挖）

sentences.english: The cat dug his claws into my leg.
sentences.chinese: 猫的爪子抓进了我的腿中。

sentences.english: lobster claws
sentences.chinese: 龙虾的螯

detailed_translations.english: a sharp curved nail on an animal, bird, or some insects
to tear or pull at something, using claws or your fingers

name: clan
trans: n. 宗族；部落；集团

sentences.english: the Campbell clan
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔家族

sentences.english: warring clans
sentences.chinese: 交战的各氏族

detailed_translations.english: a large group of families who often share the same name

name: clamp
trans: n. 夹子；螺丝钳
t. 夹住；强加；压制

sentences.english: She clamped her hands over her ears.
sentences.chinese: 她用手紧紧地捂住耳朵。

sentences.english: Many openers have a magnet or set of clamps to grip the open lid.
sentences.chinese: 许多开启器是用磁铁或夹具来夹紧要开启的盖子。

detailed_translations.english: to put or hold something in a position so that it cannot move
a piece of equipment for holding things together

name: clammy
trans: adj. 湿粘的；湿冷的（形容词比较级clammier，形容词最高级clammiest，名词clamminess，副词clammily）

sentences.english: Get your clammy hands off me!
sentences.chinese: 把你又湿又黏的手拿开，别碰我！

detailed_translations.english: feeling unpleasantly wet, cold, and sticky

name: clad
trans: adj. 穿…衣服的；被…覆盖的；被…笼罩的

sentences.english: an armour-clad ship
sentences.chinese: 装甲舰

detailed_translations.english: wearing a particular kind of clothing

detailed_translations.chinese: 在金属外覆以另一种金属
穿衣（clothe的过去式和过去分词）

name: civil
trans: adj. 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的

sentences.english: They were married in a civil ceremony in May.
sentences.chinese: 他们在五月份举行了世俗婚礼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公民的；民间的；文职的；有礼貌的；根据民法的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the people who live in a country

name: cite
trans: vt. 引用；传讯；想起；表彰

sentences.english: The judge cited a 1956 Supreme Court ruling in her decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在她的判决中引用了1956年最高法院的一项裁决。

sentences.english: The passage cited above is from a Robert Frost poem.
sentences.chinese: 以上的引文出自罗伯特•弗罗斯特的一首诗。

sentences.english: She was cited in the divorce proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 她在离婚诉讼中被传唤。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
detailed_translations.english: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

name: citation
trans: n. 引用，引证；传票；褒扬

sentences.english: The essay begins with a citation from ‘Hamlet’.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章开头引用了《哈姆雷特》中的一句话。

detailed_translations.english: a line taken from a book, speech etc

name: circumvent
trans: vt. 设法克服或避免(某事物);回避

sentences.english: The company opened an account abroad, in order to circumvent the tax laws.
sentences.chinese: 为规避税法，这家公司在国外开设了账户。

detailed_translations.english: to avoid a problem or rule that restricts you, especially in a clever or dishonest way – used to show disapproval

name: circumspect
trans: adj. 谨慎小心的,周到的

sentences.english: The banks should have been more circumspect in their dealings.
sentences.chinese: 银行在交易时应更加谨慎。

detailed_translations.english: If you are circumspect, you are cautious in what you do and say and do not take risks

name: circumcise
trans: vt. 〈医〉割除…包皮(由于宗教或健康理由)

name: circuit
trans: n. 巡回；线路；环形；电路；回路
v. 巡回；绕 ... 环形

sentences.english: We did a circuit of the old city.
sentences.chinese: 我们绕着老城走了一圈。

detailed_translations.english: a path that forms a circle around an area, or a journey along this path

name: circadian
trans: adj. 昼夜节奏的,生理节奏的 (即大约每天一次的)

sentences.english: the body’s circadian rhythm
sentences.chinese: 人体的生理节奏

detailed_translations.chinese: 昼夜节律的,生理节奏的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a period of 24 hours, used especially when talking about changes in people’s bodies

name: cinnamon
trans: n. 肉桂；肉桂树；肉桂色
adj. 肉桂色；黄褐色的

name: cinder
trans: n. 煤渣；灰烬
vt. 用煤渣等铺

sentences.english: a cold hearth full of cinders
sentences.chinese: 冰冷的炉床，里面全是炭渣

sentences.english: The cake was burnt to a cinder (= completely burnt ) .
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕完全烤煳了。

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of burnt wood, coal etc

name: cinch
trans: n. (马的)肚带；容易做的事情；必然发生的事情
v. 系肚带；确保

name: cigar
trans: n. 雪茄

sentences.english: He was smoking a big cigar.
sentences.chinese: 他在抽一只大雪茄。

detailed_translations.english: a thick tube-shaped thing that people smoke, and which is made from tobacco leaves that have been rolled up

name: cider

detailed_translations.chinese: 铬，铬合金；铬黄；谷歌浏览器

sentences.chinese: 人们开始对霍乱感到惊恐起来。

sentences.chinese: 你根本不喜欢唱歌，但是你还是加入了唱诗班。到底你想干什么？

sentences.chinese: 这些物质有时可与其他化学品化合，例如氯。

sentences.chinese: 仅用凿子，电锯和锤子这些工具，这位32岁的男子举家搬到了位于威尔士的一个山坡，并开始继续挖凿（房子）。

name: chimp

sentences.english: Incapable of moral clarity, he could never quite admit to himself that he was a charlatan and that his scheme was an impossible fiasco.
sentences.chinese: 由于缺乏明确的道德准则，他从来不承认自己是一个江湖骗子以及他的计划是个彻底的失败品。

sentences.english: If you are too trusting of the invisible, then you buy that $89 ebook that comes with the promise of instant riches, or you sign up for ear candling, or invest time and money with a charlatan.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对这些无形的事物相当信任，那么你可能会花89美元买一个承诺给你一夜暴富的电子书，或报名参加一次耳烛疗法，或跟一个江湖郎中花费你的时间和金钱。

sentences.english: When humans first started building things, determining whether they would work as planned was mostly a matter of trial and error. Build a bridge, drive a chariot across it, and see if it collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 一开始人类建造房屋时,决定房屋是否合格的方法是去试一下,看看有什么不妥的地方.建成一座桥,把辆战车开上面跑一跑,看看桥会不会倒.

sentences.english: I drove my chariot to the vineyard gate, and there I saw the twoKings.

name: bankrupt

sentences.english: The job is mainly administrative.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作主要是行政方面的。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the work of managing a company or organization

name: adjourn
trans: vi. 休会；延期；换地方
vt. 推迟；使…中止；使…延期

sentences.english: The rest of us adjourned to a nearby pub for some refreshments.
sentences.chinese: 我们其他人转移阵地，去了附近酒吧吃点心。

detailed_translations.english: to finish an activity and go somewhere – often used humorously

name: adjacent
trans: adj. 邻近的，毗连的

sentences.english: We stayed in adjacent rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在毗连的房间里。

sentences.english: the building adjacent to the library
sentences.chinese: 紧挨着图书馆的建筑

detailed_translations.english: (of an area, a building, a room, etc.) next to or near sth

name: adhesive
trans: n. 粘合剂；胶黏剂
adj. 带粘性的；粘着的

sentences.english: waterproof adhesive
sentences.chinese: 防水黏合剂

sentences.english: ...adhesive tape.
sentences.chinese: …胶布。

detailed_translations.english: a substance such as glue that you use to stick two things together
An adhesive substance is able to stick firmly to something else

name: additionally
trans: adv. 加之,又

sentences.english: A new contract is in place. Additionally, staff will be offered a bonus scheme.
sentences.chinese: 新合同已经准备就绪。 除此之外，还将给员工设立一个奖金计划。

detailed_translations.english: in addition

name: adamancy
trans: n. 坚硬；坚强；固执

name: acute
trans: adj. 严重的；敏锐的；急性的；剧烈的

sentences.english: Young children have a particularly acute sense of smell.
sentences.chinese: 幼儿的嗅觉特别灵敏。

detailed_translations.english: acute senses such as hearing, taste, touch etc are very good and sensitive

name: acronym
trans: n. 首字母缩略词

sentences.english: Every new acronym I hear turns out to be another dirty trick designed to allow rich countries to go on with business as usual.
sentences.chinese: 我所听到的每个新缩写词原来都是另一个鬼把戏，旨在允许富裕国家照常进行一切活动。

sentences.english: Al is considered to be one of the first high profile commercial artists and his initials are also conveniently the acronym of the club.
sentences.chinese: 铝被认为是第一个高调的商业艺术家之一，他的首字母是那么方便了俱乐部的首字母缩写。

detailed_translations.english: a word made up from the first letters of the name of something such as an organization. For example, NATO is an acronym for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

name: acrobat
trans: n. 杂技演员，特技演员；随机应变者；翻云覆雨者，善变者

sentences.english: The acrobat balanced himself on the high rope.
sentences.chinese: 杂技演员在高绳上保持平衡。

sentences.english: Leggy models and a child acrobat wait offstage at a pop music concert in Ulaanbaatar.
sentences.chinese: 乌兰巴托的一场流行音乐会会场外，一群美腿模特和一位少年杂技演员正在等待入场。

sentences.english: He also added a crotch belt, a unicycle-like seat and an acrobat’s trapeze for a footrest; all help to keep the operator in optimal flying position.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他还添加了三叉腰带、独轮车式车座、还有一个杂技演员所用的秋千，用来放脚。 所有这些装置，都能够帮助操作者保持良好的飞行位置。

detailed_translations.english: someone who entertains people by doing difficult physical actions such as walking on their hands or balancing on a high rope, especially at a  circus

name: acme
trans: n. 顶点，极点；最高点

sentences.english: the acme of perfection
sentences.chinese: 尽善尽美

detailed_translations.english: the best and highest level of something

name: ace
trans: n. 幺点；好手；高手；发球得分
adj. 一流的；卓越的 vt. 发球得分；考试中取得好成绩

sentences.english: Agassi believed he had served an ace at 5-3 (40-30) in the deciding set.
sentences.chinese: 阿加西认为他在决胜盘中5-3(40-30)时曾发出过一记Ace球。

sentences.english: ...ace horror-film producer Lawrence Woolsey.
sentences.chinese: …一流的恐怖片制片人劳伦斯·伍希。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幺点；直接得分的发球；佼佼者；（俚）最好的朋友
detailed_translations.english: a first shot in tennis or  volleyball  which is hit so well that your opponent cannot reach the ball and you win the point
Ace is also an adjective

name: accost
trans: v. 搭话；搭讪

sentences.english: He was accosted by four youths and forced to give them all his money.
sentences.chinese: 四个少年走上前来和他搭讪，逼迫他交出身上所有的钱。

name: accordion
trans: n. 手风琴
adj. 可折叠的

sentences.english: But my fancy accordion might as well have been a cardboard box that afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 但是那天下午，我别致的手风琴好像变成了纸板盒。

sentences.english: All at once I pictured my own father, patiently enduring my nightly accordion practice sessions though he must have yearned for peace and quiet after his long days at the pizza factory.
sentences.chinese: 突然，我想起了我的父亲。 虽然他在比萨厂呆了一整天后一定非常渴望清静，但还是耐心地忍受着我每天晚上练习手风琴的那段时间。

sentences.english: So you may be saying to yourself, I have to sign up right now for Swahili and calculus and accordion lessons before my brain withers away!
sentences.chinese: 你或许因此对自己说，趁着我的大脑还没退化，赶紧报名学习史瓦西里文和微积分，还有手风琴班吧！

detailed_translations.english: a musical instrument like a large box that you hold in both hands. You play it by pressing the sides together and pulling them out again, while you push buttons and  key s  .

name: accomplice
trans: n. 从犯, 帮凶, 同谋

sentences.english: Witnesses said the gunman immediately ran to a motorcycle being ridden by an accomplice.
sentences.chinese: 证人们说该枪手立即向由一名同犯驾驶的摩托车跑去。

detailed_translations.english: a person who helps someone such as a criminal to do something wrong

name: accommodate
trans: vt. 容纳；向…提供住处；使适应, 顺应

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: acclimate
trans: v. 使适应新环境,使服水土 服水土,适应

sentences.english: Several things can be done to help the snake acclimate.
sentences.chinese: 可以通过几件事帮助这些蛇去适应新环境。

sentences.english: Some earth plants that I will try to acclimate to the moon.
sentences.chinese: 我将设法使一些地球植物适应月球的环境。

detailed_translations.english: Acclimate means the same as

name: accessible
trans: adj. 可得到的；易接近的；可进入的；易受影响的；易理解的

sentences.english: The island is only accessible by boat.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛只有坐船才能到。

sentences.english: There is a church which is easily accessible from my home.
sentences.chinese: 有座教堂离我家很近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易接近的；可进入的；可理解的
detailed_translations.english: a place, building, or object that is accessible is easy to reach or get into

name: accepted
trans: adj. 公认的；已承兑的；可接受的；录取的
v. 接受（accept的过去式及过去分词）

name: accentuate
trans: v. 重读；强调；突出

sentences.english: The photograph seemed to accentuate his large nose.
sentences.chinese: 照片似乎突出了他的大鼻子。

detailed_translations.english: to make something more noticeable

name: abysmal
trans: adj. 深不可测的；极坏的；完全的

sentences.english: The reunion was an abysmal failure.
sentences.chinese: 重逢聚会弄得一团糟。

detailed_translations.english: very bad or of bad quality

name: absurd
trans: adj. 荒谬的；可笑的
n. 荒诞；荒诞作品

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

name: abstraction
trans: n. 抽象；抽象概念；心不在焉

sentences.english: He’s always talking in abstractions.
sentences.chinese: 他老是谈抽象的东西。

detailed_translations.english: a general idea about a type of situation, thing, or person rather than a specific example from real life

name: abstinence
trans: n. 节制；禁食；戒酒

sentences.english: ...six months of abstinence.
sentences.chinese: …6个月的禁欲。

detailed_translations.english: the practice of not having something you enjoy, especially alcohol or sex, usually for reasons of religion or health

name: abstention
trans: n. 节制；戒绝；(投票)弃权

sentences.english: The draft law was passed by 134 votes to 19, with 5 abstentions.
sentences.chinese: 该法律草案以134票对19票获得通过，另有5票弃权。

detailed_translations.english: an act of not voting for or against something

name: absorb
trans: vt. 吸收；吸引；承受；理解；使…全神贯注

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: abscond
trans: vi. 逃匿，潜逃；避债

sentences.english: He was ordered to appear the following day, but absconded.
sentences.chinese: 他被传唤于第二天出庭，却逃跑了。

detailed_translations.english: to escape from a place where you are being kept

name: abscess
trans: n. 脓肿；脓疮
vi. 形成脓肿

name: abound
trans: vi. 充满；富于

sentences.english: Rumors of such coordination abound, but as with many rumors, they have no basis in fact.
sentences.chinese: 关于这类协调的谣传很多；但如同许多其他谣传一样，它们没有事实根据。

sentences.english: Finally, offer this closing prayer to the Lord: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 最后，将结束的祷告告诉主：愿在你拥有信仰的时候希望的上帝用快乐与和平充满你的人生，让你在圣灵的力量下富于希望。

name: abide
trans: vt. 忍受，容忍；停留
vi. 持续；停留；忍受

sentences.english: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.english: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.chinese: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

detailed_translations.english: bear, stand

name: abet
trans: vt. 煽动，教唆；支持

name: abdomen
trans: n. 腹部；下腹；腹腔

sentences.english: He went into the hospital to undergo tests for a pain in his abdomen.
sentences.chinese: 他去了医院接受对他的腹部疼痛进行的各项检查。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body between your chest and legs which contains your stomach,  bowel s  etc

name: abate
trans: vt. 减少；减轻；废除
vi. 减轻；失效

sentences.english: We waited for the storm to abate.
sentences.chinese: 我们等风暴减弱。

detailed_translations.english: to become less strong or decrease

name: abandonment
trans: n. 放弃；自暴自弃；放纵

sentences.english: ...memories of her father's complete abandonment of her.
sentences.chinese: …她父亲对她的彻底抛弃的那些记忆。

detailed_translations.english: The abandonment of a place, thing, or person is the act of leaving it permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so

name: abalone
trans: n. 鲍鱼

sentences.english: The highly reflective surface and the abalone shell made this photograph a real challenge to take.
sentences.chinese: 高度反光的表面和鲍鱼壳使这张照片的拍摄成为真正的挑战。

sentences.english: Lighting is everything. The highly reflective surface and the abalone shell made this photograph a real challenge to take.
sentences.chinese: 灯光就是一切。高度反光的表面和鲍鱼壳使这张照片的拍摄成为真正的挑战。

sentences.english: Yeast don't normally do any of those reactions on their own, so Belcher and her students had to engineer them to express genes found in organisms such as the abalone.
sentences.chinese: 酵母通常不会对二氧化碳等做出自我反应，所以贝尔彻和她的学生们必须改造它们来表达类似鲍鱼机体中的那些基因。

detailed_translations.english: a kind of  shellfish  which is used as food and whose shell contains  mother-of-pearl

name: aah
trans: v. 发啧啧声,惊呼 AAHabbr. Armored Artillery Howitzer 装甲...
